The location can‚Äôt be beat.  You are about a 5-minute walk from the parks.  On the negative side, only one elevator was operational, we heard outside noise frequently, the bathroom was very cramped, the hot water was not working at the entire hotel for a good part of one day, and we never had our sheets changed despite calling to request that be done.  I woke up one morning with what looked to be several bug bites, but to be fair, we didn‚Äôt see evidence of bugs in the room.    Check in at the hotel was quick and efficient.  The lobby has ice water and also popcorn for guests.  I believe the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for my birthday weekend and Leo gave excellent customer service. He was very helpful at check-in. This hotel was convenient for our Disney weekend. Summary: The bed was PHENOMENAL! Oh my god, every time I sat on it, I would fall straight to sleep, that‚Äôs how comfortable it was. The location is awesome, literally directly opposite Disneyland. Only reason I did not give a 5 star review is because our room was located on the bottom floor in the back corner, so it was pretty dark and the window was facing a brick wall, and there was an issue with drainage in the shower. However, this is a great hotel if you want something reasonably priced, clean and comfortable for your trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Very convenient location to Disneyland - excellent service and helpfulness from night manage (Charles)

Summary Heading: Noisy Guests and Management Does Nothing
Summary: We stayed here Christmas Eve after a day at Disneyland. This was our third stay here. Check in was smooth and parking was easy. However, the management and security does a very poor job of dealing with loud and obnoxious guests.  At 10pm and all hours of the night my young kids, husband and I were awoken by our neighbors who had their door wide open and were yelling and making loud noises.  We had to call the front desk twice before anyone came and even then the hotel security did basically nothing.  We had a horrible night sleep and all ended up getting sick after. When I spoke with the front desk the next morning I couldn't even get a manager to speak with me and all that got waived was my parking. I was told a manager would call me within the next day or two and ten days
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn‚Äôt find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. Summary Heading: OK if all you're doing is sleeping

Convenient, yes. It doesn't get much closer to the park entrance than this. However, the entire place is completely run down. The room had awful glaring EXTREME fluorescent lighting--my teenagers called them murder lights because it really looked like the atmosphere for a horror movie. Summary: I want to like this place, but after todays experience, I 1000% do not recommend. Long story short, I wasn't going to make the reservation due to the flight situation (which was out of my control) and yet the hotel refused to reimburse the first night stay because I cancelled the day of my reservation. I guess my recommendation - if you book here and are from out of town, be sure you can predict the future and know if your travels will stay in tact, because if not, you will be out hundreds of dollars.

Summary: Grand Legacy at the Park left much to be desired.   PROS: Location is amazing as it made it very easy to return to the hotel for naps (only a 5ish min walk). Staff was friendly. Mini fridge is large and room was dated, but clean.   CONS: Cockroaches. We found two cockroaches in the bathroom over a period of a couple of days. When reported to the front desk, they offered to send someone to kill it but my Husband had already done that. No offer for compensation unfortunately. No continental breakfast (which we already knew about when we booked). Pool is quite small. Bathroom had very little ventilation. Carpet was pulling up and rippled in spots. Parking spots are very tight because everyone has a family-sized vehicle, and the spots seem more suitable for compact vehicles.

Summary: You know a place is clean when you see housekeeping wiping the elevator doors. Not just the buttons. But the entire stainless steel doors from top to bottom. My daughter (11) and I visited for four nights and I was impressed by everything. Rooms are well appointed and clean. Beds were comfy. The pool is a good size and in the center of the parking area so it‚Äôs accessible from all buildings. It was busy but not crowded. You can‚Äôt beat the proximity to Disneyland either. It is literally a five minute walk up Harbor and across the street. I read other reviews where sound in the main building was a problem from the bar/restaurant on the fifth floor. We didn‚Äôt have that issue. We could hear it from our room, but it wasn‚Äôt distracting enough to stop us from sleeping after a busy day
Manager Response: Hey BriE1976  On behalf of our entire staff at Grand Legacy At The Park we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area. Hope to you see you and you family soon.   Thank you,

Summary: Rooms are definitely outdated and need to be renovated asap. If you stay on the 4th floor, be prepared to listen all the parties happening on the roof (The 5th on the Roof restaurant) until 12:30 A.M. Thursday - Sunday, and till 11:00 A.M. remaining week days. Main tower has only one elevator, which takes a toll on your family when coming back from the parks later in the night and conflicting with patrons partying on "The 5th" and crew serving the restaurant (besides those being 'escorted out' by the security team as they were too drunk). Not family friendly. Front desk staffing is friendly and accommodating but maid services/cleaning are inexistent - our room was fully cleaned once out of the 8 nights we spent there, and I had to pick-up towels from the front desk several times
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was in the area and had booked a room somewhere else; when I was disappointed in it, I was looking for other available hotels. Manager Response: Hey Footprints614549,  Thank you for your kind praise of our staff! We do our best to have all departments working as a team to ensure a pleasant stay for each of our guests. We will inform Raymond of your kind words.   Thank you,

Summary: With just a short walk to Disneyland, it was a closer to the main plaza than the Disney Paradise Pier and half the price.    I recommend the Premium rooms, which are at the back of the resort.   Much less noise and a little more room for the four of us at 325 sq. feet.    Our room had a small fridge, microwave, pod coffee maker, twin sinks and a small table.   It never felt cramped as we rushed to get ready or collapsed at the end of the day.   The free wifi was fast and the TV had enough channels to keep the kids happy.   Another kid pleaser is the pool, which is good.  It had a few play sprinklers for the little ones and a hot tub for us sore adults.   I wish I would have visited their bar/lounge on the roof of the building as it has a great view of the nightly fireworks.
Manager Response: Hey Nomad_LA,   Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to share about your recent stay at the Grand Legacy At The Park. Our room faced the Main Street and on Friday and Saturday nights you could hear the dance music either from the restaurant on the roof, or somewhere near- I couldn‚Äôt distinguish. Both my husband and I checked the windows as it was so loud, we thought it was open. The music went well 2am both nights.   2.On our second morning, we realized that one of the kids‚Äô rooms had a broken lock on the door. Even with the deadbolt flipped, you could push on the door slightly and
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel/motel combo is located very close to the Disneyland entry. We had to book a room here at the last minute and the only rooms available were the most basic. Two full-not queen-beds, no chair, table, or room to turn around. If you have a family or plan to eat in the room I'd recommend upgrading if possible. I'd also note the rooms were pretty worn, but clean.  Staff were up front that the rooms would be cleaned only on request "due to covid." That explanation doesn't really hold water as much as the general labor shortage, but with that knowledge we were OK.  Pool area is centrally located, well-maintained, and has two splash areas for little kids. They also maintain a nice collection of pool toys.  My interactions with staff were all positive.  I do think they could use

Summary: We visit Disney often and have consistently used this hotel. We have kids ranging from teens to an infant and this hotel is perfect! It's a super close walk to the park, spacious enough for our family of 6, close restaurants to order late night dinners. I am very particular about hotels and typically choose 4 or 5 star hotels to ensure they are clean but with the Grand Legacy I don't have to spend all the extra cash because it's clean and I feel really comfortable here. The manager is amazing and has accommodated me several times. My only word of warning is that if you have little ones who need to sleep, do not stay in the tower. On weekends the roof top bar is busy so it can get noisy. The outdoor suites are quiet though and works amazing! So far of all the many hotels we have

Summary: My family arrived at the hotel early and dropped off our luggage at the front desk.  A room was available when we dropped off the bags but we were hoping to be placed in the newer part of the building.  We asked if we could possibly be placed in the newer part of the building and they said a room was not available yet in that part of the building..   The clerk at the counter said if we wait till 3 she could get us in to the newer part.   Although we were tired from traveling all day we thought it would be best to wait.  At 3 we arrived just like requested and they said they had only rooms in the older part of the building.  Needless to say I was not happy with them stringing us along.  Just tell us up fro t if you can‚Äôt accommodate our request.    We came as a family of four and
Manager Response: Hey Excursion568746,   Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your recent stay with us. We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Summary: I really really wanted to like this hotel. But it's just 'meh'. It came highly recommended to us, so we excitedly booked for our 5 days at Disneyland. Upon arrival we were told our rooms weren't ready, but they took our luggage and we were able to go to downtown Disney and get dinner, we were told to return after 5. We returned at 6, got our luggage and went up to our room. The door was wide open and there was a man under the sink with a bunch of tools and a wetvac. He did not speak English and I don't speak Spanish, so back downstairs all 5 of us went. The front desk was confused and pointed fingers at each other and the 2 employees went into the back room. They came out and said it's going to be another hour. I asked to be compensated in some kind of way, at this point it was
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was comfortable, a little dated but the proximity to the park was great. My granddaughters enjoyed the pool. Walking back after a long day at the park was great,  shorter than walking to the parking lot structure.

Summary Heading: Over 1/2 block to cross the street to Disney - Great Value
Summary: We were here for a very short weekend and 1-day trip to Disney resorts with 2 teenagers - arrived Friday and departed Sunday.  The housekeeper knocked on our door and opened it at 8:30 am after a long night at Disney.  We didn't have the DND on our handle, but that was a disappointment and then they knocked again around 10:45 am and opened while the kids were at the pool and I was getting ready - even though by then we had the sign on the door.  We couldn't tell if they had even been in our room the day we did spend at Disney which would have been nice.    Blackout shades worked well.  Some noise from people walking and talking outside our door on their way to the stairwell/elevator.  The a/c fan creates white noise and is a little noisy - I don't mind, but the kids complained.
Manager Response: Hey Tlcjunk,   Our housekeeping department is usually commended for their thorough service, with special attention to detail. As a person who also enjoys their rest after a long day at Disney, we apologize for the rude awakening at 8:30 am. I have shared your comments with the housekeeping manager to ensure that this is promptly addressed.  I understand that your room was experiencing a few maintenance issues, and I have forwarded these concerns on to the chief engineer, to be addressed as necessary. We hope that you were able to communicate these concerns during your stay, as we have a very talented maintenance staff on property that can remedy such inconveniences as they occur!  We apologize for the vending machine being out of water bottles. It is a true inconvenience to you and that is not how we would like to show you our gratitude for choosing our hotel. When this occurs please do inform us at the front desk by dialing 0 on the house phone. The front desk staff is trained to locate other vending machines on the property. As well as offer other locations where you can purchase water.   I agree that after a long day at the Disneyland Resort a four to five-minute walk is a lot. We hope you enjoyed your Disney day.   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We take every review of our hotel very seriously. We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. We will relay this message to our staff to better service you in the future. We are delighted to know that although your experience wasn‚Äôt perfect you still had a decent stay we hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.

Summary: I called today with some questions on an upcoming booking this weekend that we have. Charles was the Best in being friendly, helpful & an overall awesome guy. Thank you for all of your help. We look forward to our stay!
Manager Response: Hey Tmtapia  We are ecstatic to read about your interaction with Charles. If it is not too much of an inconvenience we would like to read about your stay with us at the Grand Legacy At The Park. Hope to hear back from you.   Thank you,

Summary: We stayed at this hotel because of the location to the Disneyland park but will certainly stay here again because of the remarkable hospitality.  The front desk staff are very helpful and friendly. Alanna was very knowledgeable and helpful with any questions we had  also Charles helped us getting an upgrade which made or stay PERFECT. Special shout-out to the overnight guy Raymond he was very helpful when I needed towels and other supplies  when getting back from the park late at night. You guys rock!!

Summary: The grand legacy is always our first choice in hotel. Not only is it right across the street from Disneyland, but the rooms are always SO clean, the lobby smells amazing and inviting and the staff is fantastic. We especially love to see Charles. My three year old twins get so excited to see Charles almost as much as going to Disneyland! All the staff here is so kind and will go above and beyond your needs. The housekeeping staff is out of this world and do such an amazing job every day. We stay at this hotel quite often and each time our stay has been exemplary. There are also some new food options like Hawaiian anytime and pizza and boba attached to the hotel. There is also a little market if you need drinks or snacks which is really helpful. Come book a stay here and see
Manager Response: Hey Krickle339,   On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area. We appreciate your praise on our cleanliness, as well as, the information you provided for our onsite food and beverage options. Charles is one of our many exemplary employees, it delights us to read about his interaction with you and your twins. Thank you for continuing to choose the Grand Legacy At The Park.

Summary Heading: Some good; some not so good.
Summary: First stay at the hotel. On the positive side, hotel was sparkling clean, well-appointed, and the staff tried their best to rectify  bad situations beyond their control. Did not use the pool, so no info on that. On the not so positive side: Booked online at the hotel website for a street facing room in mid-November for an early March stay; confirmation came back as hotel facing. Called hotel, said they would fix it. Checked in and no they did not. On top of that we were right under the bar. They did move us to a lower floor the next night of our 7 night stay. but the racket from whatever was going on with whatever was mechanical outside was almost as bad as the bar but lasted all night. We went to the bar for dinner our last night and decided to hit happy hour which was
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Legacy twice. The first time was in June of 2018. We loved everything about it! We couldn't believe the price for the location; it was amazing. We had a great room, great service, parking was easy, and our 4 and 6 year old loved the pool! We had an amazing time! We planned to go back to the Grand Legacy in March of 2020... but we all know what happened there. We had an amazing rate on that particular reservation! The rooms manager Byron has been amazing to work with since then. He helped us change our reservation 4 times I believe, with great service all of those times and we were able to keep our great rate. We were finally able to use our reservation in December of 2021 and the room and service were just as great as ever. We will never stay anywhere
Manager Response: Hey E3939QJerinj,  Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to share about your recent stay at Grand Legacy At The Park.  Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we will utilize your response by continuing to focus on making every guest experience the best it can be. We really appreciate your praise towards our Rooms Division Manager. Hope to see you and your family in the near future.

Summary: We stay here often and we are NEVER disappointed. It is so close to the park and the rooms are always clean. I recently made a new reservation for March and a man named Charles helped me over the phone and he was so incredibly friendly and helpful. Best customer service I have received in a while. 10/10 would recommend this staff and this hotel to anyone around :)
Manager Response: Hey FannyB871521,   Thank you for sharing about your recent stay at Grand Legacy At The Park. Hope to see you soon.   Thank you,

Summary: The hotel is literally across the street from all the Disney parks and downtown Disney. The hotel itself is only average. There's an outdoor pool. You have to pay for parking. The room is small and there is barely any counter space in the bathroom, which is not a good thing for toiletry bags, etc.
Manager Response: Hey Desifoto,   We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property on a daily basis. In addition, please know that your comments will be addressed. We greatly appreciate your feedback. Hope you give us another opportunity.   Thank you,

Summary: I stayed in your property and it was a exceptional stay. I love that the hotel was close to Disneyland. The experience was great and it all started with very friendly and patient Front Desk crew and it just continued through our time there.
Manager Response: Hey 114lizethc,   Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to share about your recent stay at Grand Legacy At The Park.  Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we will utilize your response by continuing to focus on making every guest experience the best it can be. Hope to see you soon.   Thank you,

Summary Heading: Disneyland trip made all the better!
Summary: Stayed at the this hotel with friends during my Disneyland trip. It‚Äôs super close to the parks and the staff was super nice and attentive. It‚Äôs also close to a lot of restaurants and a Walgreens and a CVS. Would definitely book again!
Manager Response: Hey N5243ZRmaurof,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort. Hope to see you in the near future.   Thank you,

Summary Heading: Great hotel for an amazing friends trip
Summary: My friends and I stayed in a standard double queen room. The place was super clean and staff were very friendly. The beds were comfortable and the building was pretty quiet. It‚Äôs a short walk to the Disney parks and many restaurants. There is a mini mart just in front of the lobby. The pool area was cute with a separate hot tub and splash pad/ fountain area. We were able to see the fireworks at night from the 4th floor balcony.  I think it was a great hotel for the price and how close it is to the parks. We had a great trip and can‚Äôt wait to go back!
Manager Response: Hey 363baileyj  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.   Thank you,

Summary: Talked to a worker on the phone told us they couldn‚Äôt help with our problems, We were having but CHARLES was more then helpful when we went to the front desk. He met us with extreme kindness, solving our problems within seconds. We are definitely going to continue to come here due to the great staff such as Him & amazing service .
Manager Response: Hey E6122TCkinberlyc,  We apologize for the inadequate phone call you had with a worker. We will relay this message to our front desk staff to continue to provide great customer service. Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits. Charles is one of our great employees here at the  Grand Legacy At The Park.  Thank you,

Summary Heading: Front Desk manager Freddy Cruz made my stay memorable and exceptional
Summary: I visit Disneyland at least once a month. I usually stay at another hotel as I am a Diamond member and often get upgraded to a better room. I decided to try the Grand Legacy hotel due to its close proximity to the entrance to the park. While it costs more than my usual hotel it is worth the time saved by not having to take a city bus. What made my most recent stay very memorable was the excellent service provided by Front Desk Manager Freddy Cruz. Knowing it was my birthday, ( I think he saw it on my driver's license), when I got to my room after a day in the park it was filled with balloons; a birthday card signed by the staff; a gift bag AND a bottle of my favorite wine! (not sure how he knew I drank Malbecs. Maybe a coincidence.) Nonetheless, this kind of personalized service
Manager Response: Hey Convertibleguy,  Thank you for your feedback. As the front desk manager, I strive to make every reservation feel like a warm welcome to the hotel. I'm glad you enjoyed the complimentary gifts. We hope to see you here soon!   Thank you,

Summary: I would like to shed some background on our stay at the GRAND LEGACY AT THE PARK in order to explain why I will never stay here again. Our stay at the Grand Legacy was 7/29/2021 through 8/3/2021, a total of 5 consecutive nights. Weeks in advance, I called the hotel to explain that I would have 2 vehicles during our stay, but the second vehicle would only be there for 3 out of the 5 days throughout our stay. Prior to checking in to the hotel, I had presented an email coupon that we received directly from that hotel for free parking with a minimum stay of 3 nights. Again, I  reminded them that one of the vehicles would be arriving the next day and would only be there for 3 days as my father would not be staying with me  throughout the entire stay. The hotel staff let me know that
Manager Response: Good Morning Daniel!  We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property on a daily basis. Our goal is to not only meet the needs of each and every guest we serve but to exceed your expectations to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible. I will be contacting you regarding your stay. Once again thank you for staying with us and we greatly appreciate your feedback.  Thank you!  Front Office Manager

Summary: My son and I recently stayed here for 9 nights. You can't beat the location of this hotel to the Disneyland gates. A very quick and easy walk after a long day in the parks!  Prior to the trip I emailed asking a question about early check-in/luggage storage and received a very prompt and friendly response. Due to two flight cancellations on our arrival day we ended up not needing that since we arrived at 8 PM instead of 11 AM!  Our room was located in the back section across from the pool. We didn't use the pool at all but it looked nice. The room was clean upon arrival with the exception of something splattered on the wall behind the room door. I assume the housekeeping missed this with the door open while cleaning. Other than that the room was clean and fine.  Pros: Very close
Manager Response: Hey Shel28,   We are sorry to hear about the canceled flights but are glad to hear you made a safe arrival at our hotel. We are extatic that you enjoyed your recent stay with us.  We strive to have our amenities available for all guests. I personally apologize for your room not being to the standards we hold in our hotel.  As a team, we hope to better service you in future stays.   We apologize that there was some miscommunication regarding when housekeeping services the rooms. Housekeeping will first clean the guest rooms that have checked out, to have rooms ready for the guests arriving at 3 pm check-in time. The next will clean the stay-over guest rooms, and they are available to have service requested until about 4:15-4:30 pm. We can always schedule service earlier in the day, so please be sure to request this during your next stay, and we will be happy to accommodate this! :)  We appreciate the time you took in giving your feedback on our hotel. We hope to see you in a future stay!   Thank you,

Summary: We've been staying at the Grand Legacy for many years due to its proximity to Disneyland.  The staff is very accommodating (shout out to Rafaela at the front desk for being awesome!) and you can't beat the location.  The property and rooms are clean and our room had a refrigerator and Keurig machine with good coffee (Vanilla Bean Euro Coffee was my favorite...so much so that I purchased a box online!)  We've told all our family and friends that The Grand Legacy is THE place to stay when visiting the Magic Kingdom.  Oh, and The Fifth (the hotel's rooftop restaurant/bar) is amazing!!
Manager Response: Hey usc4us,   It seems from your comments that you were quite happy with your overall experience, and we‚Äôre pleased that we were able to be a part of your Disneyland vacation adventure! We will make sure to inform Rafaela of how she did recently. Rafaela strives to put a smile on every guest's face upon check-in! :)   Thank you,

Summary: Excellent hotel with excellent location located just a few minutes walking distance from the main entrance of Disneyland, extremely clean & comfortable. Upon arrival we were warmly welcomed by Charles , he made our trip more memorable with his advice & tips about the area like shops,restaurants and bars that were within walking distance. I Would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody! It's a true sample of excellent hospitality. Thank you again Charles for going just that little step extra for your guest!!!
Manager Response: Hey Passenger32535642129,   Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to share about your recent stay at our hotel.  Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we will utilize your response by continuing to focus on making every guest experience the best it can be. We hope to be of service to you in the future. Charels is one of our esteemed front desk leads, we appreciate your kind words. We will be sure to let him know how well he did! :)   Thank you,

Summary: This is my Disneyland go to hotel !  The Staff are friendly and accommodating ! Charles was so pleasant and helpful. He really went out of his way to give me EXCELLANT service. Thank you Charles ! üòäüëçüëè
Manager Response: Hey 16theresaj,   Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. Thank you for the shot out to one of our amazing front desk leads Charels. We will let him know about his awesome service so he can continue to put big smiles on our guests faces. We hope to see you soon!  Thank you,

Summary: This place is so great!!! the best thing about it is that Disneyland is across the street! the staff is very professional and friendly. Charles was great at helping me and answering all the questions I had! I had a great experience!
Manager Response: Hey JoannasD7216AP,   Thank you so much for your kind words. Charles always goes that extra mile for guests. In turn, we work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to see you soon!  Thank you,

Summary Heading: Perfect Location for Disneyland & California Adventure Parks
Summary: I love that this property is an easy walk to the Disney parks. All the staff is super friendly. Charles gave great recommendations for food and shopping in the area. I need to check out the rooftop bar next time for fireworks and drinks!
Manager Response: Hey Rochellicer,  We are glad that the distance of our hotel is up to par. Charels, as well as our front desk staff, strive to be knowledgeable of the restaurants and entertainment around the hotel to better inform guests. We know guests love days at the park but there are other amazing entertainment businesses around the hotel as well. We appreciate that you took the time to write a trip advisor! :)  Thank you,

Summary: This hotel was wonderful. The room was nice. There‚Äôs a rooftop restaurant which is really nice. The customer service was great. Charles helped us at check in and also had great recommendations for food and other activities for the family. This is a great hotel for a family Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: Hey Giomaricastillo,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to being of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us. Charels is a big hit with our guests. We hope to continue to meet your expectations of what you look for in a hotel. See you soon!  Thank you,

Summary: Disneyland for Christmas! Whatttaaaa dream. Let‚Äôs not forget to mention this little gem, right across the friggen street from it. I guess it beats walking all the way through the tram trails. Everyone is so knowledgeable about the surrounding areas which was awesome! Thanks for all the fun recommendations Charles!  Makes vacationing that much more enjoyable!!!
Manager Response: Hey Chuggachoochoo,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort! We appreciate your kind words on our front desk lead Charles.   Thank you,

Summary: I gotta say, there‚Äôs a first for everything. My first time in CA, and my first super fantastic stay. I normally hate hotel interactions. Always all super rushed and unpleasant. But, thanks to Charles for all the smiles! Wish I was able to lounge by the pool, really cute, but it was colder than expected. Haha!
Manager Response: Hey Littlelovie15,  We are excited to read that your first time was super fantastic! It is truly what we love to hear coming from first-time guests. I'm glad you were helped by one of our frequently requested front desk agents. We will follow Charles's lead and provide our guests with loving smiles. We are sorry to hear that the pool was colder than expected we strive to keep the pool at roughly room temp and warmer during the winter seasons so that guests can still be able to enjoy the pool even while cold out.   Thank you,

Summary: First time staying there and the front desk staff were very welcoming, the room was very nice and clean. The rooftop bar has an amazing view. Freddy, answered all my questions and made my stay more enjoyable. I will definately be staying here again!!
Manager Response: Hey Veronika1086,   I am glad that I was able to answer all your questions. I am more than satisfied to know that you felt the warm welcome we try to give to every guest that steps foot in our hotel. Thank you for taking the time to write a response. I hope to see you again soon! Any questions about future stays or anything regarding your stay please feel free to contact us at 714-772-0440.  We are a 24-hour front desk service! :) Hope to see you again soon!  Thank you,

Summary: The room was very clean, quiet, and safe. Edgar is very helpful. Very close to Disneyland entrance, stores, and other restaurants. There's a security patrol watching the area. The swimming pool is clean.  Excellent customer service.
Manager Response: Hey Disneyparents,  Thank you for your kind praise of our staff! We do our best to have all departments working as a team to ensure a pleasant stay for each of our guests.  Thank you,

Summary: Grand Legacy is always a great choice when visiting Disneyland. It‚Äôs within walking distance, and usually a great deal. Their rooftop bar is really nice and the perfect spot to watch the fireworks. Thank you to Charles and Eufrocina for the amazing customer service!
Manager Response: Hey Nickdalbianco,  Charels and Eufrocina are one of the amazing staff we have here working for us at Grand Legacy At The Park. They set an example for upcoming front desk agents. Summary: Charles and Martha always go above and beyond to take care of me and make every stay the best one yet!  I stayed at the hotel on December 6, 2021 which was my 21st stay just at the Grand Legacy in the past year!!  As a Magic Key holder, former Walt Disney World cast member and frequent traveler, I feel they both embody the spirit of the hotel and take their roles seriously.   I truly feel their enthusiasm is genuine.  They are both easy to talk to and very friendly.  I am looking forward to my next trip to the Disneyland Resort and seeing both of them.  They are the most memorable hotel staff I have encountered and why I book Grand Legacy continuously.  They both deserve recognition for all their hard work during my many stays!
Manager Response: Hey Alli N,  We miss you here at the hotel. We hope you're doing well and can't wait to see you here! Martha and Charels are eagerly waiting for you to book an upcoming stay! We are truly impressed with your 21st stay with us. Hope to see you here soon.  Thank you,

Summary: Great room with very quick walk to the Disneyland entrance. Beds were comfy and pillows were nice. My family and I are coming back in February and have already booked here again. I would highly recommend if you‚Äôre going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hey A6700Tliejffv,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope you enjoyed your stay in February we hope to see you soon!  Thank you,

Summary: My partner and I made plans to go to Disneyland, and decided to stay off property for the first time. I was hesitant, but originally booked with Grand Legacy because of its proximity to the parks. Now I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever stay anywhere else. We had a great room, conveniently right next to the elevator and a great view of the parks so if you wanted to come home early you could still see the fireworks. The room was really nice too; every time he got into the shower I could hear my partner saying ‚Äúwow, what a great shower!‚Äù The hotel was clean, and cautious of COVID.   And I think what made our stay just perfect was checking in with Alanna. She was super helpful recommending the closest In-n-Out for us to get to, helping us get sorted with parking, and just was a shining smiling
Manager Response: Hey Alexabee73,   We are genuinely delighted to read this amazing response. We know it's a bit overdue but we are glad you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. We will let Alanna know about your warm and thoughtful words. We look forward to guests like yourself that take the time to appreciate what we strive for here at the Grand Legacy At The Park. Thank you for taking the time out of your day to submit this trip advisor for our exemplary front desk agent, Alanna. :)  Thank you,

Summary: Really enjoyed my stay here!  I was looking for a hotel fairly close to Disneyland for my vacation and whattaya know, this is right across the way!  The rooms were comfy, the lots are spacious and the staff made everything quite simple.  I believe it was Charles, who kindly checked us in and even made our check-out a breeze. Nice to see the same faces from start to finish. Will definitely stay again when we're in Anaheim!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Grand Legacy is always our go-to hotel when we visit the Disneyland Resort! A very close walking distance to the parks, the rooms are always very clean and comes with a microwave and mini refrigerator‚Äîvery convenient! The staff are excellent and always take such great care of us, particularly Eufrocina and Charles! They have such amazing guest service and always make our stay that much more enjoyable! If only all hotels have people like them to take care of their guests! Eufrocina and Charles are very professional, kind, courteous, excellent all around! We highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Been hesitant to stay anywhere ever since the pandemic and on going regulations. Decided on Grand legacy for its proximity to Disneyland- great reviews on cleanliness. I was pleasantly surprised to be greeted and checked in efficiently by the front desk. Answered all my questions and recommendations were all helpful. Made the stay memorable and def will be booking here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Arrived around 8p for check in and was greeted by Martha. Very friendly and professional. The check in process was very quick and she quickly gave information regarding the property, pool hours and services available on site. Didn‚Äôt make time for the roof top restaurant/bar so there definitely will be a second visit. The fireworks from Disney and the jacuzzi after a long day of walking at Disney were the highlights for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself is very nice, staff are great. Parking is expensive and the roof top bar is....hwy robbery. Not part of the hotel. $35 to walk thru the door and auto 18% gratuity. All of that is even IF you can get in, they close out hotel guests for private parties.  IF you're booking the hotel thinking you can have a drink, enjoy the view....look elsewhere!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I have been staying at the grand legacy for years and years. We stayed with them during their transition from the Ramada to the grand legacy. We‚Äôve experienced such kindness, professionalism and great customer service. Dora, has helped me with any questions or changes I‚Äôve needed in the past. She‚Äôs always Been patient and sweet. Today, I checked in with Freddy and Dora and it was a comfort to see Dora still working here after Covid. The staff helped me check in quickly, offered me a different room since I arrived early and enrolled me in their new program. I have been staying at this location for over 13 years and will always choose the grand legacy. They have a great location if you‚Äôre walking to Disneyland and an amazing view of the fireworks. The rooms are
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location for walking to Disney with small kids.  Felt safe and secure.  But our rooms smelled like a fast food fryer and some of our clothes ended up smelly too.  Seemed like the air circulation was poor or maybe we had neighbors eating in their room and the air from next door was getting into our room.  Wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location was good for Disneyland, a shirt walk to the entrance on Harbor. Staff was friendly, no issues there.  For what we paid, the value was low. We usually stay at the Best Western a few buildings up for less and get breakfast included. Sadly, they had no availability on this trip.  Ants in our room, we asked for towels to be brought to the pool since they were out and they never arrived, lights out in our room. No breakfast included.  The restraunt, which has a great view of the park and if timed right the fireworks, had a private party blasting music which made it hard to enjoy ourselves. I know private parties happen there, and I know they close the restraunt down for some of them, but I would have liked the music to have been at a level where I could actually hear
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Couldn't ask for a better location!
Summary: The Grand Legacy is literally across the street from Disneyland!  It takes less than 10 minutes to walk there door to door.  As someone used to going to Disney World this was SO nice - you don't have to worry about waiting a half hour for a Disney bus or an Uber, or having to take a Monorail or walk forever to the parking lot.  The location is the best part of this hotel.  The room itself was clean but very small - for two adults it was tight so I can't imagine having kids there too.  The bed was comfortable and the shower was nice.    The only bad thing about the room itself other than the size is that for some reason the water coming out of our sink tap (not the shower or the toilet) smelled like raw sewage.  We notified the staff on our first night and they offered to send a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent stay experience. We are happy to read that you found the location and parking great during your visit. We can't wait to welcome you back!

Summary Heading: Our go to hotel for Disney!
Summary: Almost every time we visit Disneyland we stay at this hotel! The staff is always so kind, the property is clean and the rooms are spacious. Only a 5 minute walk to the parks and downtown Disney! They have a heated pool and a rooftop bar called The Fifth where you can watch the fireworks. It‚Äôs a great place to grab a drink and bite while visiting. They constantly have deals going on so I would follow them on social media to find the best rates!
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive feedback! We can't wait to welcome you back!

Summary: My teenage daughter and I stayed in a classic room with double beds at this hotel and would highly recommend it if you‚Äôre looking for something easy and convenient. Just exactly what we needed. We had a few issues and maintenance was right on it for us. The little gift shop/convenience store was perfect for water and even some bananas. Easy walk to the parks and the hotel really added to the magic. I would absolutely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this great review regarding your recent experience. We can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary: I just came back from a 4 night stay at the Legacya t the Park. I was pleasantly surprised at the room I stayed in and the hotel overall. The roomI got was recently  updated and very clean. It was a shrt walk to the IHOP where we had breakfast and omn to Disneyland, including waits at stop lights, was under 10 minutes. During my stay, the hotel was quiet. I never heard noise from other guests. The hotel overall isin great shape and well maintained.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent location but lacking in many areas.
Summary: The overall location of the hotel is excellent, not too far from Disneyland.  We stayed in room 102 which was right by the entrance walkway.  However the parking in front of our room was reserved for valet and the staff golf carts. The room was quiet despite being so close to where most everyone walked.  The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful.  The pool was the highlight of the property.  Very large pool with varying depths with a walk-in entry, no steps required.  There is also some splash pad areas for kids and a small hot tub.  Towels at the pool were plentiful, but small.  But there were many small and large problems with the room.  The layout was good, with lots of space to walk around.  The lighting situation was bad, barely could get enough light at night.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay so close to the park
Summary: I've seen some awful reviews on here for this place, but put me in the win column.  We had stayed at other reasonable priced places on Harbor, this was better than most of them.  The room was updated and clean.  The staff was friendly.  The pool was a decent size with great extras.  It was nice to be able to park in front of our room.  It's almost directly at the crosswalk to walk to Disneyland, so the location is hard to beat.  We did take advantage of their rooftop bar, The Fifth on our first night and the food was decent as were the drinks.  The view was hard to beat.  My only negative is that we had hoped to leave the car parked for a few hours after checking out so we could go to downtown Disney and they wanted to charge us for a full day of parking... We parked at Downtown
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Bed Bugs on roll away bed
Summary: We stayed for the first time at this hotel for our 4th of July weekend. It was a convenient hotel because it's across the street from Disney. Here's our experience. The pictures were definitely not what we walked into the day we arrived to the hotel. We were expecting a much more up to date hotel. The pool looks much bigger in the pictures, but that wasn't much of a concern since we didn't spend much time in it. The shower handle was loose and that was annoying and should be fixed/replaced, eye roll. MOST IMPORTANTLY, my son came home with BED BUG bites!! We requested to have an extra bed in our room. I did blame myself for not checking the mattress, but that should've been done by the staff regardless! I'm assuming they had the bed rolled away and put up for a while until its
Manager Response: Dear Argelia,  The safety of our team and guests is our top priority. Our hotel follows a disinfecting and cleanliness protocol and has systems in place for these types of situations. We take these reports with much importance and have been trying to get a hold of you for further information. A thorough inspection was done to this room, and we like to report that no pest or bed bug activity was found. You may reach me at byron@grandlegacyhotel.com or at 714-772-0440 ext. 199.

Summary Heading: Mahalo for a wonderful stay so close to Disneyland!
Summary: Great experience!   Pros: ‚Ä¢ Excellent location--a block from the light where the Disneyland Esplanade begins, only a handful of hotels are closer to the park ‚Ä¢ Great customer service on the phone and via email ‚Ä¢ Luxury 2  queen bed room in the new tower was clean with a good view of California Adventure ‚Ä¢ Our room location (259) was perfect, right above "Anytime Hawaiian" so the night before we went to Disneyland we bought a bunch of spam musubi, refrigerated it, then brought in foil to the park the next day so it was the perfect temperature and we got to avoid the long food lines. Delicious! ‚Ä¢ The staff followed COVID safety guidance by wearing masks at all times. ‚Ä¢ I joined their rewards program which gives a free night stay after 6 qualifying nights, which is better than most
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at this motel during a visit to Disneyland. The location is amazing! Short walk to the front gate of the park. The room was spotless and the area is quiet. Parking was available just steps from the room. Very reasonable rates. Plan to book another stay in the fall. A+++++
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff always make you feel welcome. They go above and beyond every time we stay. I have been coming back here for over 12 years and will continue to come back here. I highly recommend this hotel. Thank you for the great stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing staff...great location...wish I could live there.
Summary: We have stayed here for many years. Every time we return the staff welcomes us back and remembers who we are. They make us feel very VIP. Everyone here is very courteous, polite, and professional. Thank you Grand Legacy staff!
Manager Response: none

Summary: To begin with I was very hesitant about the hotel because of the bad reviews but we gave it a shot. From the minute we checked in , it was nothing but a good experience. Joshua the front desk person that checked us in, greeted us and welcomed us to the hotel. I booked through booking.com and booked double beds but Joshua was kind enough to upgrade us to queen beds. He was the best !! Even though he was incredibly busy answering phones and checking me in he made conversation with us and that‚Äôs what customer service is all about. Even though the hotel is not this fancy hotel , it gets the job done, Clean rooms, in front of Disneyland. What else can I ask for. 100% recommend Grand legacy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently stayed here for 4 nights in June.  I had a myriad of small to large problems....the refrigerator didn't work, I reported it in person AND called the front desk asking for a repair or replacement - that never happened. I had to discard spoiled milk and sandwich fixings. The pool area was out of towels early afternoon for 3 of our 4 days, even with minimal use. My room key malfunctioned most days resulting in having to walk back to the front desk repeatedly. Our room was quite a distance from the lobby and there are no courtesy phones. When it is hot trudging back and forth to the desk for the same problem repeatedly is just plain aggravating. No in-room housekeeping so you have to request more towels. This is easier said than done - another instance that required
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stay elsewhere. Unhelpful staff - there are better hotels on Harbor
Summary: Like most properties across from Disney, this hotel is dated and could use some help - pool is really good. That‚Äôs about it for the good. Staff is really unhelpful. I needed to park a rental car in addition to my car for one night. They wouldn‚Äôt allow it, even for a added charge, despite the posted policy stating guests could park two cars for an additional fee. Really ridiculous. And yes, the hotel was not full and there were plenty of empty spots.   Hotels here on Harbor across from the park should compete in every area. This one falls short. Bring your family elsewhere.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This is a DIRTY MOTEL not a hotel.
Summary: DISGUSTING!! This operates like a nasty motel not a hotel‚Ä¶. Shower was not even clean, room was dirty, snd parking was a mess!   They don‚Äôt keep their promises either. Before booking they promised us parking for the whole day after checkout so we could go to the park and not stress about parking at Disneyland‚Ä¶  However, once we arrived they said they will no longer guarantee that and that regardless of what was promised we have to move our car by 12pm (not 9pm). (This was literally the main reason why we booked with the ).   We spoke with management and rudely said that it wasn‚Äôt their problem and regardless of what we say or think the car needs to be moved by 12pm.   Even when we brought up the shower not functioning and hair and sticky stuff coming up from the drain as we
Manager Response: Dear FlowersFamBam,   We understand and feel your frustration with regard to the parking situation. With the rapidly changing times we are all experiencing, it has been necessary for our operating procedures to transition as well.  As only California residents have been allowed into Disneyland until very recently, air transportation has been nearly eliminated as a means of travel thereby increasing the volume of vehicles filling our parking lot. In order to accommodate all our guests, changes had to be made. We quickly realized it was physically impossible to allow vehicles to stay until 4 PM as was possible in the past.  While we are excited for the Parks to reopen, parking has been an issue for all local hotels. We sincerely apologize for your inconvenience and we do wish that these changes were not necessary.  As for your room, we are disappointed to see that you experienced any negative issues. We apologize for those issues!  We take pride in our property and work hard to ensure a positive stay for all our guests. There is a request for a rollaway bed and a toothbrush to your room but we were not informed of any issues with the shower or concerns about cleanliness. Please know we would have acted immediately to fix any situation. We appreciate you sharing your feedback so we may address these items now.  We hope that you and your family enjoyed your time at the Disneyland Resort.

Summary Heading: Our choice of hotel in Anaheim
Summary: This is the only Anaheim hotel I stay at whenever we visit Disneyland.  Our stay was from June 8 to 12, 2021.  We‚Äôve stayed here about 7 times.  The hotel is literally a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance.  The rooms are decent and clean, the beds comfortable, cost of nightly stay is decent . Just coming out of the pandemic, there was no housekeeping, but if you needed anything,  such as fresh towels, all you had to do was call the front desk.  The beautiful pool is  open.  There is a Tony Roma‚Äôs restaurant next door and just a few doors down a Denny‚Äôs and an IHOP.  Mc Donald‚Äôs is just a short drive  down the street.  Parking is $17 per day compared to the Disneyland parking garage which is $25 per day  plus the trams are not working d/t the pandemic and it‚Äôs a very long
Manager Response: none

Summary: We tried to check into the hotel just after midnight. The associate Raymond said my card was declined, made no sense to me because I pre-paid with Booking.  Come to find out that BOOKING had not released my payment to the hotel. Raymond said I needed to call them for them to release payment. After being on hold for an hour with booking getting nowhere (mind you it is now after 1 am, and I had just driven 7 hours after working all day) Raymond gave me my room key, and did not charge me for parking.   The beds were super comfortable, and the tub was deep. We did not have any issues with noise from the bar like others have said. I would 100% stay here again. So close to Disneyland as well.  You cannot beat that.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ridiculously noisy - a hole in the back wall of the room open to the street!
Summary: This is a cheap motel disguised as a hotel. Book a room and you won't be in a hotel tower - you'll be in a motel courtyard. There is an open hole TO THE STREET behind the air conditioner in your room and all night long you'll hear garbage trucks, people talking and yelling and cars drag racing - as if you were lying right in the street. Its like sleeping on the Vegas strip - like - ON the Vegas strip - and WAY too expensive to be so.  Had hoped to eat dinner here but on a Friday night they had sold out the restaurant for a wedding.  Yes the location is great, but you won't sleep so good luck enjoying your day at the park. You've been warned.  Staff are friendly, rooms are adequately appointed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It has been a longtime because of Covid but we are finally coming back to the Grand Legacy. It‚Äôs the only place we stay and they remembered my wife when she maid the reservation. That alone is enough! We look forward to visiting each time and the staff is STELLAR when it comes to taking care of the guests. Excited writing this and will do again after our stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No good if you want to sleep.
Summary: Location is great but beds are brutal and the bar keeps everybody up until at least midnight. It has decent reviews somehow so I‚Äôm not sure if others are just taking enough Ambien to pass out or drinking at the bar until last call but sleeping in the new tower is impossible and the old rooms surrounding the parking lot pickup a lot of the bar noise OR the parking lot noise because they also sell their parking lot for Disneyland parking.  It‚Äôs an interesting bargain hotel that‚Äôs trying to make money on every front at the expense of its guests. If you go to bed late it‚Äôs doable but it‚Äôs tough and awkward with kids as other reviewers have pointed out.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Byron and Carlos are amazing people. always welcome our family with smiles and kindness. the entire staff on property are great and always attend to your needs. Byron always makes sure we are very well taken care of whenever we stay at the Legacy! We truly appreciate you Byron! And thank you for the snacks and wonderful card! You're the best! Many Thanks, The Flores Family
Manager Response: Thank you for the shout-out! We love every opportunity possible to WOW our guests. We can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Amazing Staff and awesome location make this the best stay in the area!
Summary: All the staff members and the manager were extremely customer service oriented which made my stay at this hotel very enjoyable.   The hotel has all the necessary amenities, including a rooftop bar/lounge.  The hotel is located in the ultimate location, directly across the street from the Disneyland resort and walking distance to the Garden Walk shopping/entertainment center.   I learned about this hotel when I had to evacuate from my home during a Southern California wildfire.   The manager had provided a special low cost room rate for his premium room accommodations to ensure that my community was able to safely relocate during the mandatory evacuations.   I'm grateful that he made this offer on our neighborhood watch page as I was able to find a secure and safe location with
Manager Response: We love to help our community when possible. Thank you for the feedback! We can't wait to welcome you back but this time for a nice getaway vacation.

Summary: We travel to Anaheim quite often.  We have stayed a a number of hotels near the Disneyland Resort.  Now, we refuse to stay anywhere except for the Grand Legacy.  Their staff is amazing  They go a long way to take care of us and our needs.  Rooms are always clean and updated.  The staff does a lot to maintain the hotel. Check in is a breeze.  Their location is prefect for those visiting Disneyland.  The 5th is a great bar with an awesome view.  The pool is great and it has vey fun water features for the kids.  A lot of thanks goes out to the Grand Legacy at the Park and it's staff.
Manager Response: Hi Mark,   Thank you for taking the time to post this review regarding your recent stay! We thank you for your loyalty. We are happy to read that our staff treats you and your family with care. Thank you for staying with us. We can't wait to welcome you back!

Summary Heading: Just a quick trip to get a small taste of Disney Via Downtown District
Summary: As Disney is closed for the moment. Byron at the front desk from start to finish is the magic that we as a family are missing with Disneyland being closed. We have stayed here since it was Ramada. And will continue to return due to its staff and convenient location to the parks. Thank you again Byron for going above and beyond! The Flores Family
Manager Response: Hello Flores Family! Thank you for the shout out! We enjoy and love your visits. We appreciate you guys taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent visit. Thank you for your loyalty. We can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary: I have never had ANYONE in the travel industry go completely out of their way to make sure that my family was taken care of.  Everyone going to Disneyland should look into this hotel!  It is beautiful, comfortable and located easily within walking distance of the park.  But it is the customer service that puts them over the top (specifically, Byron!).  Thank you for committing so much time, effort and resources into ensuring the amazing experience of your guests!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review regarding your recent experience. Thank you as well for the nice shout out. We hope you and your loved ones are doing well. We can't wait to welcome you!

Summary: With everything going on right now it was such a great reassurance to talk to Carlos the other day. I needed to make some changes to my reservation in June and he was eager to help and answered every question I had. What a relief for me and my family. Thank you Carlos for everything, see you in June.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that Carlos was such a great help! During this uncertain time, we are here to assist our guests. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to seeing you in June.

Summary: This is a great hotel to stay in when visiting Disneyland. The bed was firm and supportive which I loved. The room was also very large. The walk to Disneyland is only about 5 minutes and it's also close to lots of great restaurants.
Manager Response: We are glad you loved our beds and spacious rooms! We appreciate your feedback and thank you for staying with us. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Once again we did our Disneyland trip and stayed here, and once again it was great! I wish they‚Äôd offer some more perks for the faithful customers like us tho lol . We‚Äôve been staying here for the last 6 years. At least can‚Äôt we get free parking lol  Great service, great staff and so easy to access late night snacks to surrounding places.
Manager Response: We like to start by thanking you for your loyalty. As a Legacy Rewards member, you are eligible for a nightly discounted parking fee. If you have any questions regarding our Legacy Rewards Loyalty Program, please feel free to contact me at byron@grandlegacyhotel.com.

Summary: Hotel is walking distance to Disneyland parks. A Tony Roma‚Äôs restaurant is right next door. Hotel was clean and very nice. They have a snack bag for guests to take to the parks which includes a water, apple, and cheese/crackers.
Manager Response: Dear Mobeadz,  We are delighted to see that you enjoyed our property and amenities! Thank you for your review and we look forward to hosting you for your next Disneyland adventure!

Summary: My last minute trip to Disneyland meant that the hotels I would usually stay at were 100% booked. Looking for a hotel with an easy walk to the park brought me to the grand legacy. While it‚Äôs not taking other my favorite place to stay on Harbor boulevard. It‚Äôs clean with a good size room and you can walk to park. If you are like my family and you stay in Disneyland from opening to close this hotel is just fine. Not the closet to the park as others but still an easy walk. Good size pool and hot tub, though the hot tub needed to be hotter.
Manager Response: Dear 512Kennyf,   Thank you for your feedback! We are happy that you got to experience much of what our property has to offer. We look forward to being a part of your Disneyland Resort memories in the future. Thanks again!

Summary: This property is across road from Disneyland - great to 'come and go'. Rooms roomy and clean; bathrooms roomy with bath and shower; staff great; hygiene excellent; everything one would need is available.
Manager Response: Dear Irene C,  You just made our day! We are so happy that you had a great time with us and at the Disneyland Resort! We work hard to be part of the magic of a Disney vacation... Thank you for your review and can't wait to see you next time!

Summary Heading: Great Location But Not If You Want To Sleep
Summary: The good: Great location across the street from Disneyland and the updated rooms are large.  The Bad: The club on the top of the new re-done tower, The Fifth, is loud and you can hear the boom boom boom music until 1pm. The hotel gives a gentle warning that on nights of events there may be noise. This is misleading as the club is open 5 nights a week. They are closed Sunday and Monday nights but I do not know if they also have private events that night. You can hear the music coming from the club from across the street. I was on the 3rd floor and I needed ear plugs to sleep. There is only 1 elevator so it can take awhile to get to your floor when the club is open.
Manager Response: Dear Alisa S  Thank you for giving us a try! We love having new guests stay with us. We hope to see you during your next visit to the Disneyland Resort. If possible noise if an issue; please give our Premier rooms a try. They are also spacious rooms with a 2 sink separate vanity. They are in a different section on property and away from our restaurant. We want all guests to feel comfortable and enjoy their time with us. Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary: Usually I stay at the Best western Hotel right next door to grand legacy and my family and I decided to try this one out this year and I‚Äôm pleased to say it was awesome. It‚Äôs not the best hotel in the world but you get what you pay for, it‚Äôs less than a five minute walk to The parks, offers snack bags in the morning which I thought were really neat. Not only that but the customer service was amazing, that‚Äôs what gets me to stay at a hotel or not. The front Desk person I think his name was Joshua, he was so nice and welcoming and gave us suggestions on what places to eat around the hotel. Great customer service on his end! Housekeeping was amazing as well, nice and clean rooms, what else can I ask for. My family and I really enjoyed our yearly trip to Disneyland. We‚Äôre definitely
Manager Response: Dear Lisaf00,  Thank you for your review and welcome to the Grand Legacy family! We are so excited that you gave us a try and that you will be back! Our wonderful staff works hard to ensure our guests have a comfortable stay after all that play time at the Happiest Place on Earth. Vacation time is to be enjoyed to the fullest and we are honored to be a part of yours. Thanks again!

Summary: So the best thing it has going for it is location. Close to the entrance at Disneyland and restaurants like tony Roma‚Äôs, IHOP and a couple blocks from mimies. Rooms were just ok nothing fancy we had a deluxe king bed with a tub shower and water pressure was decent (on the third floor) had a pod coffee maker, in room fridge and microwave. Only thing that was bad was they market their rooftop outdoor restaurant the fifth....but here the buyer beware comes in. We never got to see the restaurant let alone have a drink or meal there. They don‚Äôt tell you that the place is not open on Sunday and Monday. (We arrived on Sunday and left on Friday) So then on Tuesday with high hopes went went there and lo and behold it was closed for a ‚Äúprivate event‚Äù.  As it turns out every day it was
Manager Response: Dear SgtFred52,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us.We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying.Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Should you decide to stay with us again please view The FIFTH calendar shows all the events, bands, and if they will be closed for a private party so you may plan accordingly. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better

Summary: Location was the best part of this hotel. Very convenient to walk to Disney. With that said, the hotel itself was nothing special. It was clean, and the pool was nice. However, the sounds of the housekeeping carts outside of the room were extremely loud. We thought at first it was airplanes overhead. The walls are very thin, we could hear everything happening outside or next door. The biggest frustration came with housekeeping‚Äôs schedule. Our first day we were disappointed to come back around 1:00 pm to let our daughter nap and find the room had not been cleaned. We had to make sure to be out of the room by 4:30 so they could clean it for us before they left at 5:00. The next day we ran into the same issue. Housekeeping even saw us leaving the room to go to the pool and asked if
Manager Response: Dear Angiej56,   We apologize for the issues you had during your stay. We strive for every guest to enjoy themselves and to feel comfortable while staying with us. We apologize that the room did not get serviced as you requested. Our housekeeping department is usually commended for their thorough service, with special attention to detail. I have shared your comments with the housekeeping manager to ensure that this is promptly addressed. We apologize for the disturbance near your room. I have forwarded your comments to the FIFTH management. We appreciate that you took the time to provide feedback about your recent stay with us.

Summary: Most of what is on offer here is in the name: grand = large, which it certainly is; and the second most common meaning of legacy = something coming from the past,  which it most certainly is. Flanked by a range of other lodging establishments of varying standards, this sprawling 60s-era (if not in construction, at least in design) motel-style hotel sits almost opposite the Disney Park main entry on Harbor Boulevard. Paint has been used in ample quantities to keep it on life support so first impressions are OK until you get a glimpse beyond the veneer of modernity at lodgings that would, in a more discerning marketplace, have long ago been razed and replaced.  The good: reception was efficient albeit a little perfunctory. The valet parking attendants (parking $17/day) were
Manager Response: Dear Tedstravelblogs,  Thank you for your review and we are so honored that you gave us a try this trip. I understand that your room was experiencing a few maintenance issues, and I have forwarded these concerns on to the chief engineer, to be addressed as necessary. We hope that you were able to communicate these concerns during your stay, as we have a very talented maintenance staff on property that can remedy such inconveniences as they occur! Please know that we do have safety deposit boxes available at the Front Desk for our guests. We are happy to store your valuables and ID's for your party. Our entire staff looks forward to your next visit with us and becoming your Disney home away from home. Thank you again!

Summary: We stayed here on a Friday night hoping to wake up early in the morning for Disneyland. After putting my kids to bed, music started blasting as if a rock and roll band was in the next room. It woke my kids out of a sound sleep. I called the front desk and they said they had rented out their rooftop bar and It would continue to go on until midnight. He said there had already been multiple complaints. On top of all that, we could hear the water running through the pipes in the walls and the doors and TV from the adjacent room. Super thin walls I guess. Very disappointed after paying peak weekend rates for the room. Close walk to Disneyland but obviously not family friendly. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms and it was nicely furnished but very small.
Manager Response: Dear 472rachaelb,  We are sorry to hear of your experience on our property. We want all of our guests to enjoy their stay with us. We hope to see you during your next visit to the Disneyland Resort. If possible noise if an issue; please give our Premier rooms a try. They are also spacious rooms with a 2 sink separate vanity. They are in a different section on property and away from our restaurant. We want all guests to feel comfortable and enjoy their time with us. Thank you for your feedback and we look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary: We booked this hotel due to its close proximity to Disneyland. The room was only 159.00 per night which I thought was a wonderful price for being during Christmas! The check in process was easy and the clerk was polite and helpful. The room was a decent size for the 4 of us and was extremely clean! We didn‚Äôt spend a whole lot of time at the property because we stayed at Disneyland from open to close the 3 days/nights we were there. The property even allowed us to leave our car parked in the parking lot after check out for an additional fee which we were fine with! We would definitely stay at the Grand Legacy again for our Disneyland trips!
Manager Response: Dear Bumblebbeth,   You just made our day! We are so happy that you had a great time with us and at the Disneyland Resort! We work hard to be part of the magic of a Disney vacation... Thank you for your review and can't wait to see you next time!

Summary: Have stayed at this hotel over a handful of times and the past several stays there has been a consistent decline in efficiency and cleanliness. We got into our room at 8:30 tonight and had no hot water to shower. After calling the front desk several times, maintenance came to our room and told us he would be back. He didn‚Äôt return so I called the front desk and was told the entire new tower was out of hot water due to mechanical issue and we wouldn‚Äôt have hot water tonight. They offered for us two walk outside to one of the older rooms to shower and then walk back, but being two women traveling alone we opted not to do that. As we finally gave up on a shower after a long day and got into bed, the beds looked like they haven‚Äôt been changed and they had a weird odor. We‚Äôre so
Manager Response: Dear Travelgrlz,   I understand that your room was experiencing a few maintenance issues, and I have forwarded these concerns on to the chief engineer, to be addressed as necessary. We hope that you were able to communicate these concerns during your stay, as we have a very talented maintenance staff on property that can remedy such inconveniences as they occur! We apologize that the room was not up to our routinely superior standard of cleanliness. Our housekeeping department is usually commended for their thorough service, with special attention to detail. I have shared your comments with the housekeeping manager to ensure that this is promptly addressed.Please contact our Front Desk Manager if you would like to discuss further your stay. She would be happy to assist. Thank you

Summary: Friendly people greeted us with a comfortable room  The hotel is opposite the gates to Disney & Disney Adventure Park  With 2 minute walk  Central to restraints & shops   Was a great stay  Recommended & would stay here again
Manager Response: Dear TonyHolmes61,  Thank you for your review and sharing your experience. Our whole staff genuinely cares about our guests and their well-being.. Hope that you had a magical time at the Disneyland Resort. We look forward to being a part of your Disneyland Resort memories in the future.  Thanks again!

Summary: Cheaper than others at location, but you get what you pay for. Never coming back, not hygienic.  Better stay at other hotels than to worry about bugs or what is that in your sheets.  Farthest one from Disney entrance in that block. Hard to park, they block spaces for restaurant valet.
Manager Response: Dear Serchnot,  We apologize that the room was not up to our routinely superior standard of cleanliness. Our housekeeping department is usually commended for their thorough service, with special attention to detail. I have shared your comments with the housekeeping manager to ensure that this is promptly addressed. Although it is true that parking can get pretty crowded when the hotel is experiencing a high-occupancy night, we are excited to offer valet service at no additional cost to our guests. We will always make sure that every guest has a parking space.

Summary Heading: Close to park entrance and room was nicely redone
Summary: I had a feeling of dread when we drove in and I recognized this place from years ago, but it's clearly been upgraded and improved.  The room was comfortable with two sinks and a large bedroom.  We were next to the elevator and I was pleased that we weren't kept up by noise at all.  The beds were comfortable and everything felt fresh and clean.  Internet worked well.  Free valet parking was very nice and parking fees were reasonable.  No breakfast but we just drove through the nearby McDonald's and that was fine.
Manager Response: Dear 737ede,   Thank you for your feedback! We are happy that you got to experience much of what our property has to offer. We look forward to being a part of your Disneyland Resort memories in the future. Thanks again!

Summary: We stayed at the G.L. On a Sunday and Monday night.  The hotel is less than a ten minute walk to the park entrance so it was very convenient.  Parking was inside the hotel area so the car was visible from the room. A 3:30 check in was very smooth and the staff was very polite.  Walking to our room, we noticed several parking valets and an abundance of housekeeping staff working and available to help.    Our room had two queen beds and was clean, functional.  Clean is key. There was a small refrigerator and microwave.  We did not use the heater/air conditioner so I have no comment on that.  The beds were older so they were a little past their comfort prime but we still slept fine.  I‚Äôve had worse beds for sure.  We brought a pillow and our own blanket so that helped with comfort.
Manager Response: Dear RonwC6859XK,  Thank you for your review and sharing your experience. Our whole staff genuinely cares about our guests and their well-being.. Hope that you had a magical time at the Disneyland Resort. Thanks again!

Summary: I booked this Hotel for Three reasons... The location, Having a 1 bedroom suite, a Rooftop Bar. 2 out of 3 isn't bad? Long story short, we expected (from my phone conversation during booking) that it was confirmed they did indeed have a rooftop bar which you could eat dinner, (our kids for free) and watch the fireworks. After a long day at Disneyland we came over to the hotel to check in and do just that, come to find out the rooftop bar was closed for a private event and in fact it has and will be booked every night for the month of December so we had no access to it and then come to find out that it is not even "part" of the hotel and they told me that I should have check "their" ( the 5tifthe website) which is the separate rooftop bar.  So we check in, went to our room and
Manager Response: Dear bruces7774LP:  Please let me apologize again for your less than perfect experience while staying at our property. It is our intention that each and every guest feels welcome and has an enjoyable time. In addition, guest safety is a top priority. While we do have private parties at our rooftop venue, please know before an event can be reserved, the booking party is made aware of our safety and behavior requirements.
