Manager Response: Dear Cathy D:  We are so happy your group had a good time! Traveling with so many people can be a challenge and we are glad we were able to assist. Valet and Hoang are great assets to the Grand Legacy Team. Thanks for staying with us and we look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: 3 room suite. Do not do it!!
Summary: We stayed in the 3 room suite at the grand legacy for Mother‚Äôs Day weekend. We usually get the 2 or 3 room suite at the Disneyland hotel and when we first arrived at the grand legacy we were so impressed. They let us into our room at 8 in the morning instead of making us wait till 3 like most hotels. When we got into the room we were so impressed! It is such a nice room! Totally comparable to the expensive Disneyland hotel 2 rooms suite and at a much lower cost. Then the night club right above it opened and our room was unbearable for the next 3 nights. First off we are not picky people. We can totally handle noise and thought that the club upstairs wouldn‚Äôt bother us that much since we usually stay out till midnight when the park closes. But there is ZERO installation between
Manager Response: Dear Angela S,  Thank you for your feedback. Reviews can be tough to read but they help us focus our attention to areas that need addressing. Please know that we understand this issue and it is under continual review for improvements. I was happy to read that you liked the room and that you received an early check-in. If you would like to discuss your visit further, please reach out to my colleague and she will be able to listen and assist you further. (Kerry Patterson at Kerry@grandlegacyhotel.com)  Again, thank you for your feedback and we do hope you had a great time at the Parks...

Summary: This hotel is closer than two of the three Disney owned hotels at a third of the price. If you want to be in "the Disney bubble", this is not the place for you. It is a short walk but one where you will pass people that are harmless but very up front about getting a handout from you.  Our room was on the second floor, near the pool. Generally it was quiet, but when trying to nap during the day we heard pool noise and on one occasion there were children running and shouting near our door late at night.The door is thin so you will hear every noise outside.  The classic room was big enough for two adults, but I can't imagine a family in one. Everything was clean and in great condition. Bed was soft and comfortable. Maybe a little too soft for me.  Pool area was very good. Large
Manager Response: Dear oversold_plus_2,  Thank you for your detailed feedback... We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us and we do review all aspects of what guests share with us. Thanks again and we look forward to your next visit with us...

Summary: Was here with the family for a Disney vacation hotel was nice. clean room great staff especially the valet his name was Hoang somebody had parked their car kind of close to mine it was a tight space to get out of he saw my frustration and came over and said I can take care of that sir and with ease he got my truck out for us. Good dude we wound up enjoying the rest of are day I would recommend staying at this hotel anytime.
Manager Response: Dear stupipater,  Thank you for the 5 out of 5 review! We are so happy you enjoyed your stay and that Hoang was there to help out in a tight spot... See you next time

Summary: My family and I visited Grand Legacy for the first time and we love the location, room, and friendly staff. Dora and Martha made us feel at home and both were very attentive to all of our requests. At night Daisy was very helpful! Thank you and we hope to see you guys soon.
Manager Response: Dear Stefs9191,  Thank you for the "Amazing" review! And I agree with you - Dora and Martha are great... Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts.  See you soon!

Summary: This has been our go to hotel at Disneyland for the past 7 years but our recent few stays have really seen a change for the worse. The location is great, only a few minutes from the park..but everything else has proved poor. First, parking is really bad now. We checked in a couldn't find a place to park, literally had to circle for 45 minutes. The rooms are clean, but that's about it...nothing updated and quite dingy.  They used to provide a nice breakfast, now they hand you a paper bag with an apple and bottle of water. We returned to our room at 3pm from being at the park and our room still wasn't serviced. I called to ask for more towels and the reposne was "they have until 4", not,I'm sorry and we will get right on it. So, normally I would recommend this hotel, now, I will
Manager Response: Dear EnglishTeach30,  Thank you for the feedback of your time with us. It is true - we have grown a lot over the years and some things are better and some we are continuing to work on. Please know we are remodeling rooms and have plans to remodel even more. If you would like to share more of your experience, please contact my colleague and she will listen and assist you further (Kerry Patterson at Kerry@GrandLegacyHotel.com) .  Thank you again and we hope you enjoyed your time at the Parks!

Summary: Was here on business. The valet Hoang was very knowledgeable about the area and helped me with some questions I had and brought me my vehicle promptly which was good cause I was pressed for time. Keep up the good work young manüëçüèª
Manager Response: Dear krisny18,  Thank you for the review! We appreciate your time and for the shout-out to Hoang...We hope to see you soon. Thanks again!

Summary: This place in great a location!!! It's is near the parks and has rooftop access to view the fireworks from the hotel. Employees are professional, freindly and courteous. Hoang from the valet was memorable. He went out of his way to answer my questions and help out with things to see and do nearby.
Manager Response: Dear Francisco N,  Thank you for the 5 out of 5 review! We hope you had a great time at the Disney Parks! See you again soon

Summary Heading: Save your money! Avoid like the plague!
Summary: Stayed in the ‚ÄúDeluxe‚Äù Room for three disappointing nights. Would hate to see what the ‚ÄúClassic‚Äù and ‚ÄúClassic Plus‚Äù rooms look like. The first room was a complete dump! It was so disgusting to the point where I asked for a new room, which I‚Äôve never done before. Cracked walls, muggy/damp smell the second you came in the room, ancient wall air conditioner, broken lock on room door, mini fridge was making this constant noise so we unplugged it, stains on the walls and chairs, disgusting bathroom, and to top it off a long black hair and a spot that resembled a drop of blood on my bed sheets. New room was slightly better, but still consisted of similar issues. Paper thin walls; very noisy.  Rock hard mattresses. Dirty, run down room. A little TLC goes a long way. Paint peeling off
Manager Response: Dear amyl9122018,  Thank you for your detailed feedback... We strive each day to improve and feedback helps us with that endeavor.  Please know that we have recently remodeled many rooms and more are being remodeled soon. It is a process and we would love for you to visit us again to see the improvements we have made. If you would like to discuss your visit further or see about staying in an updated room - we would be happy to listen and make arrangements for you. Please contact my colleague Kerry Patterson at Kerry@GrandLegacyHotel.com and she would be delighted to assist you.  Thank you for your time...

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable, great value for money and fantastic position to Disneyland
Summary: We were doing the 3 day pass at Disneyland so didn't expect to be in the room much apart from sleeping.  Modern and clean, very comfortable and extremely good value for money.  None of the usual bells and whistles we normally like, but that was not what we were after.  Great service and lovely rooftop bar with views of Disneyland perfect for viewing the fireworks at the end of the night.  Would stay there again
Manager Response: Dear TravelChickSA,  Thank you for the 5 out of 5 review! So happy you stayed with us and excited for your next visit!

Summary Heading: Perfect! Budget friendly and near the park
Summary: We stated at GLATP from 4/11-4/15, from the beginning the staff was accommodating (letting us check in early since we had arrived in California at 6:30 am from Hawaii) and being that it was so close to DL and DCA we would take a couple hour break during the day to nap or swim and go back at dinner time feeling refreshed! I definitely would return!
Manager Response: Dear Kale0nani,  Thank you for the review!  Happy we could accommodate your early arrival time - what a long flight! We hope you had a wonderful time in the Anaheim Resort! Thanks again and see you next time...

Summary: Very clean, convenient and the staff is very helpful and friendly. When visiting Disneyland we would not stay anywhere else!!! Close enough to take midday breaks and enjoy the pool or let the little ones take a nap.
Manager Response: Dear 981phila,  Thank you for the great review! We appreciate your feedback and honored to have you as one of our repeat guests.Thanks again and see you soon!

Summary Heading: Love staying at the Grand Legacy
Summary: We choose Grand Legacy at the Park as our #1 hotel when we visit Disneyland.  It‚Äôs a short walk to the park and they have a great pool.  The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly.  Rates are reasonable and there are specials for annual pass holders, military, etc.
Manager Response: Dear amyanholt,  Thanks for the 5 out of 5 review! We love our repeat guests! Hope you have lots of fun at the Disney Parks. Until next time...

Summary: This hotel had a great location and a close walk to Disney parks. Maybe a 10 min walk to the gates? The check-in and check out was easy, no problems. The parking is scarce. Beware of that. You may have to park far away from your room, if you can even get a spot. (They do have valet available) The room we stayed in looked newly renovated. It was clean. It had two beds, a small table with 2 chairs, tv on top of a dresser that had 3 drawers. There was a cabinet for hanging clothes, an ironing board and iron. Not much walking space but I don‚Äôt care about that. We had just 2 adults and a 4 year old. If you have more people than that the room would be pretty crowded. There were double sinks which didn‚Äôt allow for much counter top space but there were shelves underneath for your items.
Manager Response: Dear ou4real,  Thank you for your detailed review. We appreciate the information. Please know we want all of our guests to feel at home and should there ever be an issue during your stay - let us know and we will fix it. A nice shower after a day at the Parks is something to look forward to... I apologize that you did not have that here. Please contact me at Carlos@grandlegacyhotel.com if you would like to discuss your situation further. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: Just a five minute walk to the entrance. It has a lovely pool, front desk staff ok not really friendly but did their job well. Nice that our room was ready early. But when we walked in the room there was someone's hair elastic on the floor and hair in the bath tub. And worst of all the bathroom smelt moldy the entire 4 days even with the fan on.  Beds were fairly comfortable. Their to go bag consisted of a bottle of water, a granola bar, a bruised apple and a cheese string. The walls were super thin and we heard our neighbours clearly the entire time. The bar upstairs was super friendly, great drinks and food and good to watch the fireworks but very expensive.  Torn between 2-3 because of the walls and cleanliness.   Molly .
Manager Response: Dear Molly H,  Thank you for your review. We value feedback as it assists us in our focus for improvement. If you would like to discuss your situation further - please contact me at Carlos@grandlegacyhotel.com

Summary: My daughter and I came up here for her birthday to Disneyland and California ventures.   Hoang  what is the valley that took care of us not only did he give her special Disney ears but had a birthday card and candy sent to our room. He was nice and helpful put the sticker on our window lock us in the hotel then my sister came and he took care of her as well what excellent service
Manager Response: Dear Barbie G,  Thanks for the 5 out of 5 review! So happy to see you enjoyed our property and thanks for the shout-out for Hoang. Hoang is great! Thanks again and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We came to visit for a volleyball tournament staff very friendly. Parking at night is a hot mess! Really need to do way with valet parking and open it to guest. The bathroom vanity is so small it‚Äôs hard to get ready. The mirror is below the air-conditioner that‚Äôs above the sink so strange. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô8‚Äù and I could not see my head in it. I understand Disney is close but it‚Äôs not that nice for the price.
Manager Response: Dear Brian N Leah W,  Thank you for the review. We appreciate the feedback. Should you visit again, please contact me directly and I would be happy to assist in finding a room that would be better suited for your party. We all hope you had a great tournament!  Thank you...  (carlos@grandlegacyhotel.com)

Summary: The valet guys were very nice, the beds were clean but the mirror was so low we couldn‚Äôt see to get ready, old style air conditioner, we had 4 girls in a room and it was a nightmare getting ready it was so small
Manager Response: Dear  dslintz5,  Thank you for the review... We do value your feedback. Should you visit the area again - we would be happy to assist in getting a room type better suited for your party. The correct room type can make all the difference! We hope you all had a great time in the Anaheim Resort.

Summary: The hotel was nice, clean and very close to Disneyland for those who want to walk to the park.  Its close to a small market and many places to grab breakfast and or dinner.  The beds were comfy as well.
Manager Response: Dear Karen L,  Thank you for the 5 out of 5 review! We appreciate your feedback!  We hope to see you next time you visit the Anaheim Resort...

Summary Heading: Best hotel for grownups on a Disney trip
Summary: I absolutely recommend this hotel! We stayed there for 3 nights and all the staff was so nice! Especially our valet attendant Hoang! We loved the roof top bar to watch the Disneyland fireworks at Tiki Tuesday. Our restaurant waitress was awesome too! We enjoyed the drinks and the Hawaiian style food.
Manager Response: Dear aalfter,  Thank you for the great review! So happy your got to experience all our property has to offer. Tiki Tuesdays are so fun! We hope to see you next time - thanks again!

Summary: We've visited Disneyland several times and have stayed in various hotels along Harbor Blvd.  The Grand Legacy has been far and away the best experience we have had.  Everything was quick and easy and the staff was exceptionally helpful.  Especially Hoang at the valet service.  He was super friendly and went above and beyond expectations with his service.  We will return!
Manager Response: Dear generalstradingpost,  Thanks for the 5 out of 5 review! And a special thank you for being one of our repeat guests - can't wait to see you next time!

Summary: This was my families first vacation to Disney and it was everything we expected and more and thanks a lot in part to our hotel. As you drive in your greeted by an amazing extremely friendly valet staff who has any info you may need and always have a smile on. From there we walked in the lobby to happy, smiling faces who greeted us and even gave my daughter and niece Minnie ears which is where the magic began and their faces lit up. The rooms are very comfortable and the entire staff at the hotel is soooo helpful. The hotel is literally on the same block as Disney and they provide all details you may need. Another huge plus is the food and beverage options connected to the hotel which make grabbing a bite really easy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will be
Manager Response: Dear Francisco H,  Thank you so much for sharing your "Magical Experience" with us! We all strive each and every day to be wonderful part of your Disney memories. So happy you choose our property! Thank you!

Summary: Hoang at valet was fantastic. From the time we pulled in everything was taken care of. As we were ready to leave Hoang helped load the car and then I noticed I had a flat. I was ready to call AAA, but then Hoang offered to help me change it. Within in no time we had it changed and we were back on the road. Thanks for giving the extra effort of service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I surprised my wife with a quick getaway for her birthday. Julianna at the front desk from the moment of our arrival made us feel so comfortable and welcomed. She was helpful, friendly, and very accommodating. Our dinner at The Fifth was excellent. The staff there was also superb and more than accommodating. The complementary snack bags before the trip across the street to Disneyland were perfect.  We will definitely be back and hopefully bring the kids next time too.
Manager Response: Dear sjg333,  Thank you for sharing your feedback! Happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. And thanks for the shout-out for Julianna - we agree - she's great! Thanks and hope to see you again soon

Summary: My family stays at the Grand Legacy at the Park every year. We started staying because it‚Äôs locsted right across the street from a Disneyland. We continue to stay because of the accommodations and the great staff. Hoang is the Valet who will help get thinks done. Hoang is like having a right hand man onsite with you. Thank you Hoang and thank you Grand Legacy at the Park. We‚Äôll be back next year.
Manager Response: Dear jonnywiseblood,  Thanks for the 5 out of 5 review! We appreciate your feedback... And we think Hoang is awesome too! Can't wait to see you next year...

Summary: I stayed here the week of 04/06. The Hotel is in a great location and is vastly improved over the old Ramada that it used to be. The fist night we were there are room was not what we expected and the neighbors fighting kept us up most of the night. The next day we asked if we could pay for an upgraded room even if it meant moving a couple times throughout our stay. The front desk moved us to a very nice room with no charge! That was above anything I could have asked for. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good place to stay near the park. Thanks again to the great staff.
Manager Response: Dear charliedodge,  Thank you for your review and feedback. We appreciate your time and information. Also, happy that we were able to assist with your neighbor situation so it didn't affect your energy for Disneyland! We look forward to your next visit with us...thanks again!

Summary: Perfect hotel for a weekend get away with friends, one block away from Disneyland main entrance, which was wonderful after extremely long days in the park.  We stayed in a classic double room, it was dated, and could use some updating, but it was clean and served the purpose.  With long park hours, we probably only spend under 20 hours in our room over 4 days.  Simply there to sleep, bed was hard but we were too tired to care. All in all great hotel, great location, friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear cjeanelle,  Thank you for the review... We appreciate your feedback! I am happy to report that many of the Classic rooms have been remodeled (they are called Classic Plus now). It sounds like you had a great time at the Parks and we look forward to your next visit to the Anaheim Resort

Summary: Stayed at the Grand Legacy. It‚Äôs a hotel. Not much to say about it really except that it‚Äôs close to Disneyland so who really cares about the room itself. If your spending any time in it you‚Äôre doing it wrong. But the real highlight of the place is Hoang! The dude is the valet and he‚Äôs an absolute lifesaver. We got it on a very early flight and booked it to the hotel to try to get into the park at opening. Hoang was super helpful immediately. Helped us with bag check and was really patient as we fumbled through our things trying to get from travel to park mode. But the next day he went over the top with the customer service. My phone charger wasn‚Äôt working. Hoang got one out of his own car and gave it to me for free. The dude is dope. End of story.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My initial impression was the room was nicely decorated, but too small for 2 beds. We were in a premium suite with 2 beds, but it would not be large enough for more than the 2 people we had. The desk staff wasn't very friendly, each time we approached it felt like we were interrupting or putting them out in some way. I didn't feel comfortable interacting with any of them. I booked through Trip Advisor and ended up being charged twice (with one pending to drop off), but was also officially charged  $50 more than my booking total (not including parking).  Overall the experience was mediocre, which was ok because we spent most of our time at the park. Room was not big enough if we had kids with us because the only place they'd have to play would be the beds, and it would have been
Manager Response: Dear Ashlee_Bippus,  Thank you for your review - Your feedback is important and has been shared with the appropriate managers. If you wish to discuss your stay further, please contact me at Carlos@grandlegacyhotel.com. We hope you had a great time at the Disneyland Resort...

Summary: across the street from DL.  clean and service is awesome.  They used to serve a light breakfast but have since chased to an apple + in a bag.  TOO BAD!!!!!   Still though, it can't be too bad since my wife and I have stayed there for about 30 years.  (iy used to be ramada main gate)
Manager Response: Hello rudy v,  Thank you for your response. We are happy to have had you and are grateful that you took the time to provide us with feedback. We are delighted to know that you were pleased with the rooms, and hope that you will allow us to serve you again in the near future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We have always walked by this hotel and wondered how it was. I am so happy we decided to stay here. It was super duper close to the park, Staff was so friendly, and room was perfect. I loved how the front desk called to see how we liked the room soon after we arrived. Also a major bonus was the fridge and microwave in room! We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer N,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I only spent one night here, but the room was clean, and the service was great! Parking proved to be difficult if you were trying to self park, but thankfully the valet service is fantastic! Hoang even took me to my car to grab a few things that I had forgotten the night before. Great service!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay in the three bedroom suite.  We splurged and were not disappointed.  But the highlight of the trip was when our SuperShuttle left us stranded because we arrived four minutes in between the window of 5:40-5:55... we arrived at 5:44 a.m.  Hoang, the valet, explained the company does that frequently and without me even asking, he was already on the phone calling another service to pick us up so we would not miss our 8 a.m. flight.  He literally saved the day!  And I was not very pleasant to be around when this was happening, yet he continued to keep an open, calming dialogue with us and actually helped me calm down and feel better.  I cannot thank him enough.  We cannot wait to return so we can see Hoang again and thank him appropriately!!!
Manager Response: Hello THEdisneyfamily4ever,  Thank you so much for reviewing us on tripadvisor. We are very fortunate to have Hoang on our team and I am so glad to hear that he was a great help to you.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I stayed 3 nights in a new Tower Room with double beds on the 3rd floor.  The rooms are still in new condition.  There were plenty of towels and pillows per bed.  The beds are comfortable and the a/c cools the room as it should.  We did not use maid service, and kept the do not disturb sign on the door while we were in the park.  We did not pick up a breakfast snack sack, but I understand it still contains the same items:  water, granola bar, apple, and string cheese bar.  The only issue we experienced were the elevators being down one day.   We were there with a handicapped friend, and her dad had to carry her down 3 flights of stairs.  This also happened during the last visit also.  I still don't understand why they have handicapped rooms on upper floors, especially with all
Manager Response: Hello TxNurse,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize about the elevator being down. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The walk to Disneyland was about 5 mins, that was probably one of the most valuable things this hotel offered.  The pool was a ton of fun for the kids and usually pretty empty. We enjoyed meals once or twice at the tables set up in the pool area. The breakfast was handy, but very basic and not the freshest ingredients. But very convenient to have! The room it was served in was very busy and sometimes difficult to get a table.  The lounge restaurant was neat to visit. Fireworks in view because of the rooftop location. Service and food was OK.  Rooms were clean but older. Beds were comfortable and the fridge was very handy to have (we packed lunches and snacks almost everyday for the park). We didn't stay in the new tower, but the one on the other side of the parking lot.  Lots of
Manager Response: Hello Carissa C,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The room was absolutely disgusting!! carpet was coming up and was filthy. The room was dusty and unclean. Bathtub was peeling and stained. There was mould around the ceiling in the bathroom. remote control was filthy. I have read other reviews that mention the grab and go breakfast.. however we were never told about this. Would have been nice to know considering we walked to the Cove to buy breakfast every morning. I would not recommend this location to anyone.  The only positive is that the pool is nice and the location is great but there are many other hotels that are closer to the park entrance. They were doing renovations when we were there and the renovated rooms look much nicer. Would have been nice to have had a nicer room that I wanted to go back to at the end of the

Summary: It was the first time that we got to go on vacation with all 5 of us, and so of course we chose Disney. The location to the Disney Parks was perfect. The pool gets a 5 star rating from my kids, and the Grab and Go bag in the morning was exactly what we needed for our day in the parks. We got an older room, but because of the size of our party they gave me one of the larger corner deluxe queen suites. It was perfect. 2 queen beds, a double hide a bed, corner suite so there was lots of room for 2 adults, a 14, 13 and 11 year old.   Thanks for the AMAZING time!!!
Manager Response: Hello Alexis B,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again soon when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: As I write this we can‚Äôt sleep because of the noisy bar
Summary: We are directly under a super noisy bar called The Fifth, and my son and I can‚Äôt sleep. It sounds like there are noisy drunk people sitting right beside our bed and they are swearing away and shouting while my 6 year old tries to sleep. We were not told this at all when they checked us in, only that we wouldn‚Äôt be able to see the fireworks. It‚Äôs so disappointing as this was our last chance to see Disneyland and I saved all year to be close to the park. There is no security on the windows and people are constantly walking by so you have zero privacy too, because the only window opens up right on to the parking lot, full of people. If you keep the curtAins closed the room is almost black.   It‚Äôs gotta be one of the worst hotel experiences in my life. So even though the price might
Manager Response: Hello Iheartvancouver,  Thank you for your review with Tripadvisor. I apologize for any inconveniences you experienced while staying with us. Improvements is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: FANTASTIC!!  GREAT PLACE,  WONDERFUL STAFF,  HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT
Summary: My family and I had a great time at this hotel. We stayed for 3 days and the staff was great, friendly, very informative and just plain fun to be around. The valet even told us where to watch the Disney fireworks our first night there as the FIFTH was not open. It is a short walk to disney,  there is a menu in the room with several resturants to order food from delivered to the room prices were on the menu no guess work. plus several food places within walking distance. Really clean  and just an overall great experience we had the deluxe queen room and it was good  for the 4 of us there refrigerator and microwave came in handy and the snack bag to take in the park helped a lot. I did not hear any noise from the bar on the nights it was open. We had no problems with this hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place for a Disneyland Trip
Summary: We stayed here five nights and were very pleased with our stay. We got a premier room in the back of the hotel and it was perfect for us. Rooms were clean and comfortable and staff was kind, courteous and prompt. Short walk to Disney which made it nice to come back and forth throughout the day, and one of us could go back early to put the little ones down, while the other stayed with the older kids. It saves so much time to be walking distance to the park, and not have to deal with parking and the tram. We had lots of fun in the pool and enjoyed the hot tub. The little bagged snack in the morning was nice, I would just want a little more variety as we stayed so long and the same thing got old quickly. But, overall we were happy and would stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a two room family suite.Very nice.The staff was very helpful and friendly. The location to Disneyland was great. Less than a 5 min walk to the front gate. With several restaurant only foot steps away. looking forward to my next stay. .
Manager Response: Hello rdr698,  Thank you so much for your kind words and great ratings. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for choosing our hotel.     Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Had a deluxe room with a king bed.  When daughter decided to join us we realized there was a sofa bed in the room also.  Room size was nice, didn't feel cramped.  The pool looked really nice, but the cold weather kept me out others were swimming and enjoying the hottub. This is now our go to hotel when going to Disneyland.  It is located so close.
Manager Response: Hello ld mom,  Thank you for the great ratings and for reviewing our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again in the near future.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Right across the street. Closer then parking and taking the tram. Prices are comparable and rooms aren‚Äôt bad. No breakfast but sack with snacks you can take in the park. Parking is not fun but staff is nice and rooms are clean.
Manager Response: Hello Pamela G,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Good location is the only good thing about this hotel. The hot tub is nice, but rooms are pretty bare minimum and the hotel staff service was average. We only stayed here for the convenience of being close to Disneyland which was nice.
Manager Response: Hello WilsonLin,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for staying with us. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location easy walk to park
Summary: Let me start off by saying we were not in a newly remodeled room, however it was clean and not expensive. They offer pass holder discounts. There is no breakfast included but they do give a snack bag with water apple nut bar string cheese. The staff is very nice  everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. We did not visit the roof top restaurant but it looked like a great place to be for summer fireworks.
Manager Response: Hello Mary C,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, kind and helpful staff; but stay in an upgraded room.
Summary: The location of this property can't be beat, along with the concept that they permit you to park more than one vehicle (with a per-day cost); whereas most hotels in the area only permit 1 vehicle per room.  The front desk staff was very kind and helpful, check-in and check-out were both a breeze.  We arrived prior to check-in on a Tuesday and we had decided to spend two days at DL and DCA rather last minute.  They had no problem with us parking a little early and pre-checking us in, and just explained that we would have to return after leaving the park to pick up our keys.  The agent was able to tell us our room number so that we could park closer to the room, which worked out perfectly and we parked directly in front of it.  The air conditioning/heating unit, while affixed to
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer M,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated. I will forward this email to the department heads.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First off, we took a chance and wanted to give the newly remodeled hotel a try. The staff was nice. We had a nice young man walk us to the remodeled King suite to see if we preferred that over the un-remodeled room. For the extra charge, we accepted the upgrade. When we return to the lobby they informed us the room is no longer available and we would now have an original room. On the first floor. It was old and dirty and has no sound proofing. I could hear the man snoring next door. Their kids were up late and crying before the sun came up. The bathrooms are nasty. The ac unit is above the sink in the bathroom area. If you are shorter than 5‚Äô8‚Äù, good luck trying to reach the controller. The hair dryer was covered in dirt. The light switches look like they have never been
Manager Response: Hello,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the concerns you and your family experienced at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location to visit Disneyland Paris
Summary: You can't beat the location, but you probably can find better rooms elsewhere. The lobby was very nice and the staff was friendly and very accommodating however we thought the rooms could be better especially the bathroom. Whoever put the shower in forgot to use a level. It's is slanted and felt like you were standing on a mound and when it's wet, it's really a strange feeling. Add to the the shower head and faucet were not attached properly and pulled away when you touched them.  It just could have been better
Manager Response: Hello Friar79,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing us.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: All above a great place to stay. Location, cleanliness, and price and parking very good. Would and have stayed many more times. Great discounts for Disneyland  annual pass holders! Only a 5 min walk to the front gates of the parks
Manager Response: Hello karipetrovich,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel during a recent trip to Disneyland. The location is very convenient (Across the street from the Disneyland entrance). The reason I am writing this review is because I found the staff to be very professional sympathetic helping me deal with a problem. They listened to me and responded very quickly to my concerns. This was customer service at it's best!! Great experience. We will be back.
Manager Response: Hello tubtop993,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: VERY PLEASED it was everything it was supposed to be!!!!!
Summary: I have read some of the negative reviews and feel so sorry for those people who did not have the same SUPERB time here as we did!!! This hotel was recommended by our eldest daughter's friend who had stayed here and although those comments were positive, it is always a bit of a gamble booking places on-line which you  know nothing about. Fortunately, all was great!  From the time we were let off at the door the staff was constantly courteous and friendly without any condescension. They seemed truly interested that we were staying with them. We stayed in the front three level section which has the two-bedroom "suites". The room's entrance was into the smaller and somewhat narrower room which had a table  and chairs, a (pull-out) couch and a chair with a wall-mounted flat-screen
Manager Response: Hello Doug W,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I will never stay at this hotel ever again. The music was ridiculous! Dragging furniture &  drunk patrons using the same elevators as the hotel guests!!! Trying to start a fight in the elevator with children on board! The hide-a-bed & rollaways were garbage...very painful.  The staff at the counter were trying to say that they were not responsible for the night club up on the 5th floor, how does that happen???? We should have read the disclaimer on line saying there would be noise????? Really???? It doesn't work that way...two business in one building???? The room was not that clean... I love going to DL...our stay at this hotel definitely cast a shadow.  Make your choice.....family hotel or night club. Those two don't match up!
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer R  We apologize for the experience you and your family encountered. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. Please know that your comments were addressed and please know that we have security that will help prevent any issues that may arise. Again, we apologize for the inconveniences during your stay and hope you will give us another opportunity.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I stayed here with my 4yr old granddaughter for one night while we spent 2 days in Disneyland. Freeway 5 access is vey easy coming and leaving. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the crosswalk at the Disney entrance. The Front Desk staff was very friendly and helpful. They were able to check me in early this day and I was in my room within 10 minutes of getting to the hotel.  The room was very clean, it had a refrigerator for our use. The heating/air conditioner was an older model- not central air/heating. It was located near the vanity area of the sink, but it had a remote control that was used to change the settings. The tub and toilet are separate from the sink and vanity- makes it easier to get ready if you have multiple people. There was a nice table and chairs to sit at for
Manager Response: Hello Lucienneh,  We appreciate your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed in in early January for six nights. Foolishly in hindsight I booked the two bedroom family suite. Since these are in the front tower we got the hideous nightmare that is ‚ÄòThe Fifth‚Äô directly above our room.  Bad enough getting confronted every night by the staff manning the event table in the lobby as to our eligibility to use the lift to get to our room, but once up the the horror was intense. The ‚Äòmusic‚Äô was so loud our windows actually vibrated. Sleep was virtually impossible until the thumping eventually stopped which was never before midnight and weekends it was 1am. Then before 8am the next day we had the pleasure of listening to furniture being dragged all over the floor. Either that or a herd of elephants was breakfasting above us. It was useless to complain
Manager Response: Karen K,  Thank you for your comments with TripAdvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department managers have been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and I apologize that we have not yet been able to fix this. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Updated look but a little disappointed.
Summary: We stayed here 3 different times when it was the Ramada Inn Main gate and it was a decent place to stay. clean rooms and very close to Disney. Just returned from a week at Disneyland and I have to say the new look of the Grand Legacy was impressive at first then we pulled into the parking and let them know we would be checking in and the first thing they said was it it $15/day to park. Well that little tidbit was not told to us when we booked. Well what can you do....you pay the $15/day. Oh but they don't have enough parking for the amount of rooms because now with the renovation they have put a night club on the roof top of the new addition and they seem to cater more to the patrons of the club than the occupants of the hotel. Now the rooms....the new addition has one elevator
Manager Response: CClifford505,  Thank you for your review. We apologize for the experience you and your family encountered at our hotel. Our goal is to meet the needs of every guest that stays with us, and we regret that we were not able to do so for your family. We have other great rooms away from The Fifth. We hope that as we continue to improve our services, that you will allow us another opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here for years....even when it was a Ramada. We have always loved the convenience to the park and the reasonable rates.  We are super happy they remodeled...it was looking very tired.   Lots of folks gripe about GL not having a breakfast anymore...yep, it‚Äôs gone...but the snack bag is still pretty great. A bottle of water, granola bar, string cheese and an apple was perfect for us. It kept us fed until lunchtime. If you want a full breakfast...go to Denny‚Äôs or IHOP just down the street.  We had a room with 2 queen beds, plus fridge, microwave and small 1-cup coffee maker. It was just fine and plenty of room. It was very clean and nicely decorated.   Dual vanity sink was nice and there were lots of outlets throughout the room.   The shower was wonderful after a
Manager Response: Hello gryhnd-lvr,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and we appreciate you being a loyal guest.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Great location, nice friendly staff, rooms are good only issue we had we the walls are really thin we was up all night listening to a child cry for 5 hrs so not much sleeping. But like I said great location:-)
Manager Response: Hello Gemma B,  Thank you for your feedback, we are happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. It was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: House of Blues keeps you up all night!!
Summary: Used to be a favorite for our Disneyland visits. Now House of Blues is across the street. Loud music blares late into the night. Management needs to work with other area leaders to get this under control. We will not be back.
Manager Response: Hello,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the experience you had at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Couldn't be happier with the location of this hotel. 5 minute walk from the park and the Garden Walk Mall and within walking distance of many different restaurants. My only problem with the hotel is the 5th floor club that is upstairs of the lobby. We stayed across the parking lot but on the weekend you could still here the music playing well into the night. However this was a small downside in another wise awesome stay!
Manager Response: Hello Dylan P,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I would stay here again in a minute! Perfect location. It‚Äôs literally just as close as the Disney Hotels. Beds were comfy, clean. Amenities were good. Plenty of places to eat nearby. My only complaint, the shower wasn‚Äôt very hot. Also, if it‚Äôs a weekend, it‚Äôs a little noisy due to the night club. The staff was super helpful and friendly and helped us with every request! We will be back for sure! Great price and great location!
Manager Response: Hello Heather S,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and great ratings. We hope to see you again when your travel bring you back to the area.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in a great location
Summary: I just returned from my 4 night stay for business in the Disneyland area. The hotel is in a great location if you are planning a trip to Disneyland with your family, it's right across the street from the park entrance. The rooms are spacious, fairly clean and the beds are comfortable, they also had complimentary wifi in the room.
Manager Response: Hello P M,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We were checked in by Kerry at the front desk. She was professional and courteous. It was a very smooth process and we really felt welcomed. Later we passed by her in the parking lot and she stopped to ensure our room was up to standards and asked if there was anything else she could do for us. The room was clean and in good condition. It's a great location being right across from Disneyland's main entrance. We had a great view of Disney in the evening on the rooftop bar. At check-out Joy helped us. She was so kind and efficient. They really treated us like family there.
Manager Response: Hello 974marin,    Thank you so much for this great review. I am happy to hear that Kerry and another team member were very helpful to you. We do our best in providing great customer service to all of our guests. Kerry provides exceptional service and is an excellent example for her team to follow. We are very fortunate to have her on board.   Thanks again and we look forward to your next visit.  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Best Stay at Disneyland - Luxury Rooms!
Summary: Over the years, my family and I have stayed in almost every hotel on Harbor Blvd and each of the 3 Disney properties.  We usually come away very disappointed either because of expense or conditions of hotel- not the case with Grand Legacy‚Äôs new bldg‚Äôs rooms.  We were on 3rd floor, facing rear and rooms were amazingly clean, modern and in perfect condition.  We had 2, 2 queen rooms which I request adjoining but was told they did not have (or were not available) but we were next to each other.  While not hugely spacious (4 adults would have been tight), rooms very adequate for our 4 night stay.  Close enough for frequent returns to rest, as is just across street from Harbor and Disney Way.  Great food options at bottom of bldg( Pizzatarian and Jimboy‚Äôs Taco‚Äôs) as well as small
Manager Response: Hello lkrause,  Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your kind comments and your observations. We do listen to our guests and their valuable feedback assists us in making operational modifications and service enhancements. 	  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Loved it here. Rooms are clean and updated. Beds were really comfy. Very close to park. They even serve a snack lunch in a bag! Really close to more food options too. Had a great pool in the middle of compound.
Manager Response: Hello rambuncious,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My family and I stayed here for three nights first off for convenience.  The hotel is right across from the main Disney entrance and is only a five minute walk.  We were pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was.  Everything was clean, the rooms were nice, and the staff was excellent.  Every single staff member would say hi to us from the housekeepers, to the front desk, and even the valet packers!  The front desk even made my 5yr old feel special by giving him crayons and a picture for their coloring contest.  Great place!
Manager Response: Hello Shawn O,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a great stay with us. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Great for our needs. Rooms were fine although beds were harder than hard and pillows weren't the best.  Thin walls - kids running down the hallway late at night kept us up until midnight one night which says more about poor parenting than the hotel.  Also, the construction/renovation started on the room directly above ours at 8am sharp and was VERY audible in our room.  Another time, while I would stay here again, I would bring my own pillows.
Manager Response: Hello Maren L,  On behalf of our entire staff, we apologize for the concerns you experienced at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: You won't be able to sleep due to noise
Summary: You're considering this hotel?  Keep scrolling on by.  Don't be fooled by thinking this option is "good enough" and "what could go wrong?"  I thought the same thing.  When Park Vue was sold out (we needed a suite to fit 3 kids + two adults), I made a reservation here.  Checked in at night and was immediately warned by the front desk (who looked a little bit afraid - foreshadowing) that "it might be a little loud, there's a band playing."  No big deal, I've stayed in resorts in Mexico and Hawaii with a faint band playing in the distance.  I'm not a wuss.  I blew it off.    Got to our room (4th floor) and the room was shaking with music. The bass was pounding through every square inch of the room.  I swore it almost shook the TV.  We went to dinner.  Came back, just as bad.  Front
Manager Response: Hello pdxmommytraveler,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated. We offer other great accommodations away from that building. We hope that you will give us another opportunity to better serve you.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: When we first arrived we were delighted by the proximity to Disneyland, just a short walk. Once we found our way to our room....The disappointment set in, very small, very dark, broken chair,strange urine smelling oder, and very noisy air conditioner.  Sometimes great location isn't everything, especially when there are so many great hotels to choose from.
Manager Response: Hello Monica P,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at Grand Legacy At The Park we would like to apologize for the issues you encountered at our hotel.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.  It is only a 6 minute walk to the gates at Disney from hotel.  We had one of the upgraded rooms and found it to be good.  I'd say it's a solid 3 star room.  Did not have any issues with noise but I always run the fan on continuous to help with that.  The breakfast snack pack is a good touch if you trying to make it for park opening.  You do have to pay for parking but that's California for you.  I'm happy with staying here and would do it again.
Manager Response: Hello SDDC11,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a great stay with us. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at a handful of hotels on harbor dr.  We like the location! As annual pass holders, it's easier than driving back down to San Diego and we can enjoy amenities. We stayed oct 30th and drove our car right up to our room... To our room Right next to the housekeeping laundry room on the first floor. We thought that would be a nuisance but it turned out not to be too bad... And the first floor access with the stroller and access to harbor drive was great and better than being tucked back in the back of the hotel. You are in the park 90% of the day and this was a comfortable, upgraded, clean spot to lay our heads for the night. I'll definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice big rooms and great location
Summary: We had a room with 4 Queen Beds, just recently updated.  Downside is only one bathroom and a mirror shortage.  We did mention this to the front desk and said they are working to add some more mirrors.  Literally 1 block from front gate entrance of Disneyland and California Adventure.    There is no coffee to be purchased on premises, just fyi.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm currently a guest at this hotel. I travel very frequently and normally stay at another hotel where I receive loyalty rewards. having stayed over 100 nights at hotels this year alone, I consider myself an expert traveler. lol  This hotel is very clean, newly renovated, quiet and very comfortable. You cannot beat the location if you're here for Disney unless you stay at the Disney hotels. It's a 5 minute walk to the Disney gates.   The staff is awesome. So friendly and helpful. I arrived early, so they did a pre-check in for me. I was able to park my car and leave my things.   The room is very spacious and all new. Beautiful.  They do not offer breakfast but they gove you a snack bag every morning. I would suggest that they deliver these to the rooms rather than have guests
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Decent hotel with an identity crisis
Summary: This hotel has a decision to make. It wants to be a family friendly location, right across the street from Disneyland. But it also wants to be a destination for evening entertainment with a bar/club atop the front building. Guess what? That's a crappy combination. Nothing but noise every night from the thump thump of the music to the loud, presumably drunk guests stumbling back to their rooms. If GL wants to be everything to everyone, they really should invest in some sound proofing and consider  either reduced rates for the rooms that are closer to the club (fat chance) or putting families in rooms as far away as possible. (Also unlikely and probably not helpful considering the entire property is an echo chamber.)  All that said - the hotel room itself was comfortable, the
Manager Response: Hello traveling_solo76,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the issue you encountered with The Fifth, our rooftop restaurant and bar. Please know that we do have other accommodations away from the rooftop restaurant and bar. We appreciate the feedback and thank you for staying with us.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This is our second time staying at the Grand Legacy! As long as they keep they‚Äôre prices below others in the area we will continue to stay here! The staff was friendly and having food and a store in front of hotel was a great convenience.
Manager Response: Hello M H,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First off I'll make sure to start with the positive so as to not sound like a bitter customer. The location is fantastic! Super close to Disneyland. Closer then all the on property hotels except Grand Californian obviously. The room itself seemed clean enough.  First of all, parking is a huge issue here. It's not free, and it wasn't marketed as such, so don't get me wrong. I just think people who go here should know that. They have this roof top lounge that they talk up. Be aware, they rent it out also. It was closed to us while we were there for private parties. What this also does is impact parking in the hotel. So they're basically double booking their parking. When we arrived at 8pm the parking lot was full. And I'm not talking "oh man, all the spaces are taken" kinda full.
Manager Response: Hello Carl H,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. Regarding parking, we do not allow The Fifth patrons to park on site at the hotel. They have to park at Anaheim Garden Walk. The parking was very busy due to being sold out and due to Tony Romas being busy as well. We do offer Valet parking as a service due to limited parking on site and which is part of the daily parking fee. There is not an additional cost to valet your vehicle. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Once a great hotel but now they have become arrogant.
Summary: We have stayed at these premises over 5 times in the past few years however this will be our last visit. The staff are rude, lazy and arrogant, (but I should have been prepared for  that after contacting the head of front counter Byron via email and phone and never receiving a reply) I asked for a room with a view and was given one facing the elevator, upon bringing it to the attention of Jonathon I was told sorry fully booked, when I said I wasn't happy he just ignored me. Car parking costs $15+ tax a day, that's ok but there are no parking spaces available but they still take your money. Valet parking is for free, rubbish how is it for free when the valet expects a tip for parking and retrieving your car ? If I am paying you the $15 + for parking I expect a parking spot. Room
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I continue to stay at this hotel
Summary: I have been staying at this hotel multiple times per year for the last 15 years.  There are many reasons why I continue to stay here: The management and front desk will take care of you. The location is PERFECT for its proximity to Disneyland. The swimming pool is the best around. There are many restaurants in walking distance, including some in the front of the hotel. The rooms are quiet, clean, and comfortable.  Have I paid them enough compliments?!  I will continue to stay at this hotel in the future.  Please feel free to ask me any questions, and I will try to respond.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at hotel for 2 nights. Room was dated but clean. Price was okay compared to other nearby hotels. The only unpleasant issue was the room had a urine smell. Hindsight we should have notified front desk as it was quite strong despite leaving windows open to air out. Unfortunately by the time we got back from park on first day we were just too tired. Likely would stay somewhere else next trip to Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It‚Äôs clean.    It‚Äôs a lace to sleep.   Air conditioners are noisy.  Pool is not very warm at this time of year.   The reason you stay here is that the Disney parks are one block away.   Spend your time at the parks.   Come back to sleep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at the Grand Legacy 5-6 times over the last couple of years and the stays are consistently great. Very clean place, nice beds, friendly staff, pillows are way too big for my neck though.  Walk to the parks is pretty close, half a block from crosswalk to main entrance. They have changed breakfast a bit, you get a bag now with water, fruit, cheese, and granola. There is a rooftop lounge that has a full bar-you can watch the fireworks from there with a pretty decent view and they pipe in the music. A colleague was staying at the same time I was and in the main building and could hear a lot of foot traffic near the elevator. I have stayed in many rooms, never in the main complex, and have never heard any excessive noise.   I keep coming back for a reason-solid stays,
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay if you are visiting Disney. This is my second time and plan on returning again. I've only stayed in the back section, next time I'm gonna try for the tower. The staff is always friendly. I just wish they had a rewards program for returning guests. I did ask the Front Desk about one though and she said they are working on one!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This hotel gets a bad wrap, it was great!
Summary: I was apprehensive to book based off of negative reviews about unfriendly staff, etc etc. We had no problems with the staff. They were extremely helpful upon check in and any other time I spoke with them. Other negative comments I read were complaints about the snack bag. The snack bag was great. They clearly state there is no free breakfast, so the snack bag is just an awesome perk and we LOVED it. If you want a quiet room, don't book right underneath the Fifth. Friends of ours did, but the staff warned them before booking that the room would be under the bar and there will likely be extra noise and nicely asked if that was okay with them. There is a great sized mini fridge and microwave. The pool looked nice, we didn't use it. We also didn't use the internet...we were at the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We usually have favorite locations to stay near the park, but they were all full due to RunDisney.  We had noticed this hotel close to the entrance and thought we would give it a try. The location of this hotel is great after a long day at the parks. It is also convenient if you want to run back, rest a bit and then hit the parks for the evening activities. The room was clean and had plenty of space.  The bathroom was also clean with plenty of towels. The breakfast bags are not quite as appealing as the hot breakfast we are accustomed to, but fit the bill this trip ~ granola bar, cheese stick, apple.  Overall we would stay here again, clean, great location, but the price was a little high compared to other locations with a little more of a walk, although that may have been due
Manager Response: none

Summary: We did a pre-check in and were surprisingly upgraded to a 2 room suite with a park view!  Score!  The room was great.  Comfy beds, great shower, and there was a keurig-type coffee maker.  Check in staff and housekeeping staff were very friendly.  Location to the park was great!  Can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Grand Legacy at the Park - best part is the location
Summary: The best thing about this hotel is the location to the park and since we got there really early in the morning, we were able to find two parking spots.  After spending half the day at Disneyland, we attempted to check in at 3pm for our two-room two queen/sofa bed suite -- however we were advised that housekeeping forgot to clean/prepare our room so we had to wait another half hour.  We were exhausted from being in the park so the extra wait was an inconvenience. We stayed in the newer tower and the room was decent, but I soon came to realize that the sofa bed was total unusable for sleeping as is - the 4" mattress was 99% springs and sunk in the middle. We needed three beds, which is why I booked that room. The staff brought two cot mattresses to put on top of the sofa bed
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location in reference to Disney is great, short walking distance to cross the street. There are nearby restaurants such as Denny's & Tony Romas. We had a second story room that gave us good views of the Disney fireworks show. The restaurant/bar atop the main building offers even better views of the fireworks. There is a charge for parking and the spaces are a bit tight. Valet parking is offered also. Our room was average size, two beds, plenty of towels and the mini fridge kept items cold. Air conditioning was fine. We would consider this venue again for our next visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There were mixed reviews on this hotel and I cannot see why. We had a 5 night stay for Disney and it was awesome. The rooms were great with two large beds and a huge bathroom. The pool was awesome and my kids loved swimming there after Disneyland. The front staff and ground staff were all helpful and friendly. We were able to park there before check in and go for a walk and the car park felt secure. Coin operated laundry and vending machines made it great for travelling with kids. We were in the back building so didn't notice any noise from the rooftop restaurant, and could see the fireworks from our room. There are restaurants and a convenience store at the front of the hotel and all around including Denny's and Ihop etc. In the morning you get a breakfast bag with a water,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worst managerial staff ever. Not a pleasant stay.
Summary: Over charged for 1 extra day. Manager would not return calls. Left plenty of messages at front desk. No response. Even though reservation had free breakfast, there was no free breakfast. Only thing it has going for it is that it is close to Disney. Save your money. Book somewhere else.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is nice and close to the main gate of Disneyland and was very clean.  We had 3 nights in the hotel and 1 night in the motel section and both were great.  Prices were a bit high but everything is around this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Location can't be beat for the price.  To-go breakfast is minimal, but a huge time-saver in that you can take it and eat while waiting in line to enter the park on busy mornings.  Pool is clean (very chlorinated!).  Rooms are clean but outdated.  For the price, it cant be beat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just stayed a few nights and I got little to no sleep. This place has gone through a big remodeling and no one seemed to have taken into consideration the walls are paper thin. We could hear conversions coming from all of the surrounding rooms. On top of that, the beds are hard as a rock. Back when it was the Ramada, there was plenty of parking spaces without valet and a decent breakfast. Now there are hardly any open spaces and a snack bag for breakfast! Oh and its double the price per night.. That will probably be our last time at this place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My room was beautiful, very modern. The staff ,especially Daisey, was great. I will alswyas stay her for Disney races. It is a short waslk to the parks. Thank you Grand Legacy for again a wonderful stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was super close to Disneyland and we got a great price. Not super updated, had a double queen room, you could tell it was older but no smells or anything like I read in other reviews. They really really need more outlets though!! Lol my family and I had to fight to charge our devices! Housekeeping did a great job! Front desk staff were friendly! Suited our needs for a good price. Was a bit worried about some of the things I heard in the reviews of bugs and smells but they were not accurate thank goodness! Would definitely stay again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to park and nice accomodations
Summary: This is my second stay at this hotel.  First time was in a basic room at the back of the property which was nice, but this time we stayed in a 3 room suite in the new tower.  Very nice and plenty of room for our family.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Slight delay with check in as our suite was not ready so we had an extra wait, but after it was ready the rest of our stay was easy and enjoyable.  Nice location just across from Disneyland.  Easy walk and no need to take a shuttle which is especially nice with kids a stroller. We will come back to this hotel again on another Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The staff was very friendly and helpful. My family has a great time at The FIFTH, live music, great food and fireworks = Awesome! Very close to Disneyland and other food options. An affordable option for families who want the Disney experience without spending a fortune. My family will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location is great.  It's located next to restaurants and very close to Disneyland.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The room was old and you could tell so by the floors and walls.  The walls are thin, as expected.  It served it's purpose as somewhere to lay your head.  It does have cable and spotty Wi-Fi, but if you are there for Disney, you will rarely be in the room. We did not go to the pool, but the pool looked pretty big, they had a jacuzzi and a spray park area.  We also did not go to the 5th.   A nice treat was that in the morning you can get a bag to take with you.  It has an apple, granola bar & water.  The only suggestion there, is to change it up a bit.  We had those the 1st 2 days and for the 3rd we didn't want that combination, so we did not get the bags,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I needed to be close to Disneyland and not break the bank. We enjoyed our stay; close to several restaurants. The room was clean, not fancy and the price was right. The pool was close and very nice but too chilly out for us. I would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: AMAZING staff, 10 min walk to Disneyland. Family Friendly & great Value.
Summary: Front desk staff and housekeeping were Amazing! Very friendly and helpful. Had a housekeeping issue, was taken care of immediately. The Hotel is a 10 min walk to Disneyland/California Adventure. Many Family friendly restaurants withing a 2 blocks radius. Pool/Jacuzzi area was fun and very clean. Each morning we were given a morning snack pack (fruit, cheese stick, granola bar & bottled water), very appreciated. Our hotel rooms were very clean and maintained. The Rooftop bar "The Fifth" was fun, beautiful nighttime view. Happy hour was a good deal, yummy food. Be careful about what drinks you order, Bartender/waiter was NOT honest about what drinks were half priced and were were over charged. The live music was incredible and fun atmosphere. We absolutely loved our experience at
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just completed a 5 night stay, came for Halloween Time at Disneyland.  After the last issues with my room, this time I chose one of the new rooms in the new Tower.  It was on the 2nd floor, and was a double room.  The room was very nice with modern d√©cor and a lot of room.  The bathroom has a deep soaking tub, which helped with the aching feet and body after 16 hour days at Disney.  The sink is outside the tub/toilet, which helps when you have other people that need to get ready.  There is a fridge and microwave.  The A/C kept the room iceberg degrees, if that's what you wanted.  The beds and pillows were comfortable.  There was plenty of light and electrical plugs in this room compared to the old rooms. There was a big picture window which opened up to the ugly roof, so no
Manager Response: Hello TxNurse,  Thank you for your comments with TripAdvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience with the elevator. I can assure you that the elevator has been repaired and is functional. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and I apologize about the issues you experienced. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect for Budget Friendly Disney Trips!
Summary: My husband and I booked this hotel to take my little cousin on an end of summer Disneyland trip and we were not disappointed! The rooms were clean, roomy and had everything you needed within reach. The staff was friendly and kind anytime we had questions over the phone, or directly at the front desk. The star of this hotel really is the rooftop bar and grill, after a long day of Disney, we were able to relax with a delicious cocktail and watch the fireworks while the little one enjoyed a hot cocoa. My only suggestion would be better wifi signal, we kept getting booted off the server. But other than that, our stay was delightful! We will most definitely be visiting again! Great value, nice employees, centrally located to everything you may need; definitely worth it!
Manager Response: Hello Jen M,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for staying with us and we cannot wait for you to stay with us again.    Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: SO CLOSE TO THE PARK!! Clean Room and Very Helpful, Friendly Staff!!!
Summary: We just returned from a family trip to Disneyland. Hard to tell how far the hotels are from the actual entrance to the park with reviews. The Grand Legacy is RIGHT THERE!! Such a easy walk to and from the park, and so nice to have a short distance after a long day at Disneyland.  The rooms are very clean and nice and there is an excellent pizza place, taco place and an ice cream store on the same property which made it nice to have a late night snack that wouldn't break the bank with 3 teenagers who constantly eat. A 24 hour Denny's is also right there and was great too. The staff was very friendly and kind and Ismael at the front desk totally helped us out when our pre-paid shuttle did not show to take us to the airport to fly home. He went above and beyond to help us out.  WE
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great cheaper option just across the road from Disney
Summary: We stayed here in October 2017. Our stay was drama free. Highly recommended for cheaper option just across the road from Disney. The only negatives were customer service in regards to calling a cab and handed us off to the Travel area to do it, and also there was not enough facilities for washing for such a big hotel.   Please be aware they are doing upgrades to Level 4 of this building too so there might be some noise.
Manager Response: Hello kate0987,  We appreciate the feedback and I am happy to hear that we were highly recommended. We have two guest laundry facilities at our hotel. The other laundry facility is in the new tower. We hope to see you soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Remained on first floor going with a companion with terrible knees. So activity clamor isn't excessively my own taste, I'd rather be upstairs. That said I didn't hear clamor from upstairs, conceivably because of earplugs. Beds as publicized. For a bed to rest after difficult day at the recreation center it's extraordinary.Fireworks seeing from housetop was incredible.
Manager Response: Hello karenbfiguer,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Legacy at the Park on a recent trip to Anaheim.  We love this hotel because it is located right across the street from Disneyland.  There are also plenty of places to eat within walking distance. The rooms are clean and spacious and the beds are very comfortable. If you have little ones, you will love their pool. They have a shallow section where even small kids can have a great time. We will definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here again for the second time this year.  Staff is all wonderful!  Location is a little further that we prefer but barely.  They have worked on the internet and it worked much better this time!  It is a great place for a family to stay who wants to walk to Disneyland!!!!  Breakfast is little bags with water, granola bars,string cheese, and water.  I have heard others complain about this but we actually really enjoyed them.
