Manager Response: Hello Michele S,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and that you experienced our brand new wifi. We hope to see you again soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: My review of grand legacy at the park in Anaheim, California
Summary: I recently stay at the grand legacy hotel October 3rd 2017. Great location great roof top bar reasonable prices. But.... Customer service was fair, if you like bed bugs then this is the place for you! I got bed bugs all over my back and stomach!! Not a happy camper!!!!!!
Manager Response: Hello amandastrip,  I appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you and your family encountered. Please know that we take this matter seriously and would like you to contact me off-line. Every day, our goal is to please every guest that comes to stay. We strive to continually improve and hope an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: the best location. lovely room. nice portable breakfast. i did enjoy the premium room. seriously, the finest customer service i have ever received .  i'm pretty sure i'm always staying here when i'm at the mouse.
Manager Response: Hello ohsoswedie,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and we hope to see you again soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed here two nights the end of September.  No complaints.  Location is convenient to Disney.  Room was a nice size and clean.  All staff was friendly.  Great pizza shop on property.  Definitely recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet, Close to Disney but a little small
Summary: We stayed 5 nights - Room was always very clean.  Beds were comfortable.  Our room had continuous fan option on the AC for white noise so it was very quiet.  It seemed pretty quiet, anyway.  Staff were helpful and friendly.  You can't beat the location.  Only down side was our room, with 2 double beds, was a little small.  No room to maneuver a suitcase.  Tiny vanity with no room to leave out toiletries.  Heavy pocket door for bathroom.  Still, it was a great place for a Disney trip.  You can't beat the location.
Manager Response: Hello PhxCarolyn,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This is a big motel with cheaper rates than you will find on this block. From the front the place looks fancier than it is. A big outdoor night club sits on top of the front tower. It's LOUD, sounds fun, and a great place to watch the fireworks. If you go to bed earlier than midnight, do not get a room in this tower. My room was about 1/2 way back, closer to the pool, and I didn't hear any noise. In fact I slept great! The room has a swamp cooler so I just kept it on to block out any potential noise from people coming back from Disneyland who need to talk loudly down the corridor. My room was the deluxe double. Nothing deluxe about it, just a name. The beds were comfortable, the tv was a flat screen with a tv channel guide. The programming was good. No Disney jr. This small room
Manager Response: Hello MeganLAM,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I was only here but overnight (long enough to sleep).  I booked the room 3 weeks before my trip directly with the hotel and a week before my trip the rates dropped so I cancelled and re-booked at the new rate.  I love that they offer an AP (Disney Annual Passport rate).  I checked into my room about 9pm, very easy process.  I had requested a room on the second floor close to the front of hotel. They were great about honoring my request.  I was in room 173, which is on the second floor of the main building but the next to the last room to the back. Stairs only, no elevator.  The room was very cold, which is great because it was a warm muggy day. I had a room with two doubles.  The bedding was clean and crisp.  The room was small but would certainly be do-able for 2-4 people.
Manager Response: Hello Bokehfoto,  Thank you so much for your review. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being our guest and thank you for recommending us to others. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Quick Trip to Disneyland with Grandma...
Summary: I was very impressed with the cleanliness of this hotel. Not to mention, it is such a close walk to the park! That is a selling point for me. We have a toddler and we like to take a break from the park, this hotel is a hop,skip,jump away from Disneyland. It makes it very easy to take that quick rest and then get back to the fun! We love the pool, and the STAFF here is very friendly and helpful! We will be staying here again... Thank you Grand Legacy!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very close to the main gate of Disneyland. Hadn't stayed here since it was The Saga.  Stayed in a tower room and it was nice. Fridge was really tall for a small fridge.  Coffee maker was having issues (dripping instead of flowing so took about 6 loud cycles for a full cup) but we were only there 1 night so no time to remedy the issue for us. Hopefully it got fixed for the next guest. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Dogsdish,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for coming back and for being our loyal guest. We hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My room was a second floor, 2 queen beds room. The bedding was nice and it had handy facilities like a fridge and a microwave. It had however an ancient, outdated atmosphere. The hotel location is, obviously, its best asset. But two major disappointments;  - the breakfast consists of a grab n go bag with a cereal bar, an apple, some string cheese and water. Not bad, just, not clear upon reservation.  - the bathroom is poorly maintained. The shower head and the drains of the sink are covered in rust. The shower pipe kind of comes out of the wall. To be fair, I did not complain to the reception, surely they would have addressed the issue.   Also, our room keys would scarcely work. The staff replaced it every time we needed though.
Manager Response: Hello Judith B,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the experience you had at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Wanted to stay close to the park with restaurant options and convenience store close by. Absolutely loved the proximity to Disneyland and the quick walk to get there! Will definitely stay here again. Especially if I can get a similar rate to the one I got when I booked and paid early on their website. It was a 40% off special. Couldn't beat the price anywhere. It's an older hotel, but the rooms were clean and updated. The pool area was very nice. We appreciated the snack bag they give you in the morning. It carried us through until lunch (but then we're not big eaters). I wish the parking was free, but if you sign up on their email, there are specials they send you periodically - right now I noticed the parking fee is waived if you stay three consecutive nights. If you're ok to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Zero service, smelly rooms and tiny uncomfortable beds!
Summary: Just left this hotel after staying 1 night and couldn't get away quick enough! Things didn't start out well when we arrived, the valet basically refused to park my car and asked me to move it myself, which I did but then all through the rest of our stay they deliberately avoided any eye contact with us for fear of being asked to do something! (One of them looked like he was reading a book on the valet stand!!) We also had lots of bags and we couldn't find anyone to help us with them, so we struggled to drag them all to our room on the second floor by ourselves.   The rooms themselves were very old and parts were quite disgusting, for example the bathroom sink had cracks in, skirting wasn't attached to wall properly and the room had an overall smell of tobacco and stale urine.
Manager Response: Hello MrsHBomb,  Thank you for your review with tripadvisor. I apologize for any inconveniences you experienced while staying with us. We regret to hear about the issues you encountered. Please know that we have talked to the department heads regarding this review. Thank you for staying with us. Improvements is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Used to be my favorite Disney Hotel. Now serious reservations.
Summary: Back when this was just the Ramada Maingate it was great. Decent dated rooms, continental breakfast, reasonable parking. That's all gone now. The Continental Breakfast is now a real crappy snack bag, they could've upgraded, and I would've been more willing to pay more, but they downgraded.   The biggest crime against this place is the absolutely horrific parking. First they charge you 15 dollars a night for the first car, 25 for the second, and then they have almost no parking available, because it's all reserved for valet. See my attached picture, we went on a ghost town day, and all the spaces were full because valet reserves half of the tiny lot. They don't even need valet! The place isn't Caesars Palace. Expect your car to get thoroughly dinged here, because the parking
Manager Response: Hello ClayLV,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a comment with your response. I am very sorry to hear about your inconvenience with the parking. We do our best to meet the needs of every guest, and I apologize that your stay was not to your satisfaction. We have taken your comment into consideration and will use it to better our facilities and services. Our hope is that as we continue to improve, an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: You can't beat the location of the GL!  We have stayed for years, through the change from Ramada. But, we will not be returning.  Since the hot breakfast is gone, and parking is almost non-existent this hotel is not the great deal it used to be.   The valets and cleaning crews were the only customer service personnel who acted like we mattered. We paid $40 per night to park two cars.  The room we paid to upgrade was in the worst location (elevator and stairs and people making noise very late).  And it had a broken bathroom door.  We muddled through our stay with it, however when I told the front desk they could not have cared less.  Now when your adult son is staying in your room, it's kinda important to have some bathroom privacy.  Yet, I did not even get a thanks for telling
Manager Response: Hello drivingthekids,  We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. Please know that your comments were addressed and reviewed. Again, we apologize for the inconveniences during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel was fine - Internet was the WORST
Summary: As stays go, the room was clean and close to Disneyland which is the main thing that we wanted, but in this modern age good internet is a MUST.  The internet connection in our room kept disconnecting and when I called the front desk, she apologized and had their tech support company call me back.  They did and their answer was to re-start my phone (which I had already done 3-4 times already) and then reconnect.  I explained that I had already done that and that the internet would successfully connect for a few minutes and then lose connection.  Naturally, as soon as my phone restarted,  I was able to connect and the smug tech support guy thought he had solved the problem.  5 minutes after we had hung up, once again the internet was kicking me off.  Now, we could have waited for
Manager Response: Hello designgeek,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize about the issues you experienced with the internet. I am happy to inform you that we have upgraded our wifi just a couple of weeks ago. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Great staff...clean comfortable rooms! Front desk open 24 hours... Right across the street from California Adventure! This visit was just one night but plan on staying here next visit.....which hopefully will be longer!!!!! ....we arrived at noon..... .they stored our luggage and parked our car .... easy as pie. We spent the whole day and up until closing at the parks! When we returned check in was a breeze.....and in no time we were crashed on our comfy beds.....next morning.... they provided a continental style breakfast in a bag.  That got us going......but I wish it had been a bit more but that is my only criticism  All else was great and I look forward to returning and enjoying the pool and rooftop restaurant!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This inn has never disappointed. The rooms are consistently clean. Parking can be VERY challenging at times. Pool is fun for kids. We love the bar. Far and away the best place for watching nightly fireworks. After a day at the park, adults can have a night cap and miss the "leaving park" mass exodus
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been staying here every time we go to Disneyland for the last few years or so and plan to continue staying here on future visits, since it's close to the park. The Fifth is something quite spectacular after a long day at the park and definitely recommend checking it out. The rooms are quaint and comfortable and the amenities are excellent. The wifi is spot on and has always worked. The breakfasts to go are convenient for those ready to hit the park early. The pool and hot tub are also a great way to wind down after a long day as well. Would always recommend this to my friends and family.
Manager Response: Hello 999happyhaunts,  Thank you very much for your comments. We are very glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. It is a pleasure to serve our wonderful guests and we are happy to have had you. I am excited to let you know that the wifi has been upgraded and we now have great wifi. We are looking forward to the great changes happening, and we hope that you will see them first hand when you come back to visit us again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My family and I have stayed at the Grand Legacy At The Park numerous times over the past few years. It is conveniently located near Disneyland (walking distance!), rooms are clean and cozy, and amenities sufficient for vacationing families such as wifi. The staff is great to work with and have  always been very accommodating. If a hotel is necessary for your trip to Disneyland then I highly recommend Grand Legacy At The Park. Tim
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been faithful to Saga Main gate, Ramada now this for 20 years. This hotel has outgrown itself. $15 for non existent parking that has to be valet? Who wants that. Breakfast that is so pathetic is better thrown in the garbage. For this money spend a little more and go up market
Manager Response: Hello Nigel16494,  I appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We apologize that you didn't like the new changes we made. Every day, our goal is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were unable to do so. We strive to continually improve and hope an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed in the new tower and the room was nice but the other reviews are true, the bar/nightclub is loud. It is also a bit strange to have to wait behind tipsy people getting their wristband and hand stamped to go up to the bar when your kids are tired and just want to get in bed. I'm sure they are making money off the bar but it just is such an odd choice for a hotel that must cater almost exclusively to families.
Manager Response: Hello Baseball4evr10,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience with our rooftop restaurant and bar. I can assure you that the department managers have been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for the location across from Disneyland. I wasn't impressed with the hotel. The rooms were clean and the beds okay. You have to pay for parking per day and it can be pretty packed but they offer valet parking. We didn't see the pool so I can't comment on that. We also did not go to the roof top bar. We had someone come in very late above our room and it was pretty noisy. Breakfast was a grab bag which had an apple, cheese stick, granola bar and a water. We would only stay here again if we couldn't get a room at one of the other hotels near by.
Manager Response: Hello dragonfly72,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Ok so if you stayed here anywhere else other than opposite Disney you would never pay the nightly rate. However that is what you are paying for, the rooms although slightly renovated are tired and need some TLC. I stayed in the 2 story block so had no issues with noise from the rooftop bar. But as a user of the bar it is a great place for a late drink. We tried to check in 20 minutes before 3 and were made to wait until 3 which is the official check in time, this was the most annoying thing for me. However would I stay here again, absolutely
Manager Response: Hello thepengy,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We are currently staying on 4 th floor with young children. Rooftop bar produces noise of aggregious levels for early or light sleepers. We are lucky the kids seem to be managing to sleep much better than us! Friday and Saturday nights are worst, to 1 a.m. Add loud pounding, perhaps moving furniture up there???
Manager Response: Hello funkychickpea,  Thank you for your review with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may experience one of our other room types that we have in different area of the hotel.    Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Was once the best place to stay, now not so much
Summary: In the grand scheme of hotels within walking distance of the park , this is still an okay choice. We've stayed here for years. The location is still the biggest plus. BUT.....more expensive now, parking is MUCH worse now, there is no real breakfast any more, many of the rooms in the new front tower have music pounding down on them at night from the cheesy rooftop club, the sink water pressure is nearly unusable, only ONE extremely slow elevator for entire tower, etc etc .   The staff is friendly and helpful though. New rooms are nicely appointed.
Manager Response: Hello dangerdave,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a comment with your response. I am very sorry to hear about your experience at our hotel. We do our best to meet the needs of every guest, and I apologize that your stay was not to your satisfaction. We have taken your comments into consideration and will use it to better our facilities and services. Our hope is that as we continue to improve, an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed in room 437 and it was definitely older than the pictures shown but the room was immaculate (aside from normal room wear and tear). Very quiet aside from the maids carts rolling around in the afternoon (normally would not have heard this but we had to go back to the room because our daughter was not feeling well). For being on the top floor the a/c was the coldest I've ever had at any Hotel (next to the Grand Californian)!! Valet is included in the price,which we needed because when we checked in there was a wedding taking up alot of the parking lot. After we checked in we asked the valet how to park, she asked our room and said she would meet us by the elevator and park our car. Only one elevator at the back of the hotel but being so full we never had to wait or even
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Used to be a favorite, but last visit left me so disappointed.
Summary: My husband surprised me with a trip to Disneyland with my best friend to celebrate my birthday.  We've stayed in this hotel more times than I can count and always recommend it to family/ friends, so he had no concerns booking a room here.  This is a long review, so here are the highlights if you don't want to read all of it: - Half of the parking lot is blocked for valet, though they charge $15 per day to park   non-valet - The front desk clerk when we checked in provided terrible customer service - The bathroom ceiling had water pouring from the light fixture -- a known issue    according to maintenance.  This is a big safety concern (water + electricity), but was   brushed off as no big deal. - No effort to listen to feedback when we were checking out.  We drove down from
Manager Response: Hello Licibee_916,  We appreciate you taking your time to address your concerns. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you and your family encountered. We realize the mere apologies won‚Äôt correct our mistakes in handling your visit. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I read the reviews prior to booking and although many of them were poor, there were some good ones too and the location and price were right.  After staying here for 4 nights, here are my observations:  The guys at the front desk very friendly. Offered tips and advice. What I wasn't expecting was a $15 per day parking charge. Absurd to charge hotel guests to park. $60 to park my car nowhere near my room in a VERY crowded parking lot.  The room itself looks fine on the surface, but after being in it a couple minutes, it's apparent that it hasn't had a legitimate, thorough cleaning in a VERY LONG TIME. Toilet smells like urine, the water flow in the sink was so low it was barley functional and the smell coming from the drain was enough to make me gag when brushing my teeth. There
Manager Response: Hello,  We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. Please know that your comments were addressed and if you would like to further discuss this off-line please feel free to contact me. Again, we apologize for the inconveniences during your stay and we hope that you will allow us another opportunity to better serve you and your family.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First off, when we arrived at the hotel in the evening of 07/19 to check-in to our room, the gentleman helping us at the front desk initially checked us into Room 179, and at the same time another employee was checking in another guest simultaneously.  After getting our keys we attempted to get into Room 179 only to find out our keys did not work, and shortly after the guests that were checking in at the same time as us arrived to the room and said it was their room.  Although the employee who checked us in clearly wrote out "179" on our key envelope, my wife had to go back to the front desk twice in order to sort this matter out.  It almost took an hour of my wife running back and forth and me standing outside watching out luggage, before we actually got the correct room
Manager Response: Hello Romie A,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department managers have been notified of this review. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and guest services. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My friend came on business and I tagged along and went to the parks. Stayed 5 nights. They blocked certain rooms for her convention which turned out to be their worst rooms. There is NO counter space in bathroom, no shelves or racks for towels only one hook on the door. Water pressure was awful, would pray every time we flushed the toilet! Pipes would moan and vibrate when you wanted hot water, which was too scalding hot to use. Carpet would turn your feet black so had to wear shoes all the time. Almost no outlets in the entire room which makes it hard to charge everything for 2 people and dry/curl your hair. Maids were over whelmed and do not provide service to the room everyday! One day I just asked her for towels and toilet paper and she was so thankful I told her don't worry
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer M,  I appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you encountered with our room and team member. Every day, our goal is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were unable to do so. We strive to continually improve and hope an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Really doesn't get more convenient than this for Disneyland access. Literally across the street and easily walk-able. Wi-fi worked well and there's a nice pool area. The staff were very friendly accommodating.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Found hair from previous guests in room
Summary: The front desk wasn't very nice and inviting, more straight forward and only about business in my opinion. We arrived at 10am and asked that we park before check-in at 3pm which they accommodated. We headed to Disneyland and came back at 3pm with lots of people were going in and out for check in. We signed the paperwork and headed out to our room.   I was exhausted from walking at the park that morning combined with east coast jet lag and a 6am start. After a nap, I got up to shower and found hair on the towels, bathroom counter, even men's facial hair on the sides of the shower and women's hair in the corners. It wasn't super clean to say the least.  The carpet in the room was dark, showed wear in corners and had miscellaneous stains. One chair in the room had a giant water(?)
Manager Response: Hello Jacqueline J,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Location, location, location and a young woman Daisy!
Summary: We just stayed 7/24-25. I found the hotel just what I expected. Clean, comfortable and location location location! I have been staying at this hotel since it was the Saga Hotel back in the early 70's. I received a  great price all due to a young lady Daisy! If you want to know what excellent customer service is she's the one you go to! I had booked months before and I said I was an Annual Passholder. At the time the young man was not able to help me. The day before we left Daisy called me and told me I was available for AP discount. She saved me a good chunk of change. She was pleasant, remembered my name and very helpful. Daisy even reminded me to come to the front desk and get my $16 deposit back! I can't wait to go back! I hope the manager reads this!
Manager Response: Hello TDog638,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and that Daisy was very helpful to you. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Good access & decent staff - just avoid rooms beneath the bar / restaurant!
Summary: The hotel's location is fantastic - just minutes from the entrance to Disneyland but unlike properties along S.Harbor Blvd, the wifi was intermittent, the parking often full and the noise from the hotel bar was quite something! We had been moved here due to access requirements. I needed and got a very good wheelchair accessible room and the staff were helpful in sorting this out for me.  They also warned me about the noise and helped with the wonky wifi! The room was perfectly nice - in the main hotel, the rooms are more stylish than the motel style rooms on the property. Coffee maker and fridge were a nice touch. For the money, it delivered what we needed and as we were still jet lagged, the noise from the bar didn't keep us awake but if you're a light sleeper, avoid those
Manager Response: Hello liz c,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at Grand Legacy At The Park we would like to apologize for the issues you encountered at our hotel.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: "Remodel"  didn't do much for me.  The windows are so thin you can hear people walking by your room.  The free wifi wasn't working.The carpets were dirty and I didn't want to walk on them barefoot.  They no longer have a complimentary breakfast but instead give you a paper bag with a red apple, a water, a single granola bar and a cheese stick, then send you on your way.  Of course, I try to keep in mind that the reason we are there is not for the accommodations, but rather to spend our entire waking time at Disneyland.  That being said, we slept good and the air conditioner worked.
Manager Response: Hello 1percentkids,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the concerns you had at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Remodel didn't improve staff or interior of the rooms
Summary: We've been staying there since it was the Saga Inn and the Ramada Main Gate. I don't think we will ever stay at the Grand Legacy again nor would I recommend it to my family and friends. The staff was rude and refused to honor our "early check in" request. Our room didn't get maid service 2 out of the 5 days we were there. (And we were out of the room from 8-4:30 everyday) Additionally, it's NOT Acceptable to charge hotel guests a fee to go up on the roof top (5th) to watch the fireworks. We were there on the 4th of July and the main reason we stayed there was to watch the fireworks from the roof. They had and event (which was sold out) so we couldn't go up anyway. We were NOT Happy! The 12 million dollar upgrade was not spent on the beds. Our King size bed was the most
Manager Response: Hello Dennisfam,  Thank you for your comments. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The room is clean and comfortable.  It is a good size for 4 people.  Nothing fancy but a good place to rest after a long day at the park.  No free breakfast but they give you a bag with a bottle of water, granola bar and apple in the morning (you pick up in a room near the pool).  We did not bring a car so no experience with the parking.  There is a pool but we did not use it either.  It is located across from the Disney parks and is an easy walking distance.  It is also close to a Jimboy's taco place, Denny's, and Ihop which we liked very much.  It is very convenient to stay at this hotel.
Manager Response: Hello t2beans,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay in our clean and comfortable room. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location to Disneyland but rest leaves room for improvement
Summary: Excellent location about a block from Disneyland entrance.  Variety of dining close by and can watch fireworks from some rooms and their rooftop bar/restaurant.  Check in time at 3 means at 3 rooms were not ready early at all and daily house keeping was sporadic/late in afternoon many days when we tried to take afternoon breaks daily with our young kids.  Beds were a little firmer than prefer but personal preference maybe but not "pillowtop."  Pool was good for kids and descent size.  Parking was challenging and excessive cost compared to comparable surrounding properties.  No breakfast at hotel. Have come down 1-2√ó a year for past 5 and have found better values and comfort in comparable location.
Manager Response: Hello beaver3479,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and we thank you for staying with us. We hope to see you soon when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Our room was clean and spacious. We were in the closer building to the road so it made for a decent walk to the park. At night we could sit on the balcony and see the fireworks. The breakfast too. Is limited but nice to get something to start off the day.
Manager Response: Hello erk711,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We loved the pool, the view, The valet, the workers. It was a very clean and spacious room. At a great and affordable price. It was one of the most and best stays I have ever had in a hotel. Not to mention it was a three minute walk away from the Disneyland parks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we have stayed at the old 'Ramada Maingate'  literally hundreds of times over the years visiting and when I worked at Disneyland, it was always, clean, close, semi-affordable, great pool, just a good decent hotel. Last night was the first time we stayed at the new/remodeled and re-themed/named Grand Legacy at the Park.  I must say we were VERY impressed! Excellent service from the moment we checked-in very early to our check-out today! Polite, attentive and fun to talk with staff, and the place looks GREAT! The room remodels are wonderful, everything you need, the pool is still perfect for a cool-down, parking is a bit tight, but no-one can create more space out of cosmos, All-in-all, we can HIGHLY recommend the Grand Legacy!   My ONLY 'issue' the morning complimentary breakfast
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed one night June 2017. Parking was terrible and cost an extra $15.00. Had to walk far to get to our room. Room was ok, but the crazy lock on the bathroom door was hard to work and kids locked themselves in. Cost over $400.00 and was not worth it.
Manager Response: Hello katheann39,  Thank you for your feedback. I do apologize about the issues you experienced with the bathroom door lock and I am sorry that you kids got locked in. I can assure you that maintenance has taken care of that door lock. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Grand Legacy at the Park - Great location for Disneyland
Summary: Spent two nights here in May while visiting California Adventure Park and Disneyland.  Hotel is in a great location to do the parks.  We were a ten minute walk away.  On that 10 minute walk we were able to get food at Denny's and a buffet restaurant I have forgotten the name of but the food was fine there.  The hotel staff were not overly friendly.  We did not visit the bar and nightclub at the hotel but you could hear it walking back from Disneyland after it closed.  We had a ground floor room which was perfectly adequate for our needs.  Two large beds, bathroom and room to move.  Renovations to the carpark were occurring right outside our room but it was not really annoying and should be finished by now.  Breakfast had been discontinued but we got a snack pack with a cheese
Manager Response: Hello Sue J,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at Grand Legacy At The Park we would like to apologize for the issues you encountered at our hotel.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at The Grand Legacy for about the last 10 years. Except when we stayed there it was the Ramada Maingate at the Park. That hotel was excellent!  Free parking, free continental breakfast, across the street from Disneyland. Wonderful hotel! We have now stayed there since they "upgraded" and became the Grand Legacy. Can't say there's anything Grand about it. Premium rooms are not stellar at all. So much valet parking that it takes up majority of the whole parking lot. Parking is no longer the included, although for this trip we were comped our parking. Breakfast has since disappeared and replaced with a breakfast snack bag consisting of a fruit, water and cheese stick. This hotel was much better when it was Ramada and they cared about the patrons. We asked about
Manager Response: Hello Jill H,  Thank you for taking the time to leave comments with your response. I am very sorry to hear about your experience with Grand Legacy At The Park. We do our best to meet the needs of every guest, and I apologize that your stay was not to your satisfaction. We have taken your comments into consideration and will use it to better our facilities and services. Our hope is that as we continue to improve, an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't be sucked in by the Location!
Summary: We stayed here in Jun 2017 and would NOT stay here again! First of all the front desk girls were rude n condescending! We were put in a room right by the ice machine and elevator! The ice machine was frequently used at ALL hours of the night and the walls are paper thin! Our room wasn't cleaned while we were out ALL day at the parks! To add insult to injury we were charged $25 to park in the parking lot after dropping a significant amount of money to stay at the hotel! Save your money and stay at one of the resort hotels, you will have a better stay! This place boasts about being a prime hotel in 2016 well I do t see how!
Manager Response: Hello Chris G,  We appreciate you taking your time to address your concerns. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you and your family encountered. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stayed on first floor traveling with a friend with bad knees. So traffic noise isn't too my personal taste, I'd rather be upstairs. That said I did not hear noise from upstairs, possibly due to earplugs.  Beds as advertised. For a bed to rest after long day at the park it's great. Fireworks viewing from rooftop was great.
Manager Response: Hello AhntheGo,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay and the fireworks viewing from our rooftop restaurant. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again in the Disneyland Resort area.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Upon arrival, we were placed on the second floor with only one elevator working (we had to walk all the way on the other side of the building if we wanted to use the elevator. Once in our room, pee on the side of toilet. I can't...I just can't. Our double stroller wouldn't fit in the room so we paid extra $10 a night for upgrade. Parking was super tight and that's $15 a night. For the price, I just wasn't worth it. I'm a AP holder and stayed at a lot of hotels in the area and this is at the bottom. Other then the location this hotel has nothing.
Manager Response: Hello elliebellie327,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. I can assure you that the elevator that was down is now up and running, repairs were needed on that elevator. Thank you and I sure hope you will give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My family visits Disneyland often and every June we stay 1-2 nights to take in all the parks. We have started at the grand legacy in the past prior to the renovation and I must say it is an improvement. We have stayed at other hotels around the park and they basically are all the same with the grand legacy being a bit above the rest due to the ease of check in, good customer service and clean but older hotel room.  Location is great to the park. I would stay here 1-2 nights max, but if you are coming from another state or country for a longer stay, I would recommend one of the Disneyland hotels on Po property. But if just a quick stay on a budget, this is not bad at all compared to other near by hotels.
Manager Response: Hello EnglishTeach30,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to see you again next June.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Still over a week to go, not good!!!
Summary: Currently staying here, to anyone else looking don't bother unless you want poor customer service, not being able to use the roof top bar that they advertise due to private parties using it, cleaning staff are hit and miss room never done the same twice. Coming here from the UK we were at least expecting great customer service but no, so far has been quite curt at times bordering on rude, even as we checked in after a 10.5 he flight!! As for the breakfast it is a joke, not what advertised we have to go to the poolside between 7am and 9am and pick up a bag containing a small bottle of water,an apple, a cheese string and an oat bar!! Adverises free wifi this doesn't seem to work half of the time and when it does keeps dropping off so you loose the website you are viewing.Will see
Manager Response: Hello Teresa F,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the hotel and it was the greatest hotel nightmare of my life!!!The noise at this place is ridiculous!  The LOUD LOUD LOUD LOUD noise and techno music doesn't stop until 4am.  So if you are thinking of resting or enjoying your time, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!  The main tower is a pretty much a night  club and the staff doesn't care about you or your stay.  If you complain, all they say is that the website alleg lady mentions "noise" during booking!  Come and stay if you want to remember your worst hotel nightmares.  Run.  Run. Run to your nearest ANYWHERE away from this dump.  Also, if you have kids, be prepared for no sleep for them and tired, angry kids at the park.  Night. Mare.  Run. Cancel your reservation and stay somewhere that doesn't think it's a club in downtown
Manager Response: Hello travelitnow2014,  We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. During the time of booking we were not contracted. This was a one time private event. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property. Please know that your comments were addressed and if you would like to further discuss this off-line please feel free to contact me. Again, we apologize for the inconveniences during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I've stayed here before and I will go back. When visiting Disney I just want a quiet place to sleep. This place does the trick.   Pros-  Real Queen beds! So many hotels try to tell me a Full and Queen are the same.   Nice T.V.'s with a printed guide  Mini fridge & microwave in rooms  Pretty quiet. I've stayed here a few times and not much noise (I'm to afraid to stay in the front tower. It has a noisy bar with lots of complaints)  Has a Jimboys! I grew up on these greasy tacos. Great post park treat!  Has a nice mini store on site.   They give annual passholders deals. Which is smart. Keeps me going back!  The valet & housekeepers were very friendly. Like they said hello and smiled.   Cons- The front desk ladies could learn from the housekeepers & valet. When I checked in they
Manager Response: Hello MeganLAM,  On behalf of our entire team, we would like to apologize for the concerns you had about your experience at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First Impression wasn't pleased that even though your a paying guest you pay for parking and have to park away from your room because they allow visitors to pay and park in lot.?The rooms are clean and staff is friendly. The pool area not as big as picture on website. They have a bar and restaurant upstairs with music during the week, food fair portion small.
Manager Response: Hello 274christyd,  We appreciate the feedback. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed our clean room and friendly staff. We hope to be able to serve you again in the near future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First, this hotel has a perfect location to walk to the park. The price is low enough that it's worth it for that alone.   The housekeeping staff are very nice and always smiling. That was where the customer service ended. We were told we would have an upper floor room, no luck, first floor was all they had left (I booked earlier this year and called a few days ahead to confirm). There was supposedly a snack bag instead of breakfast, never received. Our toilet was broken and only sometimes would flush, only given extra towels from the front desk in case it over- flowed. Was told we would have no issues watching fireworks with our 3 year old from the restaurant, and there were no private parties.  Arrived an hour early and hostess said that there wasn't room for us and we could
Manager Response: Hello Suzanne D,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated so as to ensure that this type of incident does not take place again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Each Stay Is A Bit More Disappointing
Summary: I have stayed at this property every year since 2012 and go to Disneyland once or twice yearly.  Since they are no longer a Ramada property, big convenience's are no longer present.  The biggest thing the hotel has going for them is location.  It is an easy 5 minute walk to the entrance to Disneyland.  There is a Tony Roma's restaurant basically in the parking lot of the hotel.  They have built a new tower of rooms and suites which includes a small store/gift shop, an ice cream shop, a pizza shop, and a tour office.  They absolutely will Not allow early check-in's, even an hour early.  I arrived at 2 pm by shuttle, and had to wait outside for an hour.  I had informed them that I had arrived by shuttle alone and the rest of my party would not arrive until later, and they had no
Manager Response: Hello TxNurse,  Thank you for your review with tripadvisor. I apologize for any inconveniences you experienced while staying with us. Improvements is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We were closed by the pool on the 2nd floor. Room was clean  with a microwave and small refrigerator. There is a gift shop , and ice cream place and a taco place on site of the hotel (reasonable priced an tasted good).  My only complain is the internet did not worked at all for the 3 nights we were there. There is no continental breakfast just a bag with a water bottle, cheese, apple and granola bar.  Just enough to get you going before heading to disneyland.  Overall, a good price for a hotel ner Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello Felicia W,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay. I do apologize for the issues you encountered with the wifi. I am happy to let me know that our brand new wifi is currently being upgraded now. Our new upgraded system will be completed by the end of next week. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Hotel for price and distance.
Summary: My family and I stayed at the Grand Legacy this past week for 5 nights. The premier room was very clean and the hotel was right across the street from Disneyland. Although there is no breakfast the location makes up for it. Housekeeping did a great job and honored our requests. This hotel would get 5 stars if they didn't have such an issue with parking. A few times it was hard to find a spot but after a few circles a spot would open up. They offer a free valet service which is convenient but over all the spots in the parking lot are still very tight for an SUV.  I would stay here again as the location and price out way the parking disaster.
Manager Response: Hello Chris H,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and that our housekeepers did a great job. We hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The only benefit to this hotel is being right across the entrance of the theme parks.   I called the front desk concierge a few days before our arrival to let them know we will be checking in around 2am since we took a late flight to LAX. I made sure to confirm that it has been noted. When we arrived at the hotel and we successfully checked in. No greetings, no smile, nothing. However, I smiled and made the best of it. But it's all good, it was late. The hotel looked trashed and overused. Repainted to hide cracks, dirt, wear and tear, and damages.   When we entered our room, it was HOT as hell. We immediately turned the AC on. I am sure the AC was installed 20 years ago, who knows if the filter was changed? There was so much dirt and dust all over the place, especially the
Manager Response: Hello Allison A,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. I can assure you that the department managers are aware of this review. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The hotel is within less than 5 minutes walk from the gates of Disneyland parks. There are many eating options that opens late along the walk back from Disneyland to the hotel, great for late dinner after visiting the park.  Stayed in room 103 which is a few steps away from the reception area. Despite being at the front, the room is quiet and we were hardly disturbed by other guests passing by.  The room is clean and definitely provide enough conveniences for the stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We absolutely love the Grand! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful! The rooms in the new tower are amazing! I love the 2 bedroom suites, they are so huge!!! Our family of 6 never feel cramped and the walk to and from Disneyland is so short and easy! We haven't tried the Fifth on the roof yet, maybe next trip! A lot for your money! This is the only other hotel I'd stay is Disneyland hotel!
Manager Response: Hello Denise C,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and we hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This is extremely close to the park! It's also close to Alamo car rental as well as Anaheim garden Walk. It was very clean and also has a nice pool and hot tub. You can also have drinks at the bar on the roof and watch fireworks however we never got to because they were closed for a private party.  In the morning they provide a sack breakfast. Ours had a water bottle, apple, granola bar and string cheese which I loved because it's actually healthy which is completely opposite of what you will find at Disneyland. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello lovelaughsew,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: No longer my default hotel in Anaheim
Summary: I have stayed here many times over the years including back when it was Ramada Maingate. You would think the hotel would be better overall after all the changes and construction they have done. Sadly, I don‚Äôt think that is the case.   It seems like every time I am there, they have changed something for the worse. For example, parking used to be free (it was something that set them apart), then they started charging $12 a day and now it is $15. Additional vehicles are $20 a day. At least if you can‚Äôt find any parking spaces, they have a free valet service.    They used to have a basic breakfast that I liked but now it is to go bags that include things like a bottle of water, an apple, string cheese and a granola bar. Yes, those are nice things to have for a snack later in the day
Manager Response: Hello Seniority97,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn‚Äôt like the changes we made to our hotel. Improvements is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidence by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: This used to be a favorite
Summary: WiFi was so bad it was all but non existent. I even talked to their Internet provider and still got kicked off the WiFi for timing out.  If WiFi is important at the end of the day this is no longer the place to stay and it used to be my favorite hotel at dlr.  Now they charge 16  for parking, and the breakfast is almost an insult.  The hotel is clean but the staff is far from friendly.  We will have a new favorite from here on out.
Manager Response: Hello Mark D,  Thank you very much for your comments. We are excited to let you know that our brand new wifi system will be completed by next week. We are looking forward to the great changes happening, and we hope that you will see them first hand when you come back to visit us again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location but better hotels around
Summary: We stayed here in May for one night for the purpose of being close to Disneyland.  Room was decorated ok . The maid forgot to restock the coffee area so there was no coffee or anything.  Beds were hard . At 1130pm at night people in the room next to us were outside yelling and in their room yelling .  Was insanely loud, could hear everything perfect .  We hoped we could leave the car there the next morning while we grabbed breakfast but were told they were paving the parking lot and needed to move car by 1030. So staying here was completely pointless .  Stayed at the Hilton last time and though taking the shuttle was slight inconvenience,  well worth it compared to this hotel . They need to implement firmer noise control , and update . Staff wasn't friendly but honestly I
Manager Response: Hello daniellapea21,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. I do apologize for any noise issues from other guests and for the inconvenience of not providing you with coffee. We do our best to prevent any disturbances. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again in the near future.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: You can't get any better than this for Disney land entry.  Lots of good eateries around all reasonably priced.  Room was basic, but inexpensive, very quiet. I think they had better rooms if you paid more.
Manager Response: Hello Marie M,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you come back again to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We decided on Grand Legacy because the pictures looked great, the location, and we were really looking forward to watching the fireworks from the rooftop bar. The reality was a bit different from the pictures. We were never able to access the rooftop restaurant, so don't bother to look forward to that. You  need reservations days in advance so you would have to plan your trip around dinner rather than disneyland. And don't even think about watching fireworks from there. 2 out of our 3 nights, the whole thing was reserved for private parties. Beyond that, everything was tight on space and getting rundown. If you are looking for a flophouse in easy walking distance to the park, this works but don't expect much more.
Manager Response: Hello myakpyrs,  We appreciate you taking your time to address your concerns. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this may have caused you and your family. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, LOUD band Can't Sleep
Summary: Pros:  super location, 5 stars for that.  Nice pool and hot tub.  Room was very clean.  Staff friendly.  Cons:  we were in one of two 3-room suites.  Asked for the one on the 3rd floor several times, knowing the bar above the 4th floor suite was noisy.  Still they put us on the fourth floor.  Constant music and chairs moving.  You could clearly hear people walking across the floor even. Next day, asked to move to third floor suite (not fun when you want to spend time at Disney).  But, even on third floor you clearly get to hear the band, very, very loud.  No longer heard scraping chairs or people walking.  Also, minor things, no towels at pool had to walk back to front desk for towels.  Our room towels were not replenished the second day, leaving us just a couple for five people
Manager Response: Hello KatieZozo,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your nice clean room and our friendly staff. I do apologize for any noise issues from The Fifth. We do our best to prevent any disturbances. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed in the back of the lot. The room was fine, but there was more than one bus that arrived or departed early in the morning. This was loud. The in-room A/C was also very loud. It is a window unit. I advise setting the temperature prior to leaving for the day and then turning it off while sleeping.  My biggest disappointment was the rooftop bar. The plan was to enjoy our first day in the park and return to the rooftop bar to watch the fireworks. We had pre-purchased the viewing area for the Main Street Electrical Parade our second night so we were hoping for a nightcap that night. The bar was closed 4 of the 5 weeknights the week of our stay. We only stayed two nights and the bar was closed the first night. Goodbye fireworks from the bar, which were cancelled the second
Manager Response: Hello Jeff K,  Thank you for your review with tripadvisor. I apologize for the inconveniences you experienced while staying with us. Thank you for staying with us. Improvements is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Would have given 5 points but we got a $50 parking violation for forgetting to put our parking permit on the dash for one night. They did have our license plate on file and there was no need for that. Otherwise, this place is great and the location is awesome. It's right across from Disney, next to food spots, & small shops. Room was clean and everything worked fine. Ohhhhhh...... the toilet paper is cheap and rips apart. My husband had no problem with it but my daughter and I hated it! Lol.
Manager Response: Hello Brandi R,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize about the inconvenience of the parking notice you received. Due to how busy the parking lot is we do require parking permits to all vehicles. However, the $50 charge you are referring to must be a parking fee for all the days you were here at the hotel. We do charge a daily parking fee of $15.00 plus the tax. Please feel free to contact me directly to go over your parking charges. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Just across the street from the park entrances. Clean, quiet, comfortable. Rooftop Bar with perfect viewing of Disneyland fireworks. The pool is temp controlled not too warm on hot days not too cold on cool days.
Manager Response: Hello stuartt465,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the area.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: A magic location opposite Disneyland and a great view from the Rooftop Bar.  On the last night of a 4-day weekend we enjoyed Disney's 9.30pm fireworks show with a nice glass of wine, delicious fish taco and bar food, sitting next to an outdoor heater under a cool January night sky.  Ours was a 1-room suite on the 2nd floor of the main building for our family of 5. Two comfortable large double beds and big shower with wheelchair access.  Although the rocking locking mechanism on the bathroom sliding door was bit awkward. The fold-out sofa in the lounge was also uncomfortable, lumpy and cramped the small space. However, we were handily located across the hall from the Breakfast Room.  Basic filling breakfast food and drink.  The rooftop bar on the 5th has live music and only goes
Manager Response: Hello Ele560,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing Grand Legacy At The Park.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We had stayed at this hotel many times while it was still the Ramada Maingate.  I was a little disappointed with this stay after I had read so many things about it being updated and remodeled. I did review it as very good because it DOES meet my needs for being so close to the park AND Tony Roma's is next door which works out great when we don't want to eat a restaurant (we take it to go and eat in the room).  Also, the front desk service was excellent.  They were able to check us in at noon when we arrived.  We had a little issue with parking as we only had a vehicle parked for one night and they charged us for two but Joy at the front desk was very accommodating and reversed the charge for us.   I didn't get to see the rooftop bar so can't comment on that, but the rooms were
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer J,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This hotel is really not worth the high cost! If I paid around $300 for 3 nights I would've loved the luxury room! Which is the top selection out of their choices. But what I got was a nice clean updated room that was small! A view of a smaller building and the parking lot, thin walls, and floors! Rude guests that we're staying under is and kept banging on the ceiling cause my kids were running around. The service was great, but they only helped with valet and checking in! After that not a peep from them! The 5th floor was closed till 10 cause of a private event the day we arrived so none of that. 3rd floor had no ice machine!  And I heard that the luxury rooms were the best they had! I was hearing horror stories from other guest about the less quality rooms! Bad smells, out
Manager Response: Hello Lurkerlou510,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We had an amazing stay!  We booked 4 rooms 5/20-5/24.  The staff were so friendly and accommodating!   They made sure that all of our rooms were next to each other and we even had connectors.  The rooms were good sized and very comfortable.  It was so nice to have a good sized fridge & microwave.  The pool was very nice too.  It helped break up the hot day at Disneyland.  The location of the hotel is amazing!!!  It is so close to the entrance of the park.  I was so surprised that the rates were so reasonable with the close proximity!  There are so many conveniences right on the street too.  We had pizza, tacos, and ice cream right at the entrance to the hotel, nice restaurant next door and down the street.  The roof top lounge was so much fun too!  We will definitely return and
Manager Response: Hello Dawn A,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Review of Grand Legacy at the Parj
Summary: We have stayed here when it was The Ramada Inn Maingate at least 5 times whenever we visited Disneyland.  We have now booked to stay there again in June 2017, now called The Grand Legacy at the Park.  As one reviewer mentioned, it is truly a  5 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance( it beats paying $20 to park in the Disneyland parking lot per day).  Although parking‚Äã at this hotel is now $15/day, many surrounding hotels also charge for parking. For those with youngsters, this hotel is close enough to head back to the hotel for a nap or a swim, then head back to Disneyland in the evening for the fireworks.  Rooms are clean, beds fairly comfortable. There is a nice sized heated pool. On the hotel grounds are a pizza take-out snack bar and other Italian foods like spaghetti and
Manager Response: Hello Debbie N,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we will see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Grand Legacy Ruined Our Family Vacation!
Summary: I'm not going to go into to much detail about their subpar rooms, non working wifi, crazy loud ac unit (kept waking up the kids!), or the fact that their balcony restaurant The Fifth is never opened because it's always booked for private parties - let's just jump to what this hotel... if you can call it that really is. It's a place with a bed and parking close to Disneyland. They can't even get that right. So here is how they made us miss Magic Hour at Disneyland, the entire reason we stayed there. When I checked in I asked how parking worked. They said it was 15 plus tax for 24 hours. OK great. I asked how it worked after checkout  they notified me that as long as I asked before I check out I could extend my parking for another 24 hours for the same price. So I headed down to
Manager Response: Hello Jason L,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a comment with your response. I am very sorry to hear about the inconveniences you encountered at our hotel. We do our best to meet the needs of every guest, and I apologize that your stay was not to your satisfaction. We have taken your comments into consideration and will use it to better our facilities and services. Our hope is that as we continue to improve, an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent location less than 5 minutes to the park.
Summary: This was an excellent location. Across the street from Disneyland, less than a 5 minute walk. The beds were comfortable, microwave and small fridge in the room and our room was clean when we arrived (huge bonus). The pool area was clean, stocked with towels and vending machines for drinks or snacks. The kids loved the small waterpark type area and in addition to the pool there is a hot tub. Plenty of lounge chairs and you can view the fireworks from the pool! Great place and I would return
Manager Response: Hello yensenfamily,  Thank you very much for your comments. We are very glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. It is a pleasure to serve our guests and we are happy to have had you. We are looking forward to the great changes happening, and we hope that you will see them first hand when you come back to visit us again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Proximity And Pool - But Would Stay Elsewhere
Summary: I would NOT stay here again.  The beds were alright, but pretty firm, I'm usually not at all picky about my bed at a hotel, but these were pretty hard.  The room size was pretty tight for 2 adults and 2 <5 year old children to move around in.  To give just an understanding of how dysfunctional this place is, they have super ultra low flow aerators on their bathroom sinks.  So low flow it makes it takes forever to fill a glass of water or even rinse out your toothbrush.  Then right next to it they have a leaking bathtub faucet with a super high flow shower head.  Then right outside the bathroom they have an AC unit where the fan runs continuously and is pretty loud, borderline annoying but probably added white noise to the room.  The room we were in was so tight it had a table
Manager Response: Hello aver2801,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department managers has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and these issues have been taken into consideration. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel with comfortable beds and great rates
Summary: I stayed there from May 1 through May 5 while attending a conference at the Disneyland hotel.  My budget only allowed for a cheaper rate hotel but the hotel was a wonderful bargain.  Rates just over 100 a night, the beds were extremely comfortable and the conference party ended up being at this hotel.  Plus, they gave my wife a great picture of Disneyland  All in all a great experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here when it was the Ramada so decided to try it again. The location is great as it is right across from Disney's main gate.   They have free Wifi which is nice but the coverage was terrible. The Wifi would cut out several times so I had to use cell data a lot. Hope they upgrade that soon  The bed was comfortable and the room looked renovated. The air conditioner was LOUD. The walls were paper thin. The people next door had a baby and when he cried, it sounded like the baby was in our room. I could hear anyone that walked on the floor above us. I am a light sleeper so that did not work well for me  The staff were friendly and helpful. The pool was nice but a lot of the spraying items were not work no well. Rather disappointing for the kids  They did away with the
Manager Response: Hello Jason B,  We appreciate you taking the time in addressing your concerns. We apologize that you were experiencing issues with the Wi-Fi during your stay. I am happy to inform you that soon we will be getting an upgraded wi-fi system for our internet users. Our guests are encouraged to seek assistance from the Front Desk whenever necessary, as we are often able to help our guests with connectivity issues should they arise. There is also a 24 hour technical support number available to further assist our guests when necessary. We hope that you will come back and see us again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Rooms were spacious, walking distance to the main entrance of Disneyland and a wonderful bar on the roof, where you can view the fireworks.  The bar on the roof offers wonderful food.  The restaurants in the area offer you discounts for your stay at the hotel.
Manager Response: Hello Vinnie850,  We are glad to see that you enjoyed some of our best features such as our great rooms  and wonderful rates as well as our rooftop restaurant and bar. We hope that as we continue to improve our services, you will allow us the opportunity to serve you again in the future.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: BE CAREFUL LEAVING YOUR BAGS AT THE FRONT DESK
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many times while it's been both the Ramada Maingate and now the Grand Legacy.  The location is awesome, but I have to warn potential guests about my experience this weekend with my luggage. I left my bags at the front desk after we arrived (a few hours before check-in) so I could go into the parks with my friends before our room was ready. When we came back to get our room key and get situated, my bags were gone.  I panicked--the bags plus everything in them cost maybe $4000.  I always trust the hotel to keep my belongings safe. I was paying over $600 for a two night stay, I feel like they at least owe their customers that.  They have bag tags that were on each bag, but were not checking them. They were going off of people saying "oh, that's my bag"
Manager Response: Hello Lizzy Z,  Thank you for your TripAdvisor review. We apologize for the experience with your luggage. We have reviewed our luggage handling system and have taken every steps to ensure this will not happen again. Our goal is to meet the needs of every guest that stays with us, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We hope as we continue to improve our services that you will allow us the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I did a great deal of research when choosing a Disney area hotel. From what I read, I decided to upgrade to the premiere room and I am glad we did because this level room increased its level to around a 3-star hotel. The premiere room was nice and clean, with new double sinks and a nice shower. The beds were also very comfortable and it was an average size hotel room (not sure what the other rooms are like since this is two steps up from the normal room).
