My complaints were that the bathroom door was extremely scuffed and the sliding door would not close and would slide completely open. We had to stuff a towel in the door jam to keep it shut. Once the door was open you also had to pry your fingers in the small crack in the wall to close the door. They should definitely invest
Manager Response: Hello Gabrielle M,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us and enjoyed our comfortable clean room. I do apologize about the issues you encountered with our bathroom pocket door. I can assure you that our Maintenance has taken care of it. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The location is about 5 mins walk into the park They have decent sized rooms with a full size fridge and microwave and large TVs Our room had two large queen beds which were very comfortable beds made everyday  Coffee machine and a breakfast bag was available at no extra charge on a first come first service basis which consisted of a bottle of water an apple granola bar and string cheese There was a nice shaped pool and spa with fountain sprays for the kids There is a rooftop bar where you can see the fireworks if you are a guest you do not have to pay to get into this as it's exclusive There is a laundry yo can use and the ice machine and machine with sweets pot noodles crisps etc, our room was next door to this but we never heard anything The rims are built on a U shape grid 4
Manager Response: Hello vonski1,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The hotel was fine, the pools were great.  The location was stellar, but the noise was unbelievable.  The building actually shook from 8AM-11AM.  Why were we placed in a room where known construction was taking place AND WE WEREN'T NOTIFIED?  We would have paid for a room in a different location (paving, etc. only affected 5% of the facility AND IT WAS THE OFF SEASON AND 2/3 EMPTY.  Worst hotel stay in my 36 years, and by a LONG shot.  8 AM unannounced building shaking!  Rippled the Damon toilet water!
Manager Response: Hello Andy C,  Thank you for your feedback. We do apologize about the experience you encountered with our paving on part of our parking lot. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This is the second time this school year we have chosen this hotel when coming with my daughters group. This hotel is clean and very convenient to the park. We walk across. I like how we get to park at the hotel and walk over in the morning. I don't like that we get charged for parking which I find weird since hotels don't usually charge for parking.
Manager Response: Hello Emz805,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your room was clean and our location is convenient to the park. Many hotels now charge a daily parking fee. We hope to see you when you come back again to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I've stayed on Disney property and this was better than the Grand Californian. Better value and I'm pretty sure it is closer to the Disneyland entrance. The Legacy 2 Suite was very nice. It still smells new. The staff was friendly. Don't stay on the 4th floor unless you don't mind loud music late at night. You can hear the roof top band. This only happens if there is a private party or on the weekends. I would not hesitate to stay here again, just would ask for a 3rd floor room.
Manager Response: Hello kdoll2,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Even though they were under construction everything went smoothly with our visit. Our room was clean and well appointed. Free breakfast is "meh". So close to Disneyland entrance. We walked. I would stay here again for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary/birthday trip to Disney and we loved it. Check in was a breeze, very nice staff. Each one of them said hello and welcome. The valet attendant was very informative, he told us if we didn't find a parking to bring our car back around and he would valet for us, and it's no extra charge from what you pay the hotel for parking, which was about $14 a day, that's after tax. We found a parking next to our room. It is limited parking but if you get there at a decent time to check in you can find a space, there were plenty when we got there.   We stayed on the ground floor which was nice. Just us two so we got a king bed, good size room. Bed was comfortable and pillows were amazing. You get a microwave and fridge in the room and the fridge
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have visited many times and never had a bad experience. This location is amazing with easy access to Disneyland (even closer than two of the Disney Hotels); very helpful friendly staff and management team; newly built suites/rooms; and until recently a full hot breakfast meal with eggs, bacon, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, fruit as well as many breakfast drinks. Because visitors decided to complain about the size of the eating area and other nit picking, the management has stopped the hot breakfast. You now get a bottle of water, an apple, a cheese stick and health bar. This change was forced on the management and the bag of items each mornings replaces a $10-14 hot breakfast. So, you can thank the nit pickers for not appreciating what we had as part of the daily price. Enough,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just got back from an Easter break staying at the Grand Legacy. We loved the location - so close to Disney, we walked there and back twice per day and it was easy with our 8 and 10 year olds.  The pool is OK but the kids said it was a little cool. There's a spray park bit which a couple of kids were playing in. There's also a hot tub.  The included Breakfast bags were handy - simple, just an apple, cheese stick, granola bar and bottle of water.  Better than nothing which is what you normally get around here.    We were towards the back of the hotel, it was pretty quiet.  The room was a decent size but felt quite dark.  Rooms come with a microwave and fridge.  Internet was generally OK. A couple of slow times but we were all streaming most of the time.
Manager Response: Hello vancouversmithy,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Pros: Location! Great for tired feet at the end of the night...very close to the main signal light to get to disneyland. Pool for kids. Has squirter, fountains and it's a lightening bolt shape where the kids are on one end and the deeper end at the other near the hot tub. Price. We got a pretty good pre anniversary rate.Rooms were clean. Valet parking at no extra charge. The Laundry room was big, cleans and prices were OK.  Cons: Older rooms are small. Our toilet was very low to the ground and it backed up (maintenance came in a flash to fix it so that was great) Beds felt old and hard (good pillows tho) The "to go" snack bags are only given until 9 or 9:30 which we only could make it 2 out of our 4 days. Elevators are only located at the middle tower and would fill up fast so
Manager Response: Hello wendisfan,  On behalf of our entire staff, we apologize for the issues you experienced at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Family vacation to Disneyland is never complete without a hotel within walking distance. The Grand Legacy is a nice hotel that is SO CLOSE. Walk down the road and you have Dennys, IHOP, and McDonald's for breakfast. I only have a few things that could have been different. The number one problem was parking. There are very limited spaces and they make you pay extra for it. It's about $12 a night, which is what you pay to park at Disney in the first place. The lot is very crowded and we had to just leave our car in the middle of the aisle for the valets to worry about. (The valets were very nice by the way). The beds and pillows were comfy. Our room, 142, didn't close properly unless someone was in the room to bolt lock it, which was a pain, but we had adjoining rooms, so it
Manager Response: Hello ShandiJan,  Thank you for your review. I apologize for any inconveniences you experienced while staying with us. Improvements is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent location but housekeeping let this place down
Summary: We have just left this place after a 7 night stay. Check in was great and efficient, our room was at the back of the resort which meant a bit more walking but was away from the busy main road. The room was ok, two good sized beds, bathroom and sitting area. We were right outside the lift so it was a bit noisy but only when people came back late. The pool area was great with towels provided and a good pool for everyone + a good open hot tub too. The only thing that let this place down was the housekeeping team. We had our room serviced but some days they didn't do it and one day only did one bed and left the other one. Cleanliness was ok but it wouldn't put me off staying again (small management changes required) Excellent location to Tony Romano, IHOP, Denny's, Ice creamery shop
Manager Response: Hello Tim E,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear about the  unfortunate experience with our housekeeping crew. I can assure you that our Housekeeping Manager has been notified of this. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This was our first time back since the hotel has been updated, and we were impressed with the new look, very attractive and comfortable! all the staff were great, housekeeping was friendly and efficient, maintenance was great, the front end staff were knowledgeable and nice. The in room amenities were great like coffee and make up remover wipes. The beds were comfortable, and the air conditioning worked perfectly. The pool was excellent, big enough but it felt fun and safe. The spray park was fun for our little guy, and the hot tub was a great temperature. The valet parking service was free and convenient when the parking lot got overly busy, the valets were friendly, careful, and helpful. The best part was the daily snack bags on the way to the park...saved us good money on
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family spent 5 days at Disneyland in October. The hotel has been recently renovated, and everything was clean and in working order.  When we checked in, we made use of the on site coin laundry, and the front desk was able to provide us with a role of coins. The staff was friendly and helpful. The complementary breakfast was perfectly adequate, and the staff did their best to keep the area clean and well stocked. The nature of the hotel, being across the street from Disneyland does mean that the area was crowded and a bit chaotic (families all trying to eat before heading out for a busy day in the park) though perfectly reasonable for what it was.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello AdamKberg,  Thank you very much for your comments. We are very glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. It is a pleasure to serve our wonderful guests and we are happy to have had you. We are looking forward to the great changes happening, and we hope that you will see them first hand when you come back to visit us again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We returned to this hotel after a stay there in January. We asked to have a room next to our respite worker who helps with our special needs child. We were not given side by side rooms, which is very inconvenient in the middle of the night when your child needs help, the room above us was leaking in the bathroom so when you sat on the toilet you got dripped on, the wifi is horrible, and the parking is NOT free. The location is great, and our room was clean, beds are comfy, and the pool is fun. It was just an unfortunate experience of not being heard about needing rooms together and a leaking bathroom. The wifi was annoying, but not a necessity.
Manager Response: Hello Marken98,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This hotel was a quick walk to Disneyland and CA Adventure.  The parking was free throughout the stay.  The room was outdated but clean.  For people who spend from morning until night in the park, it was the perfect fit.  Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello BostonKata,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: When you spend your time calling the Tech Support
Summary: Arrived here yesterday and my dear Pom had bad wifi signal. I contacted the guest services told Ken they have upgrades and I should try again in an hour. I tried again Andy it was still not working so I decided to wait till today since it was very late already.  I raised the issu again today and I was put in contact to an external tech support who mentioned that they will escalate the issue and contact me.  And since no one contact me and I have urgent work to finish, I called the guest service again and they told me tthey will put me in contact again with the tech support. 20 minutes later and nothing happened so I called for "Again" . Th guest service agent this time put m  in contact with the tech support who told me that he can't do anything for me and asked me to contact
Manager Response: Hello ShadyRamadan,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated so as to ensure that this type of incident does not take place again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: The bar noise makes this hotel unlivable despite having great rooms for families
Summary: The noise from the bar with the heavy bass made it impossible to sleep until the bar closes, which is 1 am on weekends. The rooms are nice enough and easily fit a larger family (we have 4 kids), which is why we chose this hotel, but the noise makes it a horrible place for a family. We won't stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Dwayne M,  Thank you for your comments. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future in our variety of different rooms that we have in a different area of the hotel.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First and foremost I must say that the housekeeping and maintenance staff at this location was incredible. They are the ONLY reason I gave the hotel three stars. Our room was always clean and our stayover service was on point every single day of our stay. Grand Legacy's maintenance and housekeeping staff were some of the nicest and most polite people I've experienced in the hospitality industry.   Unfortunately I cannot say the same for the staff in the reception area. First of all while making my reservation I had to call and modify my reservation to add my annual pass holder discount. The gal that helped me was very nice. Unfortunately I had to call back a couple times because she got busy, then had to confirm and ask questions about my booking. Both calls I had different
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent location across the street from Disneyland's main gate. The staff is welcoming, friendly & knowledgeable. They went above & beyond in every way possible. The room is spacious. Plenty of room for 4 people. The pool area is clean & fun.  I highly recommend this establishment.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hotel okay if you find a good deal on nightly rate, BEWARE of using the valet......
Summary: Stayed here during our recent trip to Disneyland.    	So before entering the room, I noticed a gap between the door and the frame.  I thought it was odd.  It wasn‚Äôt just our door though.  ALL the rooms had a gap between the door and the frame.  Unlocking the door was nice and convenient.  Which was REALLY nice because carrying A TON of stuff to the room and trying to insert a key card into the slot is hard but all we had to do was touch the key card to the front and it unlocked.  The door didn‚Äôt shut close via spring or whatever in the door after opening like most hotel doors do.  It stayed open so no one had to block the door with the door lock thingie to keep it open.          Anyway, upon entering the room at 8 pm, I noticed that the carpet was damp.  I guess they cleaned the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here over spring break, at first I was a little concerned with the mixed reviews. We had a room at the back of the property on the 4th floor it was amazingly quiet with the amount of cheer teams that were also staying at the property. It is super close to the entrance to Disneyland which made it perfect to come back and enjoy some down time at the pool which is great for kids of all ages. Our room was very clean, we have stayed in a few places on the strip and for our kids this is the winner so far. We make yearly trips to see Mickey and friends and this will not be our last time staying here. If you are expecting a 5 star room, try a new hotel or one farther away, I would have given this a 5 star but there is some wear on the room which is expected from how busy these
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nicely remodeled. Clean rooms. Fun pool area. And a very short walk to the gates of Disneyland! Only bummer was the "snack bag" breakfast. Although a little something is better than nothing. Would definitely stay again.!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Grand Legacy At The Park is a great place to stay in Anaheim, especially if you're planning on going to the Disney Parks.  The staff is awesome, nice, professional, and seem to like serving their community.  Our room was very clean and well stocked.  We stayed for 5 nights and it was quiet and within walking distance to a Denny's, IHOP, a pizza  shop called Pizzatarian (Gluten-Free crust available), and next door to a Tony Roma's (all restaurants have allergen menus).  The hotel also has a restaurant called the Fifth, although we didn't dine there.  There is also a souvenir shop close by with a cold case with soda, milk and alcoholic beverages.  Grand Legacy is close to the Disney Parks, it took us 7-9 minutes on average to leave our room and enter the front gate.  We very
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very pleasant staff, very clean room and liked the new remodeling.  The Fifth was awesome!  Great views and very pleasant environment - a great way to unwind after a long day.  I especially liked the blankets and fire pits and towers.  A nice touch...the "to go" bags are great!  Nice to have a bottle of water with a few healthy snacks to take and go!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We go to Disneyland frequently and love to stay in hotels across the street.  We have usually stayed at Del Sol or Desert Inn.  We chose this hotel because it was cheaper.  This was our first stay at Grand Legacy and we sincerely enjoyed our stay.  It is only a couple of buildings away and we will stay there again.  The kids loved the pool.  Our room was clean and spacious.  The only negative was the internet.  It was spotty at best but they told me that they are working on that.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here in March 2017, The location is excellent, close to Disney and lots of restaurants near by. We had no issues with parking. Room was small but we managed fine, rooms were very clean. Internet was very slow and this was a big negative for us. We had an issue with our room noise next to the cleaners room, early am noise and late pm noise from staff slamming the doors. We were ground floor it was very noisy at times. I went and spoke to the manager who moved us to a quieter room, he was very accommodating in helping make our stay enjoyable. I would stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel pricing during Spring break is usually a bit pricier so there was a lot of research done before deciding on this one.  Finally decided on this as the hotel was within a short walk to Disney and the hotel website showed pictures of nice looking rooms for a reasonable price. I also liked the fact that the rooms had a microwave so that we could heat up food for breakfast (e.g. instant oatmeal).  On arrival, my friends and I requested a room on the top floor of the side building so that there was no noise from above.  The front of hotel was noisier as that was where the bar was located and faced the road traffic and Disney fireworks.  Clean Deluxe room with 2 queen beds, small bathroom with little counter space (so used a chair placed behind bathroom door to put everyone's
Manager Response: none

Summary: My kids and i travel to Anaheim a lot, mind you we have not been to DIsneyland as a family of four since my kids were 2 and 4. So they were excited that their daddy was coming, we had booked a room at The Best Western Pavilions where we have stayed countless times before. Upon our arrival at 5am at that hotel, we received horrifying customer service. After getting corporate involved and the front desk not wanting to refund our money, i started looking around for another room.   I came across The Grand Legacy, called them and spoke with Daisy, not only was she so understanding and helpful but she mentioned she could get us into a room immediately so we can rest. She said she would hold our room for an hour while we dealt with BW, 15 mins later i called and mentioned we were on
Manager Response: none

Summary: On a recent trip to Disneyland we stayed at this place. Nice clean rooms. Bathroom was clean with plenty of towels. Only complain was the toilet was very slow to flush. Beds were a lil harder than I like but it was acceptable. WiFi signal wasn't very good, I was never able to connect. The television was a nice flat screen. Keep in mind they do charge $12 plus tax for parking. Had to wait about 5 mins for someone to leave to get a spot. Our check in was at 3:00 but they allowed us to leave our car there at 8am,so we can just walk to Disneyland instead of paying at the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our travel agent recommended this hotel because it included a hot breakfast.  We found out that the hot breakfast was discontinued in January 2017.  When I complained that we had paid for this and hadn't been notified in advance, I was told that the hotel had no contact information for us.  Apparently, they had no obligation to contact either our travel agent or Westjet Vacations either. The hotel offered us an opportunity to join a private group for a breakfast for 6 of the 7 days that we were there but unfortunately, the person in charge of the private group made it very clear that it was for her group only, and that we were not invited.  Feeling humiliated, we went back to the front desk and were told that a hot breakfast would be available for pickup at 7 am the next
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times. The first time we stayed toward the front of the hotel and we had a little trouble with the wifi which we need for my daughter to conduct some business. We spend some time on the phone with tech support and it did not help much but didn't effect our visit that much.At that time I would have given the hotel 3 stars. Breakfast was okay, room was okay, service was average. The second time we stayed we were at the back of the hotel and could not stay on wifi, we keep getting bumped off and we spent hours on the phone with tech support and the mail office trying everything and even having maintenance reset the router in the office, They said the wifi signal wasn't as good in the back of he hotel and I asked why they put us there when I had
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family goes to Disneyland on average of once a year and we always stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  This time however, I was not going to pay the really over inflated price.  We chose the Grand Legacy and I was a bit leery to do this based on the negative reviews I had read.  The location of this hotel is fantastic.  Closer to the main gates than the DL Hotel.  When I booked this hotel, I asked for a room on the top floor (based on reviews I read about the high level of noise and i didn't want to hear trampling above me).  We got a two queen room on the top floor and we heard none of the noise issues that others on Tripadvisor wrote about.  The carpets are slightly worn as is the furniture.   I had to request that the two chairs in the room be replaced because there was no
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: $$ is worth more than the client
Summary: I stayed at this hotel on 12 and 13th Feb. And was booked for the location of Disneyland. I wasn't expecting much. And I got what I expected. Just one main point.. I wanted a super shuttle back to Lax.( this is the firm I used on the way from LAX) upon asking for the same company ( from there travel department at the front of the Hotel) I was told that we don't use this company. I then replied can you call them so I can book it direct my self.  WELL!! the answer I got was NO!!. The reason for this was clear. The company they wanted me to use was $6 more ( and they want there commission) So I had to walk down the street to another Hotel, And get them to call me a super Shuttle. I just couldn't believe it!!! Breakfast also wasn't what was agreed on the booking to!! I had a ground
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, but disappointed Included breakfast had turned into un appertising snack bag
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland so we did a lot of research into where to stay.  We saw some pretty good reviews on this property and was attracted to the "included breakfast" they advertised. However, when I asked about this, the breakfast was actually a snack bag consisting of a bottle of water, apple (many were bruised) and a museli bar that was so dry my girls couldn't eat it.  So was very disappointed in this. The room was tiny for a family of 4.  We ended up buying an airbed for our daughter as the girls kept each other awake. My other gripe was that the Wifii was only really useable in the laundromat and kept on dropping out in our room. So, with all these things combined, I can't say that I would recommend this property, apart from its location.
Manager Response: none

Summary: we came to anaheim in august for one night, after a week long stay in san diego. had reservation at another hotel, but we took one look and one stifled breath{ no ac } and ran. grand legacy was a couple of hotels down so in desperation we stopped to ask about any openings. it was weekend, in august, and I was crying at that point. it was a day before our 25th wedding anniversary, which we planned to spend at Disneyland, and we had no room. legacy not only found us a room, but matched our previous hotel price. Great staff, clean, open, lots of parking, and ac was blasting! awesome warm pool, too. will definitely stay again in the future. I wish to thank the young man who was so helpful, i think his name was julio.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing 3 Room Suites - Perfect for Families!
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel several times when it was previously the Ramada.  I was excited to see the changes as now they have gone under a large renovation and added a tower of rooms along the front side of the property facing Harbor Blvd.    Our family was going to Disneyland, and instead of getting two adjoining rooms, we booked the 3 room suite, and it was amazing and well worth it!  2 completely separate rooms with a living room in the middle was just the space we needed, and it worked extremely well for nap time with toddlers.  The rooms are about a year old, and they did a great job during the remodel.    We were disappointed in the breakfast service this time though - always as the Ramada, this hotel had a great little continental breakfast, but said they were in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed here again for another trip to Disneyland. Sign up for their email specials! We were deciding on where to stay for our latest trip and had actually picked a different hotel. Then we got one of their emails offering a 30% discount. We stayed for about $85 a night. Not bad!  We arrived by plane and Lyft in order to get to the hotel so I am not sure what their current parking rates are. But I know they do charge for parking. (They let us check our bags in at the lobby because we showed up too early to get a room. This gave us the ability to go straight to Disneyland.)  The room itself was nice. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. The room had a fridge, basic toiletries, and wifi. Their soap smells really good.  The negative of the motel is the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is brand new and in walking distance to the convention center and Disney. I'm in Anaheim for a trade show and this hotel could have provided a fairly pleasant stay. Unfortunately, I was put on the 4th floor, directly under the rooftop bar. It is sooo, sooo loud. I can hear the music clearly enough to identify the song titles and the bass is hurting my ears. Imagine chairs and tables being scrapped across the floor for the full affect. Supposedly, the bar is open until 1 am. I'm not happy. I've given this hotel 3 stars because I'd assume there are quieter rooms on the lower floors. I'd go with a different hotel in Anaheim. But If you do book this one, be absolutely certain you are not given a room on the fourth floor! Also, be aware that the rooms are fairly small. Not
Manager Response: Hello gracefesta,  Thank you for your review. I apologize for any inconveniences you experienced while staying with us. Thank you for staying with us. Improvements is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Location is a short walk to Disneyland.  They have a Disneyland AP rate.  First time I stayed here and my room was great. Room was clean and seemed pretty new.Room has a fridge and microwave. Staff is very helpful and pleasant.  Will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect location and my favorite rooftop lounge in Anaheim
Summary: Stayed here for my birthday, loved the new renovations in the lobby and in rooms. The location is about a 7 minute walk to the resort entrance. What I loved most about the resort was the newer Fifth lounge. Has an amazing atmosphere and great views of DCA and Disneyland resort. They even pipe in the music during the fireworks. Loved all the drinks and appetizers as well. They offer an Annual Passholder discount as well. Staff was great and would stay here again in a heart beat. New favorite good neighbor hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Always a great place to stay for our Disneyland trips
Summary: We always stay here for our Disneyland trips and it's always a great experience. The location is perfect since it's only a very short walk away from the parks; very convenient when we want to come back and take a nap during the day, walk back late after the parks close, and when we have to leave extra early for the runDisney races. The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the rooms are always clean. The rooms have a microwave oven and refrigerator, which is very helpful when you have leftover food from the parks you want to store and reheat, and when you want to bring your own snacks/food. We're always happy staying here.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Location is the only reason that is saving this hotel.
Summary: Discontinuing the HOT breakfast service is a highly impacting factor. It's not the same as discontinuing the iron in the room. Hot breakfast is actually a MEAL that people need. An apple, bar, water and cheese stick is not a substantial meal. According to your FDA, it was taken away because guests complained the eggs were not hot enough. Instead of coming up with a better solution, you create the snack bag.   Our rooms' water pressure and temperature was all over the place. The sinks' pressure was soo little and only provided cold water. It took me 10 minutes to wash a cup! The shower pressure was strong but the temperature fluctuated uncontrollably. One minute it was insanely hot, the next minute cold as ice. Also there was mold in the upper left hand corner of the bathroom.
Manager Response: Hello JHNY,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department managers have been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and these mishaps have been taken into consideration. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Grand Legacy in mid-February. It is fairly new hotel and in good condition.  However, there is nowhere close to enough parking, so even though you have to pay for parking, you need to valet park to get a spot.  They really didn't try to make you feel welcome. The plus side is that it is very close to the park entrance.
Manager Response: Hello mrboge,  Thank you for your review. Although it is true that parking can get pretty crowded when the hotel is experiencing a high-occupancy night, we are excited to offer valet service at no additional cost to our guests. We will always make sure that every guest has a parking space. Please let us know if ever you need assistance with this.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Not good..But we made the best of the situation.
Summary: Let start out by saying, I researched this trip to death.  I thought I was getting a great deal.  I will start out by pointing out the good things.  The bed was comfortable.  The pool and hot tub were nice. The hotel is right across from the entrance to Disney. The folks at the front desk were nice.   Now lets get to the bad things.  No hot water.  Internet was horrible.  No breakfast like advertised.  Apparently there was an email that went out last month stating this.  I never got one. A sack snack pack with a water, cheese stick, apple and a granola bar was given out instead.  Awful..... I will stay at the Best Western up the street next time.
Manager Response: Hello Kgv938,  We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property on a daily basis. In addition, please know that your comments will be addressed. It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you. Again, we apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: It was a brief one night stay and I had stayed here previously during the renovations. After the renovations, the lobby looked nice but it still lacks in other areas. Their rooftop bar was closed for the evening for a private event which was disappointing. The website is very confusing with the complimentary "breakfast" but in reality its just a snack bag (??) I woke up very hungry and was given a granola bar, apple, and string cheese which was not what i was really looking for. The room was clean and nice for a one night stay, and a convenient walk to Disneyland but overall I think i will look elsewhere here on out as an Disneyland annual passholder.
Manager Response: Hello madelinefldion,  We apologize for the inconvenience during our change from continental breakfast to our Snack Bag To-Go. We went through every measure to update all places online with an update on our breakfast and called all future guests to inform them of the change. We are sorry if you were not contacted about the change. We are happy to let you know our downstairs hotel eatery Jimboy‚Äôs offers an exclusive discounted Grand Legacy breakfast special.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: A great way to do Disney
Summary: The location was perfect and the staff was friendly and helpful.  Our room was ready when we arrived about 9am and I found everything to be very clean.  The room is simple but met all of our needs.  The Fifth was a great place to grab a meal and a drink before heading back to Disney to watch the parade and fireworks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Average, But I wouldn't stay here again.
Summary: The photos online were okay, but I expected better especially for a hotel primarily affiliated with Disney.  Staff was friendly and spoke good spanish with my parents. Unfortunately there was a storm going on when we got there and the front desk was offering an umbrella for $8. Like, seriously? $8 to borrow an umbrella? And my parents weren't pleased with the idea of having to pay for the parking, especially considering we only stayed there one night.  The staff at the front desk were laughing at my dad when he went out in the rain so that he could get to the car, and we weren't willing to borrow an umbrella for $8.  The carpet in our room had some weird magenta stain near the sink in the corner of the room. I didn't like the idea of the sink being outside of the bathroom, It
Manager Response: Hello,  Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback. I am very sorry to hear about the experience you encountered with our team member. We do our best to meet the needs of every guest, and I apologize that your stay was not to your satisfaction. We have taken your comment into consideration and will use it to better our facilities and services. Our hope is that as we continue to improve, an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Extreme stay experience for 2 separate stays
Summary: My husband and I first stayed at this hotel in May of 2016 while it was under going their upgrade.  We stayed in one of the new premier King rooms.  We had no complaints.  Their were no stores or restaurants because they weren't finished.  We thought the location was great.  We were bringing our girls in December so we decided to stay here. Didn't enjoy it as much.  Our room location went from the front by the office to the very back.  The room itself was good.  If there had been fireworks we would have been able to see them.  The positives is the mini fridge and coffee maker.  The negatives were no hooks or anywhere to put your clothes and stuff while you were in the bathroom.  Not enough counter space for the 3 of us, 2 being teenage girls.  There was a lot of wasted space
Manager Response: Hello thedonalds2016,  Thank you for your tripadvisor response. We are happy to have had you and are grateful that you took the time to provide us with feedback. I do apologize for the lack of space and for the wifi issues you encountered. We are currently working on upgrading our wifi, this project should be completed soon. We hope that you will allow us to serve you again in the near future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This is a nice hotel, just across the street from the entrance to the Disneyland theme parks. We booked online and received a pretty decent rate for the mid-week night that we wanted to be there.  One thing you need to be aware of is that there are A LOT of rooms here and not much parking.  So, don't expect to park close to your room.  Also, because of the number of guests that stay at the Grand Legacy, the free breakfast was extremely packed.  We waited in line for a while to eat and had a hard time finding a place to sit down (many people save tables while their family waits in line).  All that being said, the staff was awesome.  We were able to check in early, and the hotel even let us park on site after we checked out. They were friendly, happy to see us and even gave our
Manager Response: Hello Mat A,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort area.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Since Disney is exhausting the location is its best selling feature. This motel is very sparse for room amenities. It's ok not great but ok. The pool is great for the kids but the snack bag for breakfast is not a breakfast like other hotels. An apple, water,  cheese string and Granola bar. Good for taking to Disney but not a breakfast. The WiFi is unreliable. It's clean so if you aren't looking for fancy then it's a good place to take a break from the park in the afternoon then return back again with not too much walking. They do have a pizza place and a convenience store with some beer or wine for mom and dad after a long day at the park.
Manager Response: Hello Kari Lynn D,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at Grand Legacy At The Park we would like to apologize for the issues you encountered at our hotel.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean and Sparse, what more do you need ?
Summary: Reviews are mixed, we initially were worried after we booked the Westjet package but it was okay. 6 or 7 out of 10 is all I would rate it. Rooms are dark, bathroom is large and empty. No hooks or shelves for clothes etc. I don't like putting my clothes on the floor of a bathroom. No breakfast offered, a go bag with a cheese stick, Apple and granola bar & water are offered. This means you will be spending another $30 - $40 on a simple family breakfast . It is clean and bedbug free, and staff are pretty helpful. Wifi is brutal, hardly connected or allowed you to even check mail without cutting out.
Manager Response: Hello bluedeuce32,  On behalf of our entire staff, we apologize for the concerns you had about our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Location 5 mins walk to Disneyland, but room & amenities are relatively old
Summary: Definitely a short walk to Disneyland & California Adventure.  The management emailed us in early Jan that no breakfast is served, only "to-go-bags" snacks for breakfast (bottle of water, an apple and a granola bar).  WIFI is choppy, and rooms that we have, are not up-to-date.  We are able to see slight view of the fireworks from our room.
Manager Response: Hello Barbara L V,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for Grand Legacy At The Park.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, lacks in other areas.
Summary: The Grand Legacy has a great location if you are going to Disneyland. Be aware that they have stopped serving a traditional breakfast and now gives you  a "Go Bag" for breakfast. We opted to eat at nearby restaurants instead. If you need or want WIFI, this is not the hotel for you. All of the rooms that are not in the main building and surround the parking lot have a terrible connection and is usually unavailable. If you want to sit and the lobby next to the elevator the connection isn't bad, just really inconvenient.  The rooms are okay, but lack outlets that are accessible for charging phones and tablets. The lighting is pretty poor.  However, if you are there to go to Disneyland, it is an easy walk with good nearby restaurants.
Manager Response: Hello Gayle M,  Thank you for your response. We are happy to have had you and are grateful that you took the time to provide us with feedback. I do apologize for the inconvenience of our wifi. We are in the process of upgrading our wifi. We thank you for allowing us to accommodate you and hope to see you soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: My Stay During the NAMM Show
Summary: In January, I had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Legacy Hotel for my business trip.  We enjoyed the hot tub, heated pool, and diverse hot breakfast selection!  Every time we came into contact with the cleaning staff, they were extremely friendly and helpful.  Several of my co-workers stayed here as well, and it was definitely a trip to remember!
Manager Response: Hello hlaur3n,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and we hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We are AP holders at Park and go there often we have stayed at many of the other hotels in the area. One of them that we stay at is being Demoed so enter the Grand Legacy, We were very pleased with the room and size it was clean nice bedding we had a great stay. We will be back again. The staff was great as well.
Manager Response: Hello chrissE9901SC,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for giving us a try and we are excited that you will be coming back.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Place looks nice, well kitted out except for when it rains there is not enough cover.  Food we ordered was all pretty good, only exception being the burger which was really dry.  Great selection of drinks. Drinks way over priced which is why they don't have prices on the menu, be warned.  $15 for a shot is ridiculous for Anaheim.
Manager Response: Hello Darrencru,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in January, 2017, having stayed there 4 previous times with my family when it was Ramada Maingate. All my previous experiences were generally positive and I had stayed during those times in a range of room types, from classic (basic, smaller ground floor room), 3rd floor Deluxe 2 Queen and 3rd floor Premier.This stay, my experience was very mixed and I'm unsure if I would return.  The hotel certainly now looks sharper from the street and its lobby, street frontage taco, pizza and ice-cream eateries, small food mart and discount ticket and tour office are all worth visiting. "Jimboy's Tacos", in particular, are exceptional in their service, food quality,generous portions, variety and pricing, and I enjoyed their meals many times! Check-in was
Manager Response: Hello PattieG,  Thank you for your review. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our team works very hard to keep up with our facilities and this mishap has been taken into consideration. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for our large family at a great value!
Summary: This is our new go-to hotel for our family of 6. Nina provided us with amazing customer service, the convenience of walking to the park is awesome, and the breakfast was great. Looking out our window and seeing Tower Of Terror right in front just can't be beat! We'll be returning to the Grand Legacy very soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Grand Legacy is a good mid-level hotel very similar to many of the area hotels that surround it.  We've stayed at most.  What makes this hotel our new "go-to" hotel is the great customer service.  Very friendly and accommodating staff make a big difference.  We have twice had staff go above and beyond when they didn't have to; once involving a package shipped to us and once with a special booking request. The rooms are well equipped, parking is roomy and access to your car is never an issue; they've got free breakfast and a great pool; and the location is awesome!  So convenient to the park!  And I should also mention that they have an ice cream shop and a taco shop in house!  Can't get any better than that! Accommodations and location are awesome - but the great customer
Manager Response: Hello RH-Tripper,  Thank you for your review and for staying at our hotel. We are happy to hear that our team members went above and beyond to help you. We are ecstatic to hear we exceeded your expectations. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Value spot close to the main entrance
Summary: This is a "new" independent hotel that was formerly a Ramada Inn.  From the website and from the street, it's cool, hip and fresh.  But other than the killer 5th floor rooftop bar (which is better suited for Vegas than Disneyland), the rooms have not been touched and still look/feel/smell like a 1980s Ramada Inn.  I stayed here for the MLK weekend w/ my two teenage sons ... our standby is the Fairfield Inn for overall cleanliness and value but it was sold out.  The price for the Grand Legacy for the holiday weekend was reasonable (avg $185/night) given it is actually *CLOSER* to the front entrance of Disneyland than the Fairfield Inn.  But, given a choice of the two, I would walk the extra 200 yards or so for the Fairfield Inn.
Manager Response: Hello johnchinfamily,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Good location for the convention centre and Disney.  Rooms are average - looking rather tired.  We were initially given a room overlooking the stairwell which was very dark and dingy.  The staff could not have been more helpful when I requested a different, brighter room.  Our second room was identical to the first, but a little brighter, at least.  The shower was not working well, so we reported it.  A maintenance engineer appeared very quickly and came back and forth several times, eventually replacing the tap altogether.  However, it made very little difference to the shower.  The connecting door to the next room meant we could hear every word spoken next door so it was quite noisy.  The music from the rooftop bar was very loud at night.  The breakfast selection was very
Manager Response: Hello J S,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the experience you had at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The Grand Legacy is a great hotel to stay at especially when visiting Disneyland. It is a short walk to the parks and there are restaurants so close if you don't want to eat at the park. The staff are friendly, rooms are nice and the breakfast is pretty good. There jut isn't a lot of room in the breakfast room. We have had to eat at the outdoor tables standing up or take the food to our room. We use our CAA for a discount! We have stayed here several times.
Manager Response: Hello Darla B,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Was here for a convention. The hotel strives for hipness but ends up as a fleabag. Rooftop bar never stops the music. The rooms are small, dimly lit and filthy. Staff is rude. In a city with few truly good mid-priced hotels, this one is a must to avoid.
Manager Response: Hello Dan D,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated. Thank you for staying with us.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This was the old Ramada maingate. Deluxe room was "ok" , the water pressure was minimal for both sink and shower. Stains on the chairs which I cant stand to see cause who knows what they are from. I just dont like seeing that, they need to replace them if they are stained. Its not good to see. Staff were friendly. I liked the roof top bar, nice view. I'd stay here again because of the location, especially after walking (or running the half marathon) all day.
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer Y,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I've stayed in quite a few of the motels around Disneyland, so I know what to expect. I've even stayed at the Grand Legacy at the Park before when it was a Ramada property- I enjoyed that stay even though the building was under construction, so I came back.  This experience was really sub-par.   Service: Check-in and check-out were fine, but nothing exciting. I definitely had the sense that they were nickel and diming everything- they even charge a dollar if you don't turn back in a room key! Housekeeping also wasn't great- they made the beds and wiped down the sink, but not much else.   Room: I didn't have as many problems with room noise as some others, but I did find my room to be surprisingly run-down. Many of the outlets didn't work at all, and there was only one anywhere
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer L,  Thank you for your review with tripadvisor. I apologize for any inconveniences you experienced while staying with us. Thank you for staying with us. Improvements is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I've stayed at a LOT of properties around Disneyland; this is the first and last time we will stay here. Proximity to the park is a plus, but rooms are basic, there's not enough parking for cars, and this is nothing more than a huge, overpriced motel that charges extra for parking (free elsewhere) and has internet service that makes dial-up seem lightning fast and more reliable. Huge disappointment considering I've paid much less for much more within a few blocks. Also, their only restaurant is on the roof and has a "red rope" policy, meaning you can't get up there without paying on weekends and it's all outdoors making it darned cold at night, too. Boo.
Manager Response: Hello ErikaSF,  Thank you for your comments. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and this mishap has been taken into consideration. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The location was perfect. The rest of the experience was horrible. Pubic hair in the shower and on the bathroom walls. Hair in the bedding. Mascara on the mirror. Water rings on the nightstand. All surfaces felt dirty. We stayed for 4 nights and took at least 2 cold showers. The power went out twice. Yes, you read that right; the power actually went out on two separate occasions. I was overcharged for parking and front desk person blamed it on me for not returning the handwritten paper parking pass after taking the rental car back. Then she refused to give me an updated receipt showing that the charges were credited.  Customer service was absolutely horrible. I travel for work and have stayed in some pretty questionable places, but this was by far the worst guest experience I
Manager Response: Hello kcarlto2,  Thank you for your review. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I have notified the department managers regarding this review. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The location is amazing!!! 5 minutes and your are walking into the park! Just returned from a 4 night stay. The hotel is very nice and clean and recently remodeled. Unfortunately we were in the room directly below the rooftop bar. The music was so loud it sounded like a live band was in our room! Thankfully we were so exhausted from Disney all day we were able to sleep but if you are a light sleeper request a lower level room!!! We did not eat the breakfast it was too crowded and didn't want to wait. The taco place directly below the hotel had great food and good breakfast burritos! We will stay here again. When we checked in they warned us that we paid very high rates booking through a 3rd party website, we could have saved over $100 a night booking directly!!! The lady at the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in the Premier room for 6 nights. Check in was simple and quick. Clean rooms, comfy beds, hotel staff very friendly.Breakfast was very good. Pool and hot tub wonderful. Short walk to Disneyland. Only down side is water pressure in shower not to good and the cigarette smoke from those that choose to stand in the walkways to smoke.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Amenities were just ok, location was convenient.  We were able to walk to Disneyland without a problem, it is just across the street. Also close to stores for food, etc. Live music can be loud in the main building but that is where the nicer rooms are.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is close to the main gate of Disney, close enough to go back to your room if you forget something.  The room was comfortable and quiet. A large amount of this hotel is car park. There are no gardens or lawn at all. To get to the pool you have to walk across the car park. The pool is in the middle of the car park.  Very odd. We stayed at the back of the hotel on the ground floor. Staff were pleasant. This hotel is fine but not memorable. The best bit was the proximity to Disney and the extra shops and restaurants on the Strip outside.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The check in process is ridiculous.  It's basically a motel (like motel 6)- unless you upgrade to the tower for an extra charge $35 more per night. We did that and were given a room next door to the kitchen.  They do have breakfast-hardly edible but its available.  For a better more spacious room, way better breakfast, but a slight bit further go for the Hyatt Place.  By the time we upgraded to the tower, we ended up paying way more for a smaller room.  One last thing-the pool area is not what it appears in the pictures and the Five lounge is not family friendly.
Manager Response: Hello My3small,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We have stayed here the last few times we have been to Disney. Mainly because of the location, it is walking distance to the entry  and you can see the fireworks if you are in the right spot. This is the first time we have stayed since the construction has been completed but we weren't there long enough to look around.  We stayed in one of the older rooms and they are definitely in need of an update. The carpet in our room was fraying at the joins which was right in the middle between the beds. The air conditioner is noisy. However for us it is just a bed to sleep in at night as we spend all day at the parks.  The internet is almost non existent and we have never been able to use it since the first time we stayed in 2011. If it does connect it is so slow that I can't use it
Manager Response: none

Summary: Zero star for this hotel. It looked nice from the pictures online and had fairly good reviews that's why we tried it, but turned out, this is a low quality motel with bad customer service.   Bell boy did not even greet nor offered help when we came in. Front desk clerks were not welcoming and the way they responded to questions felt like they did not want to answer at all. There was no early check-in so we had to wait at the front desk from 12:00 noon to almost 4:00 PM.  And when we were already in the room trying to get some rest, one maid knocked and then immediately opened the door using her key, without waiting for us to open the door ourselves. For me that was inappropriate and very inconsiderate of guest's privacy! and to think that we did not call housekeeping for
Manager Response: Hello dokvi,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First time. The location is brilliant for Disney. We were there over new year so expected peak pricing. The hotel however does not live up to stories of refurbishment. Our room was tired, negligible water pressure in washbasin, paper thin walls and dated furniture.  However two serious points for travelers. The breakfast is dreadful and I base this on stays in 36 countries. This is due to a woefully inadequate restaurant to cope with a hotel of this size as well as quantity, range and quality of food. The eggs were cold and rubbery, there was no meat (bacon etc), only basic cereals and bagels/doughnuts and cold water dispenser did not work. There was no space to sit, a long wait to get any food, they ran out food regularly, ran out of plastic cutlery! and the coffee was
Manager Response: Hello Patch005,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn‚Äôt find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We visited this hotel for the second time this year and were again very happy with our stay! So glad to see the breakfast room finished and we enjoyed the breakfast. It's nice to have eggs, biscuits with gravy, toast, cereal, muffins, etc... before a long day at the park. The staff was very nice and our room was very comfy, perfect for a family of 4. We stayed on the 4th floor and were able to see the fireworks from our room! We would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to stay there for all of our future visits to Disney!
Manager Response: Hello JennM0417,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we cannot wait to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stayed with my wife, daughter and niece.  Picked mainly for the location directly across the street form the main entrance.  Room was plenty big.  I liked the firmness of the beds, my wife did not.  Bathroom was ok nothing spectacular. Having Pizzaterian and Jimboy's Tacos on site was great for the late night munchies.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Revamped to a More Corporate Style Motel
Summary: I call it a Motel because the room doors are on outside facing a parking lot, only one building (the new front facing So. Harbor) had inside halls. They are VERY STRICT on Check in Time and Check Out.  We go to D.L. many times a year and normally stay at a different place.  We have stayed at the Ramada Main Gate a handful of times, so when they became a NEW Grand Legacy...we thought lets check it out.  We have stayed at Ramada at least 5 times before in different buildings.  I was excited to be in one of the New buildings in the back.  Room did seem fine, probably the only thing that I remember that sticks out...the bathroom door was a Sliding door, that Sticks..so at times, it was some force to get it moving to close, then would slam.   I mentioned them being Strict on check in
Manager Response: Hello SFBayAreaFamily,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and this mishap has been addressed. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed here last week, in a premium room (They have classic, deluxe, premium and suites) We actually booked a deluxe room, but at the last minute, I checked the rates and the premium was cheaper, so I called and canceled the deluxe and reserved the premium.  When we arrived, they still had us registered for 2 rooms -At first, the clerk said we couldn't cancel the deluxe room and that they'd have to charge us - after I asked to speak to the manager, the deluxe was canceled, however, they do hold the first nights deposit on your card until check out - so for us, that was 2 rooms - that's almost 300 in funds tied up on your card -that was unexpected.  The hotel has been renovated and the rooms are really nice - we stayed in the back tower, 3rd floor. Very quiet, very clean, and
Manager Response: Hello CLBrown67,  Thank you for your tripadvisor review. I would like to apologize for the mishap with the rooms, and I have notified the department manager in regards to this incident. Our goal is to meet the needs of every guest that stays with us. We are glad you were satisfied with your premier room. We hope that as we continue to improve our services, that you will allow us the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Close location, request a room in the back on a higher floor.
Summary: First let me start off by saying we are regulars to Disneyland, and wanted to give a new hotel a try. We were excited to see the location of the grand legacy and were excited for a new experience. When we checked in we were given room 115. This room was pretty close to the entrance on the right hand side. When we got to our room, it was not at all mind blowing, and did not match the photos shown on their website. I get it, they renovated some of the rooms, since that is the case they should have both types of rooms in the pictures. Generic bedding, TV that was off centered, basic bathroom set up, nothing impressive. Once we checked in we headed straight to Disneyland for a few hours before the park closed. When we got back we were ready for a good nights sleep so we could wake
Manager Response: Hello ThisisJulz,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This hotel is in one of the best locations for Disneyland, I can not fault it for location. Literally 5 minutes and your at the gate, it makes taking a break in the day easy, and a Disney day can be a long one!  The hotel has recently had a facelift, name change etc, I watched the website and email updates with interest before I booked as previously we had stayed at Disneyland Hotel which I really didn't see the value in $$$, a change of venue for this trip was needed. Photos, reviews etc looked good so we booked.  Check in was fine, typical LA service, quick no nonsense but also no charisma either. We find our room to be at the very rear of a very large block, we drag our luggage to the elevator to find what I can only describe as a 1980's elevator complete with original wood
Manager Response: Hello dtaust19405,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: THE place to stay for your trip to Disneyland
Summary: Close to Disneyland, very clean, very friendly and helpful staff, great breakfast with lots of options, and very economical.  Love the little stores out front-pizza, ice cream, sundry and discount tickets - went to them all during the course of our stay and very convenient. Microwave, fridge, and for those with kids - very large laundry room.  You won't find more for your money.  We will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Hello K L,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We will be staying here again in the future.  We booked a basic room, 2 double beds.  It had a microwave and fridge, which was a surprise.  The walk though, wow you seriously are that close to Disneyland.  We went back to the hotel every day for a few hours because we were that close to the park.  Wanted to watch Fireworks from there, but I guess the area was closed off due to a private event.  Bummed about that, we never did get to see that area.  Room was really clean.  Water pressure sucked really bad, but if that was our only complaint then this hotel definitely is really amazing.  You do pay for parking, but Breakfast is included.  The breakfast has so many different options and is so yummy.  Parking wasn't too bad, we got there our first night at midnight and found
Manager Response: Hello SDMcCloskey,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My daughter and I were lucky enough to get a room in the new front building this time. The rooms are beautiful! Spacious, clean and new furnishings...what more could we ask for. The new breakfast room is really nice and the breakfast choices were more extensive than before. We definitely didn't leave for Disneyland hungry :). The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly (as always) and the hotel grounds were neatly kept. I don't know that we will ever stay anywhere else.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a regular room with a king bed on the bottom floor.  As far as we could tell it was clean, but the layout was weird and there weren't enough garbage cans or towel racks.  I would highly recommend that they provide more places to hang towels/facecloths by the sink and include garbage bins by the beds if management is reading this.  The breakfast was all right, but it was very busy and hard to find tables.  The service in general at the hotel was good, the property was nice looking, and we really liked the pool.  Our favourite part, however, was the location.  It took almost no time to walk to Disneyland from our room.  We came back every afternoon for a quick nap and a swim because it was so convenient!
Manager Response: Hello MissCharl0tte,  Thank you for your comments. I am sorry to hear that you didn't like the layout of the room you were in. I will address your concerns you mentioned regarding the room you were in. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay. Thank you for staying with Grand Legacy At The Park. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Upgraded Lobby, New Rooftop Venue. Rooms? Eh, not so much.
Summary: OK, I'm old. I remember when this property was the Saga Motor Lodge in the 1960s. Then it became a Ramada, with some improvements. But it was still cheap, had friendly staff, but was pretty shabby around the edges. And best of all, it was close to Disney's main gate.  Now it's the Grand Legacy, with a five story lobby building, new shops below, and a rooftop lounge call The Fifth. But the front desk staff is now uber efficient, more intent on rushing you in and out without any consideration of requests, questions, or anything else. I wouldn't quite call them hostile, but they have no interest in any of their guest's issues.  And the rooms are still kinda shabby. Sinks that are chipped, faucets that are about half clogged with calcium deposits, odd results from bathroom
Manager Response: Hello tigerized,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a comment with your response. I am very sorry to hear about your experience at our hotel. We do our best to meet the needs of every guest, and I apologize that your stay was not to your satisfaction. We have taken your comment into consideration and will use it to better our facilities and services. Our hope is that as we continue to improve, an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed there from the 4-10 Dec. a family of four. Upon arriving there was a line up at reception, we waited but there was no where to sit because of the reception area being quite small, and there aren't many chairs. Reception staff were not warm or friendly. Our room was located at the back building on the 3 rd floor. Room was clean very basic. We could see part of the fireworks from the balcony of our room. Next morning, we went to look for the breakfast room, (btw , was not mentioned whereabouts by the staff during checkin ). It's small with limited seating. Food was ok. For the 6days we were there it was exactly the same food every morning. Plus food was very bland. And if it runs out they don't really stock up. The good thing is they also provide apples, oranges and
Manager Response: Hello moffatt313,  Please accept my apologies if you experienced anything less than great. Your comments have been forwarded to the management team for review. Your patronage is valued here at Grand Legacy At The Park and I would love the opportunity to make a more memorable experience.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great potential, but not a good value
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights the first weekend in December, based on recommendations from a friend and a DLR travel website. While the staff seemed nice, we were generally underwhelmed.   The Good:  -Our room was in the front of the hotel on the 2nd flr and we were able to watch the fireworks from our bed, which was lovely after a long day in the parks -Very quick walk to the park, about 5 minutes.  -Clean, safe rooms and surrounding area. We felt secure after dark and the housekeeping staff did a great job. -There are many chain restaurants in the area w/in a 5 minutes walk (Jimboys, Denny's, IHOP) and a convenience store outside on the first floor.   You'll notice most of the pluses are really about the hotel's location, not the hotel itself. Which brings us to the
Manager Response: Hello piegirl,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you enjoyed our clean room and that you taught our housekeeping staff did a great job. I do apologize about the inconvenience you encountered at our hotel. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the Grand Legacy last week. We had a premier room - back of complex. Room was delightful. Clean. Modern. Comfy beds. Refrigerator/Microwave. WiFi was good. Breakfast was good - was able to find a table every morning.The pool area was fun - and water was warm. And we were able to just walk across the street and we were at Disneyland!  Only complaint - paying for parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived at the hotel on a Sunday at 3pm.  It was very busy, once checked in we learned our room would not be ready until 5pm.  They did allow us to leave our bags at the hotel and go to Disneyland.   Went back about 6pm, retrieved our bags and was able to get in our room.   The room was your typical hotel room.  Nothing terrible nothing great.   Breakfast was horrible.  The way they have it set up is horrible and the breakfast itself was horrible.   The breakfast room is way way way too small.
