If they would have normal tables and chairs outside it would help but they have highboys to stand at and that does not work with kids.  We ended up only eating breakfast their the first morning cause it made all but one person have an upset stomach.   The hotel grounds were actually
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Close-Very Good Place to Hang Your Hat
Summary: Thiis is my second visit since all of the renovations and I will be back again. This time I stayed in a room further back in the resort, clean, comfortable room. Pretty quiet and I know there were families with small kids on both sides of me. I had an easy check-in, staff were very friendly and stowed my bags twice for me.  I was in town for a convention, but was fortunate enough to have some downtime for Disney, hence why I wanted to stay here. It is a very short walk to the parks. A bit of a hike to the Mariott.  The breakfast is still not that great but I did notice they had some decent hot food this time-eggs. Plenty of toast and bagels and cereal and fruit. I checked out their new lounge on the 5th floor. Great ambience, I saw the fireworks from there one night, they piped
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very close to the main gate
Summary: The good: very close to the main gate. Nice staff. Clean hotel. Main tower rooms appear to have been updated recently. Adequate free breakfast. Free wifi.   The not so good: nice bar on top of building but frequently asked to pay 10 dollars to go up to it.  The pool is located in middle of parking lot and has no bathroom or change room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Exceptional front desk, clean modern rooms (stayed in tower) lots of room, we stayed in the 2 bedroom 1 bath suite, very nice, great for families.  Breakfast was ok, best you can expect for a high volume buffet - food was hot to warm, coffee good, bagels fresh, cereal for the kids.  Very close to Disney and additional food choices.   Everything you could want when visiting the Disneyland area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Horrible Experience, small rooms, noisy and construction riddled
Summary: This hotel, while seemingly a good deal was a HORRIBLE choice which we dearly paid for due to the sheer amount of noise and contraction.  It was anything but peaceful and we decided to check out the next morning.  Thankfully they were nice enough to let us cancel and we book in another city.  Would NOT return, EVER.
Manager Response: Hello Brix510,  Genuine efforts were made to provide you exceptional service and accommodate all of your requests. Unfortunately, we were not able to do so, I can assure you that your comments have been taken seriously and addressed accordingly. We take great pride in our property, your experience was unique and does not reflect the overall quality of Grand Legacy At The Park. We hope you may give us another opportunity so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Outside Disneyland front entrance, good price
Summary: This is a budget hotel within a literal stones throw of the Disney front  entrance. Its a trade off between some negative issues and its reasonable price and fantastic location. On the positive side the staff without exception were friendly and helpful, they have a great upstairs bar after 5 pm which sells an excellent scampi pasta and has live music which is not overly loud, it has a laundry which no one else seemed to use, is about a 60 second walk to some good restaurants and take aways, Also we had 3 rooms, and two had an interconnecting door which is great for families.   The main negative is that it is very noisy after 7am, with the constant trundle of cleaners carts which make a weird noise like someone walking along with a bucket on their foot. Most of the guests are
Manager Response: Hello PeterSandgate,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay. I do apologize for the noises you experienced at our hotel. We have addressed this issue and talked to all personal regarding this review. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again in the Anaheim Resort area.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times and through various names, such as the Ramada, and have enjoyed our stays every time. I would give 4 1/2 stars, and not 5 because the inconsistency of the wifi in our room, which hasn't changed from other times we have stayed at this hotel. Also, the walkway to our room seems like a pebbled metallic one, and we have had hotel guests with wheeled luggage walking by and it late in the evening or early morning, it sounds like a jet airplane taking off. Perhaps some type of outdoor carpeting might help?  The good things are great staff, excellent location for walking to Disneyland, which is what we always do, clean rooms, and what seems like an upgraded complimentary breakfast. Our grandchildren enjoy the pool and it's water features. We will
Manager Response: none

Summary: Made a reservation because my husgand and I were going to California to visit our son who was returning from deployment and thought we might fit in a quick trip to Disneyland  Dates changed of his return, so I cancelled our reservation online over a month before the date of our reservation.  I didn't write down the cancellation number because I thought I would get an email.  Never got an email so I don't have the cancellation number.  I was charged $128 for a no show.  I have called twice and was told they needed to speak to a manager but I would get a phone call to let me know if the money could be refunded. I didn't receive a phone call either time......
Manager Response: Hello Kathleen H,  We appreciate the feedback and apologize for the misunderstanding in your reservation. We will use it to fine tune our operations to avoid from this happening again. We hope you may give us another opportunity and stay with us.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice but a bit over priced.
Summary: My wife had stayed here before on business and recommended it. I found it to be a bit overpriced for a Disneyland trip considering hotels that were closer to the entrance where cheaper. It was a nice hotel with an ok free breakfast, beds were very comfortable and the rooms/bathroom were clean. If you want to watch the Disney firework from the rooftop/lounge there is a $10 charge. Parking is $12 a day but all spaces in front of the rooms is reserved for valet so you'll have to park away from your room if you are in the main building. Valet is extra.The walk is not bad and the hotel is next to Denny's and a pizza shop and also a mini mart. Overall a good stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a premier room with 2 Queen sized beds. The mattresses weren't very comfortable and the pillows are like travel size. We were so tired every night after our adventures at the park that it didn't matter too terribly much. I loved having the double sink vanity outside of the actual bathroom. That was very handy. The room was spacious enough for a family of 4. And the cleaning staff was always top notch.   The location to the parks is excellent. We stayed in the back of the property. From stepping outside our room, to scanning our ticket at California Adventure, I timed it being an 8 minute walk.  The breakfast room is much to be desired. VERY small room for a large property. Get there early if you don't want to wait forever in line. The offerings were the same every
Manager Response: none

Summary: First of all our family comes to Disneyland at least once a year. We never stay at a Disney hotel because I cannot justify spending that much on a bed. That being said this is FAR from the worst hotel near the resort we have stayed at. On the other hand not at the top either. Pluses: super close to resort, free buffet breakfast, clean, friendly staff. Negatives: we somehow ended up with two full beds. Bit tight for two adults, free wi-for is great, if it worked, parking is a nightmare if you have a car there is free valet for guests but i would rather park myself. Overall I know the rating scale here is out of five. A more accurate would be a six out of 10. I would recommend courtyard Marriott or Howard Johnson first.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a newly renovated Ramada. It's very basic, gets the job done. Our room was in the back building away from the street so it was very quiet. We were also right in front of the elevator but we didn't hear a peep. We do travel with white noise....so keep that in mind.   Our room was clean with the exception of old carpet which is pretty much standard for hotels in this range. I recommend wearing sandals or socks if you're a germaphobe like me. There was a weird "dripping" sound in the bathroom that I noticed after turning off all the lights and TV for bedtime. Again, we use white noise (and earplugs) so it wasn't a problem. It would have been if I didn't have that stuff though.   Beds and pillows were clean and comfortable.  The fridge and microwave were clean and in good
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked two rooms at this hotel for a race weekend. I made the reservations months ahead of time, and kind of forgot about it. After taking a cross country flight to meet up with friends, we hopped in a shuttle and I turned my phone back on. Imagine my shock to receive a message from the hotel that they were trying to charge through the rooms and my card wasn't going through, and that if I didn't respond by 11 am my reservations would be cancelled! My credit card had been changed due to an issue beyond my control. Did I mention it was now 1 o'clock?? I called the hotel and they were unapologetic, though they had not yet cancelled my rooms. I explained I was in the shuttle on my way, and they young lady (who was very rude) asks me how long it will be before I get there! I travel
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this location due to it's location for a visit to Disneyland with our grandsons.   I was fearful due to a number of negative reviews but decided to book anyways and see for myself because of the locale and the great rate they offered.  We arrived on Sunday afternoon shortly after check in time and were promptly checked in to our room in the tower.  Our room was in the front of the hotel on the second floor.   We had an opportunity for the boys to enjoy the pool and they did.  The water was a bit colder than expected but the kids did not mind, it did not affect their use of the pool.  There were plenty of chaise lounges and clean towels.  I especially liked that the pool has a large area for smaller children (only 1 1/2 ft deep)  I had read to stay away from the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect location, shame they can't cater for early arrivals
Summary: We stayed at the Grand Legacy on the Park in October 2016, for 2 nights.  We arrived at the hotel in the morning, after a 14 hour flight from Australia.  I had advised on my booking that we would be arriving early, and had requested whether it would be possible to get an earlier check in but did not get a reply. When we arrived, the front desk advised that there were no rooms ready yet, but that they could store our bags.  We did this, and told them we would head across to Disneyland for a few hours, and mistakenly thought that they would prioritise getting our room ready, for when we returned (since we‚Äôd already arrived).  We returned a number of hours later, and our room was still not ready and we were then told that we couldn‚Äôt check in or get our room until the specified
Manager Response: Hello KiwiGirl2007,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire staff here at Grand Legacy At The Park we would like to apologize for the issues you encountered at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: so close to disneyland, but rooms and staff need a little work
Summary: I'll begin with the phone call I made to the Hotel before we arrived I called them at 7am PST to ask about parking and got a young man that I can only picture as either bill or ted he didn't seem to want to answer my call and wasn't actually helpful either.   Upon check in the young girl that checked us in asked if we were going to disneyland and tried to sell us tickets which was fine, we were attending the halloween party that night she asked if we had been before and we said no, but we had been to the halloween party at disney world in florida, she replied "oh this one is terrible compared to that' which isn't exactly what you want to hear after a 13 hour flight and ¬£1500 paid to get there, she probably thought she was being honest but came across as rude. we avoided all the
Manager Response: Hello Designedfordisney,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities, our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This was a great hotel to stay at. It was close to Disneyland that you can walk there and all type of food places around. Hotel service was great I would stay at this hotel again. It was affordable and they have big rooms.
Manager Response: Hello Deshon T,  Thank you very much for your comments. We are very happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. It is a pleasure to serve our wonderful guests and we are happy to have had you. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We came to Anaheim for a convention and to go to Disneyland. The convention center is almost a mile away and Disneyland is about a half a mile. There are several places to eat right around the hotel as well. The room was clean and quite comfortable. The only thing that I did not like was that we were only able to book a room with two double size beds. My husband and I are used to a king size bed so it was just a little cramped and we ended up sleeping in separate beds while we were there for a little more comfort and room haha. Either way if we are back in the area to go to Disneyland we will definitely be staying at this hotel again.
Manager Response: Hello Brittany S,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and we hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stayed two nights! Great short walk to Disney. Pool was a great break from the Disney crowds.  I don't agree that guests should have to pay for parking. Breakfast looked great if you like eggs, eggs w/ham and biscuits w/gravy. They had the other basics toast, bagels, donuts, fruit, cereal and juice, milk and coffee.  Watching the fireworks from the hotel room was pretty cool too.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I like staying at this hotel for the location. I stayed here when it was a Ramada and  it was ok. This was my first stay as it being the new Grand Legacy and I guess I was expecting more? The lobby and exterior is more pretty since the upgrade and they have added more shops and restaurants. But I have to say I was a little disappointed when  I checked in because I got a passholder rate online for the classic two double beds and it said I could get a free upgrade upon checking in if available? Well, I don't know if it was available because I wasn't upgraded but second of all, the lady asked me if I needed to by park tickets? Umm, I'm a passholder that's why I got the fare I did? So I thought that wasn't very good customer service. The room looked like it had been remodeled a
Manager Response: Hello candi374,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My friend and I visit Disneyland several times a year and this is always our "go to" hotel.  The rooms are always clean, hotel staff is awesome and the location (across the street from the Disneyland entrance) is just the icing on the very delicious cake.  They have a very good complimentary breakfast that is not just muffins and juice.  The rooftop 5th Element is "family friendly" until 10 PM and is a great place to have appetizers or drinks and watch the Disney firework show.  On week-ends they have live entertainment.  The only issue I have had in the past was that their internet connection wasn't the greatest but on our last stay last month that issue seems to have been resolved. Parking can also be an issue at times, but they offer free valet service (although the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location to the Disney Parks was fabulous - one of the closest Hotels to Disneyland. Easy walking arcoss the road. There are plenty of restaurants very close by - Dennys, iHop, Subway (all 24 hour), and a few small convenience stores nearby. The pool and hot tub were great after a busy day. The check in staff were very friendly on arrival, which is unfortunately uncommon nowadays. Our room was a great size, and had everything we needed.  On the less positive, the breakfast room is far too small for the number of customers - our young children were forced to eat outside at an adult sized tall table, as there were no seats at tables inside. This is not acceptable, and was not mentioned in the advertisement when we booked. The wifi did not work at all in our room - at the back
Manager Response: Hello Janie K,  On behalf of our entire staff, we apologize for the concerns you had about your experience at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I've been staying at this hotel for the past 3 years, since it was ramada. It's clean & close to the park. I would recommend anyone to stay here! Also if you have a season pass you save $$. The lounge on the top is pretty cool too, we watched the fireworks & they even had the music that went with it! pretty cool!!
Manager Response: Hello taylorw280,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work very hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to see you again soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Love love love Staying at this hotel.
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel every year for the past 7 years for our annual Disneyland vacation. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The employees are very friendly and helpful. The pool is a great afternoon break. My only 2 suggestions would be. Bigger coffee cups in the breakfast room. And the pool to be opened a little later it would be nice to relax in the Hot tub after a great day at the park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room we stayed in was a premier room and was very nice other than the carpet has some stains on it the only thing we didn't like about the hotel was the breakfast the food was okay but the room was way too small for how large the hotel is and was always packed in the morning no matter what time it was
Manager Response: Hello Verhalas,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize about the stains on the carpet and for our small breakfast room. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Short walking distance to Disney Parks
Summary: Very helpful staff nothing to much bother . Room & amenities very clean & tidy , very good pool & spa . Very adequate buffet breakfast included in the rate . Excellent location with a short walk to Disney parks . Very convenient booking agency plus other handy shops on Sth Harbour Bvd front of complex . Smart rooftop bar called The Fifth excellent for watching Disney Fireworks . Would defiantly stay at Grand Legacy At The Park on our next visit .
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm giving 5 stars because for the price, this is an outstanding deal. That's especially true if you have an annual pass and get the discounted price. Even when you factor in the charge for parking, once you count the free breakfast you're going to beat the price at most nearby hotels by at least a few dollars.   I try to keep our budget to under $100/night if at all possible, and it usually is possible here.  The rooms are very comfortable and clean. It's absolutely great to have the frig and microwave. I really like being able to bring my own food.   Other nice details: The staff is very courteous and helpful. They always let me check in early if they have a room.  The breakfast is not particularly awesome, but it's free so no complaints. Coffee, donuts, toast, eggs, cereal
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is very near Disneyland, it is remodeled if you are lucky to get the new building it will be better..  Our last room was the worst one ever #279  bathroom looked older, coffee maker was in a high shelf unable to plug it into anything, I had to try and place it on a chair, NO place near bed to charge phones. And I could hear strange noises..   Sad to say this USED to be my favorite GO- TO Disneyland  ( motel/hotel ), before it became the Grand Legacy. . . What changed? First off the staff I encountered at front desk was not nice at all. Second of all, their parking rates! Before parking was free, then it was 5 dollars and we could leave the car the next day... now it is 12 plus tax and to leave at what they call "day parking " it is 15 plus tax for 17.95...  I was shocked
Manager Response: Hello Nitzky,  Thank you for your review with tripadvisor. I apologize for any inconveniences you experienced while staying with us and for the noises you heard. We have many guests and do our best to prevent any disturbances. Thank you for staying with us. Improvement is a continual process, and we are always working at it. We hope that you will allow us to accommodate you again in the future as we continue to make changes for the better.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Only good thing is the location!
Summary: I have stayed at many Local Anaheim hotels. This was the most unpleasant place I've ever stayed! When I booked my reservation I called the front desk to inquire about when the room I reserved was renovated, she told me 3 years ago and the rooms are in very good condition. With the information provided to me, I felt comfortable not upgrading the room.   First off, the location is excellent very close to Disneyland entrance, this is the only positive about this hotel.  Parking is very limited. When I pulled in to parking lot I noticed police officers had responded to the hotel, which I felt a bit nervous about. We stayed in the older part of the hotel, the carpet was filthy we wore flip flops in the room. My wife found ants in the bathroom on the counter and she was not too happy
Manager Response: Hello javablack,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Do not stay here unless you're ok with thumping bass until 11pm EVERY night. We moved rooms after the first night but could feel the vibration of the music two floors below the 5th floor outdoor "lounge" our third night. Hands down the worst hotel experience we've had in years. It's a shame since the hotel is very close to Disneyland and generally in good condition. We have a small child and it was painful sitting in our room trying to relax while the furniture vibrated from the music. The staff discounted the room the first night but shrugged their shoulders the final night  and said "it only goes until 11pm". Shameful and guests should be warned in advance.
Manager Response: Hello Cara T,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience with our hotel. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidence by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed for four nights and had a great time. We had a premier room which had double sinks in the bathroom. This was great as there were four of getting dressed. The room was comfortable. The breakfast was fine - I know people have complained that the room is small and crowded but we never had that problem. The breakfast had cereals, breads, fruit and a couple of hot selections. This is a free breakfast so I have a hard time with people complaining about it. My granddaughter loved the pool and I enjoyed soaking my tired feet in the hot tub! We also went up to The Fifth a couple of times. We watched the Disney fireworks from there which was fun. The food and atmosphere were a great find - I would highly recommend an evening up there!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel & EASY access to the Disney Parks!
Summary: Cute pool for kids, nice rooms, clean bathrooms & the best part: less than a 5 minute walk to Disneyland! Staying here made our trip very easy and even more enjoyable. Highly recommend this hotel for any Disneyland/CA Adventure goers.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Poor service, lack of basic amenities
Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel, and the first since their renovation was completed. I was very surprised to find that the newly redone rooms do not include a safe of any kind, especially since it is motel style with no security between rooms and public (as well as warnings about protecting your car from theft). For a location that surely attracts international travellers this felt like a major oversight.   We could have possibly overlooked this mistake if it weren't for the all-around poor service we experienced from multiple staff. The guest experience is not a priority for them and several staff (front desk, night manager) were unprofessional and even rude. We will not be returning for a third visit and will no longer be recommending this property to friends and
Manager Response: Hello spicyradish,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This was the first time staying at a hotel and there was NO hot water for a morning shower. Not on 1 day but 2 of the days.  We arrived on Monday and checked out on Friday.  Tuesday the shower started luke warm and then turned cold, and on Thursday it was just plain cold.  After waiting for over an hour than there was hot water.  The parking sucks now in the evening you car can become blocked in by the valet.  They do offer breakfast in the morning and iI had high hopes but after 2 days of cold and dry scrambled eggs we went someplace else to eat.  When it came time to check out, it seemed all she wanted to do was get me out as quick as possible the lobby was empty. She did not even ask how my stay was. When I started staying here 4 years ago I was happy with this hotel not
Manager Response: Hello Chris C,  I appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you and your family encountered. Every day, our goal is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were unable to do so. We strive to continually improve and hope an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The majority of the rooms in this hotel are exterior entrance room in a group of older buildings.  We had friends who stayed in a room in one of these buildings and the room was OK.  At the strong urging of the hotel employee who handled our reservation, we booked a room on the fourth floor of the new building.  My sister in law had a room on the third floor of this building.  These rooms were clean and well furnished.  The low rating is due to the NIGHTCLUB on the fifth floor of the building.  On the night of our stay, the club closed around 12:30am and clean up was not completed until 1:30.  The noise level on the third and fourth floors was beyond unacceptable.  We made numerous calls to the front desk and were told that noise complaints were common, and that the owners of
Manager Response: Hello Anthony L,  Please accept my apologies if you experienced anything less than exceptional. Your comments have been forwarded to our restaurant management team for review. I appreciate your comments, your patronage is valued here at Grand Legacy At The Park and I would like the opportunity to make your experience a memorable one.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The biggest draw for this hotel is how close it is to Disneyland/DCA, a 10 minute walk from our room to the park security checkpoint (including a traffic light)! This is closer than most of the Disney hotels! The hotel itself is very good. Our room was large, very clean, and quiet, and the wifi was free. The Fifth is fantastic, good food, nice beer selection, and amazing view of the Disney fireworks. If for some reason you want to take a break from The Fifth, there are plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. We flew in so did not have to park, but I could see that the lot was always full and a bit tight. The included breakfast was fine, but the space is always crowded so finding a table can be difficult. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed 5 nighst end of Sept. Got in from Canada, would have been nice to get a friendly hello. Location... excellent! 5 mins walk to main gate Disneyland, with a 4 year old... can't beat that. Rooms were clean and quiet. Air conditioning kept husband awake. The breakfast was ok. Get there early as the line up can run past the lobby area. The pool was full of dead (and alive) bees. Didn't bother me, but the kids were a little freaked out. It's also located in the middle of the parking lot. We were under the impression this was a hotel.. not a motel. So, be aware! So, all of that, being reminded of the price, was fine. Expected. The only real issue I had was the staff. They were unfriendly, to the point of being rude. One night I wanted to take advantage of the awesome rooftop
Manager Response: Hello greghah,  We appreciate you taking your time to address your concerns. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you encountered with our team members. We realize the mere apologies won‚Äôt correct our mistakes in handling your visit. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, love the Fifth but hotel service is a let down
Summary: We recently stayed here for 4 days and had previously stayed in 2013 when it was Ramada Maingate. Love the renovations. The reception area looks lovely and love the new shops out the front. As we had previously stayed here we were really looking forward to it. The proximity to Disneyland is fantastic. We also really loved the new rooftop bar The Fifth. The drinks were well priced, the food yum and generous portions, staff friendly, lovely atmosphere and beautiful view over Disneyland. Now for the bad, I feel the hotel is lacking a personal service. The reception staff didn't seem happy and weren't the most welcoming, although there was 1 girl who actually seemed nice and friendly. We had been on a long flight from Australia and arrived at the hotel at 10am. We knew it was early
Manager Response: Hello Crittee,  We appreciate the feedback and apologize for your experience. We will use your review to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We normally book at another hotel but this time not able to. Pleasantly surprised to find that this hotel was equally as nice and comfortable and within walking distance to Disneyland. We would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Good: Room was clean and staff was friendly and helpful. Very near Disneyland entrance and plenty of restaurants within close proximity when walking. Fridge in room. Easy access to and from freeway.  Not so good: Parking is tight for anything other than a smaller car. Parking fees are additional. Bed was not conducive to a good nights sleep if you already have back issues. Slept on the puffy pillows so that helped. Hair dryer defective.
Manager Response: Hello Jetk9,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that your room was clean and our staff was friendly and helpful. I do apologize that the parking was tight and parking fees are additional. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Probably best option for off property hotel
Summary: Don't read negative reviews for the last 24 months, as their construction has recently finished. They did their best during this time. We've stayed here for years and welcome the changes. Excellent location for walking to Dland. Nicely appointed clean rooms, helpful staff. Generally a middle class family place.   Things to consider: Change in breakfast room from pool house to second story "cafeteria". Gets WAY over crowded by 7AM so get there early. It is no longer easy to bring food back to the room for kids, etc. So they all go there to eat - nothing like a parent letting their 3 year old get their own breakfast while you wait..... Better food offerings though so it's a trade off. Get there at 6:30AM when it opens and you'll be fine.  Parking is still terrible, but all the
Manager Response: Hello dangerdave,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. We hope to see you when you come back again to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Disneyland hotel at the main gate
Summary: Great location, just 100 metres from the main Disneyland gate on South Harbour blvd. 24 hour Denny's and Tony Romas next door. Good parking and easy access. large swimming pool. Breakfast can be very crowded. definitely stay again for Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel walking distance to the parks
Summary: Lovely hotel very close to the Disney parks 5 min walk, lots of restaurants nearby and shops, buy you water sodas before t You enter the parks much cheaper if you are on a budget.  The hotel is very clean with lots of amenities, you get a buffet breakfast every morning the breakfast area is a little small for the amount of guests, however there is a good variety of food available.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms were decently cleaned and the location was great but the wifi would not work for more than 2m at a time, the breakfast was disgusting, there was a sewage leak and our room smelled awful but Juan from maintenance was lovely and made our visit 100x better. The best part of our stay was the free water bottles in the lobby.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Across the street from Disneyland.  Great hotel.
Summary: Great hotel.  Nice employees.  Great services. Great rooms. Fair breakfastes.  We updated to the new section of the hotel.  The bar and snacks at the 7th Floor Rooftop was very nice. Would recommend as well as stay there again..
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this hotel for a family trip (5 people) to Disneyland.  We requested a roll away bed when we booked.  We checked in around 1 and were told check in wasn't until 3 and to come back then.  When we returned we were given a ground floor room that was definitely way too small for a roll away. I went back to the front desk, the line was very long but waited again and let them know it would not fit, they assured me it would (no way this was not a fire hazard).  The front desk suggested we upgrade to the tower -we had to pay another $70 for the 2 nights we stayed.  The room was bigger and fit a roll away okay.  Although our room was located right next door to the ice machine and breakfast room it was relatively quite.  The free breakfast was terrible! We didn't even eat it the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in a Classic room, with two double beds. The rooms were neat and clean, nothing out of the ordinary. The bathroom is small, but clean.   Our room was lower level along the parking lot. There are rooms inside the main hotel with the lobby, but the majority (two floors that wrap around the main hotel) all face the parking area.  The pool is nice, with a jacuzzi. The kids spent a number of hours here, a nice respite from the heat.   There is a decent complimentary breakfast in the main hotel from 6:30-9:30, with eggs, biscuits and gravy, bagels, toast, waffles, etc. Also cereals and a variety of juices/milk/coffee/tea.  Our first night we went to the rooftop lounge to have a light dinner and watch the fireworks, which I will review separately.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The location was a short walk to the Disney gate. Parking staff friendly, front desk all business. Our room wasn't ready so we requested to be moved to the fourth floor instead of the first. since we had to wait anyway and wanted less noise. We went to Disney and came back late to find the room was less than 3 feet from the elevator, sigh... Be sure you don't get that room unless you want it.The room was average, a bit dark and dreary, but clean enough> we had no wash clothes or hand towels in the room. It was late so we made due until the morning. The breakfast was good scrambles egg choices, fruit, waffles, donuts and such.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for six days and even though we did change rooms a couple times as kids had issue with first couple rooms the staff were great at accommodating us. The breakfast wasn't the best and seating was not adequate. We ended up eating breakfast someplace else. Short walk to Disneyland. Pool was nice. Probably won't stay again as we prefer Best Western but was a ok stay over all.
Manager Response: Hello Michelle T,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize that you didn't find our breakfast room adequate for your family. Thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First off let me apologize for no picsüôÑ  My wife and I drove up from San Diego and wanted to be able to walk to the parks. This hotel fit the bill. With no reservation we able to secure and nice 2 twin beds and parking for 120$, the room was accessible for my wife with a shower stool and she could drive her scooter right into the bathroom. To all hotels... Get rid of bathtubs!!!!! Showers are the way to go !!!  Hotel offers a free breakfast in the main building on the second floor , but was way to busy for us to manage a scooter at 830a. Overall this hotel was a great value and easy walk to parks was GREAT 5mins. We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Within Walking Distance to Disneyland - That May Be The Only Noteable Advantage
Summary: Walking to Disneyland from our hotel room took less than 7 minutes. It was the first time we stayed close enough to walk and that worked out well.  As far as the hotel itself goes...    The Bad: The bed was one of the worst I've ever slept on. Very uncomfortable. The curtains could not be drawn closed enough to keep light out. One of the chairs was missing it's bottom making it useless. Lights were not very bright.  The room seemed dark even with the lights on. Decor was somewhat dated.  The Good: The rooftop lounge (The Fifth) was nice, though the music was a tad loud at times.  The food served at The Fifth was very good. Right on par with expectations. Hotel and Parking Staff were very friendly.  No issue there.
Manager Response: Hello Such_A_Ham,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and these mishaps have been addressed. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The location is perfect. Rooms are clean and nice. Staff is helpful and very friendly. The rooftop deck is fabulous! Check-in is a breeze. We loved to stay here. The breakfast is good and the swimming area is fun for the kids.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Second time at the Grand Legacy.. customer service superb...
Summary: My room was very clean... comfortable bed...The location is across from Disney. For the price of the room you couldn't ask for anything better.. Amenities were great.. My grand kids loved the pool. They provided warm towels at the pool site in the evening.. Nice. The breakfast for my family was quite nice.. We enjoyed what was served... This was our 2nd time their. We will return again.. :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: nice clean hotel.very close to disneyland about 8 to 10 minute walk to disneyland front gate.front desk staff not very friendly but the other hotel staff was all the maids said good morning and to have fun in the parks. the breakfast room was very small and my being in a wheelchair it was very hard to move him around in there. there was one staff member working the breakfast room[ named celia] she was so helpful for three days straight she made sure we had a table.[ thank you so much again celia] rooms were very clean and beds were comfy.the fifth rooftop lounge was cool  with a great veiw of the parks and fireworks.our waiter there wasent very friendly and the cocktails were kind of pricy. if you want a hotel close to disneyland with free breakfast and nice pool give this one a
Manager Response: Hello Steve T,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience with our front desk agent and our waiter. Your feedback is really appreciated so as to ensure that this type of incident does not take place again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great value family hotel for Disney
Summary: If your looking for a perfectly located affordable hotel for Disney and California Land this is it. The rooms are basic , clean,, quiet and perfect for our family of four ( kiss 6&8). It's a very easy walk to Disney as you are almost outside the gate. The staff are friendly and helpful. There's a laundry to use. Breakfast is bedlam and limited but fine for filling tummies on basic fair. Given you are hardly there this is a perfect location for a visit to Disney. Plenty of dinner options in walking distance and if you are a pizza fan head to your right as you leave the hotel to pizza press (?) fantastic pizzas!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We still love this place. The renovations are great.  Rooms clean and nice. Easy walk to parks.  This is our go to hotel. Just do not take room 182.  It is next to the laundry and it gets busy and noisy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The only good thing about this hotel is the convenience to theme parks. Dont be fooled by the pictures its not as good as it looks. Some of the rooms have been renovated but some have not. We were in a room that def had not and for the price I would have expected much more. The bed was uncomfortable and the so called pillows laughable. The were more like lumpy square cushions that seemed like they were thrown in there just to have somethibg. They were not real pillows. The carpet was dirty room tiny. There was no safe or wardrobe just a pole to hang clothes. The basin was outside of the bathroom. The curtains were drab and the room smelt dusty. The room was also next door to a vending machine and ice machine. It was noisy and in sure the cleaners used in mornings as we were
Manager Response: Hello Edwina O,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the concerns you had about your experience at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I'm always looking for good deals around the park. This hotel has recently been remodeled and is a quick walk to DL. The reviews were terrible, so it made me worry. I read there was no parking, loud parties w/ paper thin walls & lumpy beds. I pre-paid (non refundable) so I just wished for the best, but expected the worst. Check-in was just ok. I was told that AP holders were allowed an early check-in & upgrade. This is true I was told BUT not with prepaid rooms. Le sigh..... I must sit here for an hour and wait. I took a walk around the property instead. I was delighted to see plenty of open parking spaces! The mini-mart had the usual snacks and gifts and a Jimboys Tacos is being built. LOVE their tacos. It was 2:55 so I headed back to the lobby. Only to be told I couldn't get
Manager Response: Hello MeganLAM,  Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I was Impressed with the cleanliness of this hotel, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The price wasn't bad, especially when compared to all the other hotels in the immediate area. A very short walk to Disney, and the free breakfast was better than expected. I will definitely bring my family here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: You cannot beat the location of this hotel. You can walk right across to Disney and don't have to deal with parking, shuttles or any of that chaos. The pool is lovely and has some fun splash toys for the kids, and also a hot tub for the adults. We enjoyed the roof top bar and the views it offered. The rooms were recently updated and were very clean so we appreciated that. The walls in the room were a bit thin and the doors do open directly to the outside, which is never my preference but wouldn't stop me from staying there. We will definitely be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Must stay location when visiting Disneyland.
Summary: Great location to stay, really closer to the park.  Awesome and very confortable rooms. Love the Breakfast Snacks ‚Äì Esp. they free with the hotel stay. Very cool pool area, kid friendly with kids zone. Must stay location when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed Monday to Thursday - great location right opposite Disneyland car park. Was able to park in hotel grounds no problem  $12 a day. Room had what was needed,  was clean , bed needs replacing as was a bit old , squeaky and lumpy but slept fine.  Was quite dark inside but didn't spend much time in it during day anyway. Air con was really noisy so turned it off at night . WiFi dropped off frequently, swimming pool was great, breakfast was the normal fare and we got seats each day without problem.  The Fifth rooftop bar is lovely with fantastic views and they play the Disneyland music for the fireworks show which was a bonus.  Aside from a checking in mistake which was sorted ( we had inadvertently booked the wrong date at 11 pm night before  and been charged as no shows) check
Manager Response: Hello Mechelle M,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize about the squeaky and lumpy bed and noisy a/c. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed one night during the Disneyland Half Marathon weekend.  The room is a standard motel style room with the basics.  It was clean but very simple and pretty small. Our room was very quiet.   The $200+ a night charge is overpriced except for the convenience of location.  It is a very short walk across the street to get into Disneyland and Downtown Disney.  This worked perfectly for my wife and sister-in-law competing in the half marathon.  We were also able to park at the hotel and check in to the room early before heading into the park.
Manager Response: Hello Jeff P,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We originally were booked for one nite and then decided to check if a room was available (cheap) for a second nite. Well the original passholder rate dropped to $69 and the second nite $96, so I booked. The person I spoke to on the phone about the second nite told me about the rate drop voluntarily as it was not on the website. So on to the review. 1. Checked in early, stored the bags and headed up to the breakfast room. I'll review the breakfast at the end. 2. I always request a room around 177 so we don't have to walk far after trudging along all day / evening at Disneyland. The room is 2 double beds and big enough for 2 adults or 2 adults and 2 small kids. The pool is steps away, and the breakfast room is a short walk. The ice machine is on the second floor and Tony Roma's is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice new rooms, but extremely noisy
Summary: We stayed in a new three room suite with our son's family, there were four adults and two small children. The room configuration was great, we could stay together, but have privacy when desired.  The new tower was built on the street in front of the older rooms and they have a beautiful roof top nightclub deck on the fifth floor.  Between the noise from the street and the noise from the music coming from above, sleep was nearly impossible until late at night.  We could hear the deck chairs (heavy metal chairs on cement) scrape every time some one moved and our room was on the 3rd floor.  I can't imagine what it must have sounded like on the 4th floor.  Breakfast was not very good and the room, which is also new, was built way too small for the size of the property.  The rates we
Manager Response: Hello Donna C,  Thank you for your response. We are happy to have had you and are grateful that you took the time to provide us with feedback. I do apologize about the noises you encountered from our rooftop bar/lounge. The fees you mention from our hotel should only be the daily room rate, tax which is 15% and tourism improvement district assessment fee is 2% (city fee) and our daily parking fee (only if you have a vehicle) is $12.00. We sure hope that you will allow us to serve you again in the near future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Our Favorite When going to Disneyland.
Summary: We have been staying at this Hotel for aa long time, since when it was the Ramada. The pool is perfect for our young kids and its location is perfect. You have Dennys and Ihop next to the hotel and its an easy walk to Disneyland. My check in was perfect with front desk (Isai) he gave me great customer service, I was very pleased.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was ready early, the beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were very clean.  The staff was very helpful and I would definitely stay there again. We were on the bottom floor and we did not hear any noise from the room above or outside.  It was very quiet.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was clean and the staff was very nice. Always polite and smiling. The close proximity to Disneyland is great! Having to pay for parking on top of the room rate was a little disheartening, but I suppose that has become the norm when you are that close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Ideal hotel for families visiting Disneyland. We spent 6 nights here the, pool and spa were great after a day out. Rooms were comfortable but small. There where many places around to get food. The complimentary breakfast wasn't bad as a quick snack at the beginning of the day. Overall a good experience
Manager Response: Hello Taylor M,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your overall stay was great and hope to see you when you come back again to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: First this an ok hotel  There trying to be posh for a upgrade to the property  Check in was good and the same for check out  Stay here if you get a rate of $95.00 or less  $12.00 to park your car which is there way not to call it a resort fee  They have some kind of valet service which is unnecessary Its free they say but only good for Tony Romas or the The 5TH place on the roof  There valet takes up guest parking on the lower level near the front of the property  Just tell valet to move their traffic comes so you can park near your room  Close to DL and DCA walking  Decent clean room and bath - but shower head is dated   Very nice pool area  shops and eateries near by
Manager Response: Hello Steve D,  We appreciate you taking your time to address your concerns. We are committed and determined on improving our hotel and your feedback assists us in achieving that goal. We hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at the Grand Legacy on multiple occasions and always had a good experience.  The rooms are clean, service is great, and if you can catch one of the hotels discounts, the hotel makes for a great deal when visiting Disneyland. We did not eat the breakfast, but found it expanded from previous visits to include hot breakfast items. We walked around the 5th which has a awesome view of Harbour and Disneyland with comfortable outdoor seating.
Manager Response: Hello Utahman0,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Hotel facilities were okay, staff was nice, check in was quick. However, upon arriving to our room I was disappointed. Microwave was not clean and room had not been vacuumed. I notified hotel staff who offered another room which I refused (our stuff was already in the room and kids were exhausted), housekeeping was sent instead to clean the room. Rooms are outdated,  breakfast area extremely small, breakfast options are okay, parking very limited. Loved proximity to Disneyland, 5 minutes at the most!! If your in a budget I recommend this hotel otherwise I would skip it.
Manager Response: Hello Jolene4,  Thank you for your comments. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and this mishap has been addressed. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the hotel one night after a full day at the Disney parks.   First of all when we arrived there was ample parking and we were lucky enough to be checked in at 8am into one of their new deluxe rooms. These are very modern and everything about the room was great.   The best part is undoubtedly the rooftop. What a view for the fireworks - they even play the Disney music in sync with the park so it's as if you are there without all the crowds and the strained neck, whilst enjoying a nice beverage or too!   It is less than 5 minutes from the parks.   All in all I would throughly recommend to anyone and would definitely stay again.   Many thanks Grand Legacy.   Mr and Mrs Quinn
Manager Response: none

Summary: It is hard to find the words to describe this place. Terms such as awful, incompetent, and mediocre come to mind. What it all comes down to is that it is right across the street from one of the world's most popular  tourist draws. They can thus continue to be sub-par and still pack them in because it is an easy five minute walk to the entrance to Disney.  Keep in mind the following, however: the rooms are dark and not cleaned as well as they could be (I noticed dust on the side table). Also, I hate the hotel room layouts in which the sink and counter are in the main room and not behind a door with the toilet and shower. There is a lack of outlets, as well, making it hard to charge devices.   There is also no fitness center in the hotel, which surprised me in someplace so large.
Manager Response: Hello AlexanderD,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: this hotel is right across the street from Disneyland, the prices are fantastic, they have a beautiful pool, hot breakfast and the best part-the FIFTH on the roof - fantastic small bites, wonderful drinks and you can see the fireworks with piped in music.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have been to the Grand Legacy now two times and have another reservation coming up in a few months. This last visit we were able to cash in our Free night stay in the new rooms in the new tower. The elevator is a little slow especially in the evenings. The hallways were nice and cool with a/c and very well decorated. The room was great, very stylish. My fave were the chairs. SO pretty and purple. Beds are super comfy and pillows were fluffy. Bathroom was so nice I loved the new tile diamond they put on the wall of the shower and there is now a tray inside the shower for your bath toiletries. The room had a Kuerig type coffee maker which was awesome and easy to use. Also the new foot stools were awesome. Our girls used them to sit on while we brushed their hair before heading
Manager Response: Hello Catalina O,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to see you when you come back in November.    Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This hotel is located across the street from Disneyland entrance.  We had a premier room and with a roll out bed. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were updated and had a double sink, fridge and microwave. The pool was a nice for a mid day by break.  The walls are thin and we could hear Kenny G music playing for hours one night. The wifi rarely connected but did seem to work if you were near the lobby.  The hotel has no gym , no business center and only  edible items were the banana and toast for breakfast.  We purchased tickets at a store located in front of the hotel with a small discount.  We did not have any issues with parking even with a late arrival.  The front desk staff were friendly and answered our questions.  We would consider staying here again when visiting
Manager Response: Hello dejavu21,  On behalf of our entire staff, we apologize for the concerns you have about your experience at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We've stayed at the Grand Legacy (when it was Saga Inn then Ramada Maingate) many times over the last couple of decades and had a great time. However, this last time we were sorely disappointed. They have completely remodeled the office and front entrance and greatly increased their prices presumably to cover the costs. You have to pay extra to park your car at the motel or you can pay even more for valet parking. The problem is that if you are lucky enough to find a parkibg space, the valet double parks their cars in front of the other cars that are already parked in valid parking spaces. So if you want to drive somewhere you have to contact the valet personnel to have them move the vehicles that are blocking your car in, then you have to hope that there is a parking space
Manager Response: Hello G9428TXgeorged,  Thank you for your feedback. I do apologize for your most recent stay with us. I can assure you that we offer very competitive room rates and always have special promotions going on throughout the year. Please sign up to receive e-mail blasts which offer specials year round or visit our hotel website. We sure hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great time, close to the park
Summary: We stayed two nights with Grand Legacy. It was a great spot to sleep in between our busy days! Parking lot is smaller but valet parking was super easy. Really enjoyed our stay. Loved the rooftop bar!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our room was clean and large.  The pillows were lumpy but the bed was pretty good.  The linens and towels were clean and new.  In fact the towels were too new some days.  Management, please tell housekeeping to wash new towels before first use.  They smell funny, are not absorbent and the fluff comes off on your body.    The parking is overcrowded.  If there is no space, you have to leave your car with the valet and this is inconvenient.    The 'free' breakfast room was so crowded you couldn't get in let alone find an empty table.  As a result, we never got to take advantage of the 'complimentary' breakfast which didn't look appealing anyway.  As we all know, the 'free' breakfast is built into the price of the room.  I would like to be offered a choice of whether I want the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice, but you might need bug spray
Summary: Very nice hotel. Beds are super comfy. Great rooftop restaurant and bar. But I did wake up with bites on my leg from something biting me in the bed. Don't choose this location if there is any chance of canceling. I made the mistake of booking it before I realized how far it was from where all my plans were taking place. I needed something closer to Costa Mesa. Manager wouldn't refund my money because I made the reservation the day of, even though I called 30 minutes after booking.
Manager Response: none

Summary: 2 queen room. Very clean. No issues. Towels were very stiff but it's a hotel! Loved the fact the pool was incredibly nice as well. Right across from the park so a very short walk. We flew in so didn't have to deal with parking but the parking was super crowded at night. I highly suggest valet. There were cars parked behind cars so if you wanted to get out early then you were in trouble. Breakfast was so crowded that we decided to go into the park to eat instead. The line was wrapped around the room and no where to sit unless you took it back to your room. The staff was INCREDIBLY friendly! They checked our bags before and after so that we could enjoy the park longer.
Manager Response: none

Summary: All in all, we were happy with the Grand Legacy.  My only real complaint that will likely keep me from coming back is that the beds seemed to be pretty old as they were very firm.  I struggled to sleep well because of that and it took a week to overcome the pain in my lower back.  On the flip side, there were many positives:  -The place, while an older ‚Äúwalk up‚Äù motel, had a very new feel.  The exterior was well maintained and had a clean look.  The pool was very clean and a welcome break from the craziness of nearby Disney.  We have a 5 year old who wasn‚Äôt really ready for back to back days at Disney, so we spent much of one day just hanging out at the pool to get a break, and he was very entertained.  The parking lot felt clean and safe, although parking was tight depending on
Manager Response: Hello 61408Cabo,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travel brings you back to the area.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This was a great place to stay for a week. The rooms where clean and the staff was super nice. The only bummer was the parking was $12 a day and the A/C was loud in our room. Breakfast was incl. which was great just wish they would stop making that egg and hash casserole and maybe just eggs and hash separate . But over all everything was very good and I will come back again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Don't  leave and come back to think you will have a parking spot.  Valet parks cars behind your parked car.  You can not get out or get back in.  When the rooftop  lounge is having music or event they are  more cars them space for lot and  valet  they are stacked everywhere.  And needless to say you cant go up to the lounge to watch fireworks  no room, not kid friendly  Finding a new hotel to stay at.  2 nd bad experience no more for me
Manager Response: Hello Cheryl G,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and this mishap has been taken into consideration. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great apps and drinks on the rooftop bar
Summary: Had a wonderful experience last week, at their rooftop bar, The Fifth.  Josh, our server, took good care of us.  If he is working the night we go back, I am making a point of sitting in his section. We enjoyed delicious drinks and apps off their happy our menu and later ordered delicious filled donuts and coffee to finish off our night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went here with my husband and two friends. Stayed in a deluxe room. We had reserved two queens, but ended up with three queens. The extra space was nice. They let us check in a few hours early because our flight got in so early.   I only have two negatives. One: this is not a grand legacy issue, but a California issue in general. The water is a cloudy milky white and is thick. Coming from WA, we always have clean water and this was a shock. We called maintenance, thinking there was an issue with the plumbing. He came by and said he would be right back and never returned. We called room service about 45 minutes later and they told us this was "just the pipes." Okay well why didn't the maintenance guy just tell us that instead of saying he would be back?! But they did give us a
Manager Response: Hello Chelsie B,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we do apologize for the issues you experienced with our team members. The department manager has been notified and has addressed this review with our team members. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Love this hotel. It's the best one we've ever stayed at in Disneyland. They have a brand new facility with great rooms. We love the premium rooms and the deluxe rooms the best. They have great parking and a super huge swimming pool. They also have a good breakfast room. Will stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed in Room 332.  Quiet room.  Great place to watch fireworks after a long day at the park. Only negative.... the hot water never got hot.  Very convenient to Disney and a great variety of restaurants that were within walking distance.
Manager Response: Hello Lianne I,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize about the issues you experienced with the hot water. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I met some friends at "The Fifth ". It's their rooftop bar with California ambience and AMAZING VIEWS of Disneyland. The fireworks went off and it was incredible to watch from such a comfortable seat by the firepit with a great drink in hand surrounded by friends. It was an evening to remember!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The great reviews of this hotel from the great rooms, location, pool, breakfast room etc are all correct so I won't rehash these...! What an awesome updated family hotel located close to McDonald's, Disneyland and many other stores and restaurants  The staff are great with a few "curt" front desk staff which is hit and miss.   However!!! .... If you need or enjoy wifi you will be frustrated and upset.  Extremely weak signal in room is not even functional to log on...  Pool area is better but we can't sit there all hours. Multiple complaints are met with front desk indifference and a call to IT support which does nothing but lead to more frustrating problems as it is not the "apple" device that is the problem but clearly a very underpowered wifi system.  Our family ended up
Manager Response: Hello cobia_13,  Thank you for your tripadvisor response. We are happy to have had you and are grateful that you took the time to provide us with feedback. I do apologize for the issues you encountered with the wi-fi. I can assure you that this issue has been taken care of. We hope that you will allow us to serve you again in the near future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean and Close to the Parks
Summary: We recently stayed 7/24-7/29 in a newly renovated Deluxe Queen room. The room itself was clean and didn't have that funky smell that hotels can have sometimes. Housekeeping service did a nice job freshening up our rooms daily, the front desk staff and valet attendant was friendly during check in and check out. The only reason I didn't give an "excellent" rating was because there wasn't a bathroom in the pool area (had to walk back to room or get a key from the valet attendant to use the one outside the main entrance) and the breakfast really wasn't very good. The same thing was served every day and the egg casserole and biscuits and gravy were very strange and not tasty at all. I know they are preparing for a lot of guests daily but there are other options that could work and
Manager Response: Hello Shelley R,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The breakfast was horrible!!! #1-They serve the SAME thing E V E R Y day! The egg casserole was HORRIBLE!!!!!  And the biscuits with gravy were horrible. They have toaster waffles, which taste like cardboard. (The raisin bagels were good though, and they had fresh whole fruit). The eating area is too small and the outside eating area doesn't have any seats. People walk and stand ALOT at the Disney parks and the last thing we want is to have to stand to eat breakfast.  I have bad feet and need to save my feet for all the walking and standing in lines that we have to do at Disney. #2- there are not enough hooks or racks in the room to hang towels and wet bathing suits on. #3-the walls are very thin, #4- mildew on the shower head, #5-cloudy water.  The water out of the faucet is
Manager Response: Hello Sharon D,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: AVOID this dirty cheap motel by all means! And by cheap, I was referring to the quality of rooms and poor customer service, not the price! For the price you paid, you would expect to get unparalleled customer service and a decent hotel quality clean room (at least). But NO, they give you a room that looks nothing like the pictures they posted online; a dirty bathroom with stains all over the bathtub and sink, an extremely dirty toilet with disgusting stains inside (very graphic), and God knows what kind of stains they had in the beds!  I assure you, there is nothing ‚ÄúGrand‚Äù about his place. When we arrived, the receptionist had no idea how to properly check us in and refused to give us our rooms (which we PAID for!). Their manager turned out to be even more incompetent than the
Manager Response: Hello Loti W,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience.
