Summary Heading: Tricky ADA bathroom door handle in our two bedroom suite (new tower)
Summary: We splurged and went with a two room suite in the new tower (debated between basic room at Paradise Pier for 4 ppl or a suite at the Grand Legacy for 6 ppl - roughly the same price). The room still smelled new and was roomy enough for the five of us. The new suites are close to the street and therefore, the closest of all the rooms to Disneyland. The ice and soda machines were right outside our door, as was the stairwell which was carpeted, clean and inviting. The breakfast room was just down the hall as well, making it very convenient for those of us staying in the towers, but not so convenient for everyone else.  So about the ADA compliant two-room suite:  I had reserved a two-room suite but nowhere on my reservation did it say we'd be in an ADA two-room suite. The room was
Manager Response: Hello Kimbers W,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you enjoyed our brand new suite. I do apologize about the inconvenience you encountered with the door latch. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We recently stayed 7/29-7/31 in a Deluxe Queen room. The only I guess downside was my husband thought all rooms had been renovated like the pictures but other than that the room was very clean and we were very happy with our stay.  The front desk staff was very nice and the continental breakfast was great as well.  We have a 1 year old and 3 year old so the location was perfect the end of the day with two fussy kids.  I'm bummed we didn't get to try the roof top bar but I hope we get to next time.  Also didn't get a chance to use the pool but the area looked like a lot of fun.  My husband and I are AP holders so we visit Disneyland a lot.  Another plus for us was they have an AP discount!  We already booked our next stay and will be back at the end of this month!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel and the location is prime to be able to walk to Disneyland. The price was also excellent for it being so close to the park. I also loved that I got a discount with being a passport holder. The only downfall for this hotel is parking. Not enough spots for all the guest. I had a friend come pick me up for dinner so that I didn't lose my spot. But all in all would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There are many better hotel options around Disney. Steer clear of this one. Obviously the hours and hours of research of hotels around Disney did me no good whatsoever. Hotel check in staff was rude, charged my card the entire amount of the room, including parking fees and all deposits, before giving me the AAA discount, then telling me my 'discount' will be reimbursed in 5-7 days.... What a joke. $12 for parking a night?? oh, and good luck finding a parking spot, if not, valet will park your car in front of other cars.  We didn't move our vehicle the entire 5 days, was too afraid of not finding another parking spot. $8 deposit per night?? (for what, I'm still not sure) Maybe the $8 will take 5-7 days for reimbursement as well?? Haha. Breakfast was a huge disappointment. Food
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here at the beginning of this month with my parents for their first visit to Disneyland ever.  We were disappointed to find that the room was extremely small for 3 adults and a tween (we had one of the rooms with two double beds). The bathroom was also in desperate need of being updated. The tile floor was all cracked, the caulking was coming off everywhere, there was barely any water coming out of the faucet and the shower head was some weird plastic thing. Also, it costs $12/day just to park your car there!  The pros were that it's very close to the Disneyland entrance, there's a fridge and a microwave in the room and the continental breakfast was decent compared to others that I have had. The beds and pillows were decent and the room was nice and dark, so we slept
Manager Response: Hello Kristi H,  Thank you for taking the time to leave comments with your response. I am very sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with the room you reserved at our hotel. We do have several different type of rooms and suites available. Our hope is that as we continue to improve, an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Clean room but quite for a family of 4. Was told I'm the phone 2 months before the reservation we could request a room in the new area. When got there nothing available. Also sent us to the room & it wasn't ready. They made it right by giving us free parking for the week & adjusted our rate down by $35 a night.  Great location to the parks, restaraunts, groceries  & the freeway
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to the park and many other things.
Summary: This hotel has many great points.  It has a close rooftop view of the park, which provides excellent viewing of the fireworks at night.  The rooftop also has a restaurant that serves some fairly good tacos.  Mm...  The beef tacos were so delicious!Anyway, the rooms are modern and very clean.   The front desk staff were very helpful with information.  The valet was quick to get our car.  And, there is a CVS about a block away, that has normal prices on things you may have left behind.  That convenience really helped us out this time around.  There were only two negative points I can think of listing here.  We reserved a 2 bedroom suite and got a 2 bedroom accessible suite.  It was still big and roomy, but would have preferred a regular one.  Also, their breakfast, while
Manager Response: Hello ComeFlyWithMePeople,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize about the inconvenience of getting an accessible suite. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The hotel is open 24/7 very accommodating. Its right near the entrance to Disneyland.  There are places to eat nearby, they have a pool.  We could visit the park, take a break and go back to the hotel, rest, swim, and eat, then return to the park.  Very convenient for Disney visitors.  And the price was reasonable.  Breakfast was not the greatest and it was packed with people.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed July 20 to July 23. The good: close to Disney.  The bad: horrible breakfast. instead of having scrambled eggs, make your own waffles, they have stale cereal, stale Eggo waffles and they make some weird egg, hash brown and toast casserole that is dry and would be best if they separated the ingredients out. Parking: it costs you $12 per day on top of your hotel room!!! In the afternoon the valet start double parking cars behind the cars in front of the rooms so that if you need to get out and run to a restaurant or store, you have to hunt the valet down, get him or her to move the car parked behind you, then come back to having no parking spot in front of your room.  ALSO the floors in our room (168) looked like they had not been vacuumed in a very long time. AND!!! on t
Manager Response: Hello Somewhere-LivinItUp,  I am sorry to hear about the issues you encountered at our hotel. I can assure you that the department heads are aware of this review. As explained this afternoon, a thorough inspection was conducted. I am happy to report that no activity of Bed Bugs or any other Pest was found. I will be happy to discuss further.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: When we arrived we had no shower curtain.  Next day the garbage  was not collected from room. The carpeting  was so dirty my socks were black. Breakfast was a joke. No donuts one day (that was at 7:00am), what they called biscuits and  gravy was cold. The only plus to this hotel was location. Would not recommend  this hotel. Wifi was not good.
Manager Response: Hello Kim R,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn‚Äôt find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Our original dates for this Disney trip was June 12-18. We were meeting my family and friends, there were 18 of us. Disneyland was so crowded and the weather was getting hot so we extended our stay and left on the 21st. The Grand Legacy was great the staff are all very friendly and our room was nice had a great view of the fireworks. The pool was nice on those really hot days. If you want a nice clean place to stay across the street from Disneylannd this is the place. We also came back for Fourth of July weekend and had a blast watching the fireworks at the new roof top club the Fifth.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I visited the Grand Legacy for 3 days and 2 nights in late May. I had read mixed reviews about this establishment, so i was a little bit apprehensive at first, but the price and location were too good to pass up, so i went ahead and booked with them. Check in is at 3, but we were able to check in at 12:45, which was great because we wanted to be able to park at the hotel and walk over to the park for the first day of our visit. The check-in process was a breeze and the front desk staff was pleasant and helpful.  I was worried that parking would be hard to find, but at the time that we arrived there was plenty of parking and we got a spot that was perfectly visible from our room. The room was nice and clean, the air conditioner worked well and the hot and cold water
Manager Response: none

Summary: * Despite the fact that we got one of the arguably best suites in the hotel, the room was bothered by the noises upstairs - sounds like furniture are being moved ALL THE TIME from 4pm-10pm or so. * There was water leakage from drainage of the air conditioning at the ceiling right above the sink in one of the bathrooms. So as you are washing, your head will get drenched. We called service but they said it's by design and cannot be fixed. * The breakfast was one of the worst experiences - the line was so long; the room was small, food was not great nor selection. * Parking was really bad - you charge $12 each night but there's no space to park; valet reserved 3 empty slots, leaving the regular customers no room to park. * The only good thing was that we were able to view fireworks
Manager Response: Hello Yamin H,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the issues you experienced at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This is a older hotel which has been remodeled. Rooms are average but location is great and new lobby & a breakfast room. The best part is that it has the only rooftop bar in Anaheim. Lots of seating with fun live music. Food and drinks served by a friendly staff. Great view of Disneyland and DCA. So nice to see the fireworks from a nice table with a drink in hand! IG sharireneek for pics.
Manager Response: Hello 553sharik,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that you enjoyed The Fifth, Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge. We hope to see you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I have stayed in different hotels and I really love Grand Legacy at the Park.  The staff is friendly and the rooms are always clean.  The roof top bar is absolutely breath taking!  It is the best way to experience Disney fireworks and to enjoy great food and appetizers.  I would definitely recommend the casserole.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was a fairly late booking as we decided to spend just 1 day at Disney with teenage children. I had originally booked another highly rated hotel but a little distance from the park and following a suggestion on the forum cancelled and booked this hotel for the location. Big Mistake ! A review suggested having a room at the front of the hotel as refurbished which I put on my request. We arrived early and thought we would just check if we could book in early, not possible which we anticipated so parked the car and went for a wander, arrived around 30 mins before booking time to see a number of other clients also arriving but being given their keys, checked if our room was ready and informed No, asked if my request for a front room was possible, a discussion took place between
Manager Response: Hello eve605,  We are extremely sorry about your unsatisfactory experience. Your feedback is really appreciated to ensure that this type of incident does not take place again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Some of the older reviews made me a little concerned about construction but when we got there we had no problems. The front desk staff were very nice and even gave us recommendations about things to do while we were in Anaheim. We needed to take a shuttle to get to Universal Studios one day and the ticket store in front of the hotel was able to book one for us. We ate at their rooftop bar one night and it was the perfect place to watch the Disneyland fireworks! We will definitely be coming back soon.
Manager Response: Hello t0mt0m100,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for giving us an opportunity.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed there for 3 nights with my family and have not been there since it was the Ramada!  First and foremost, the staff was amazing.  We arrived at 2am after a long day of traveling (we should have been in at 9pm but the holiday traffic was bad) and we were checked in with Mia!  She was soooo accommodating and friendly.  She got us a roll-away and was very pleasant.  The rooms were nice and clean but the best thing is that the facility was very quiet.  The luxury rooms had two sinks which made getting ready to go to the park very easy.  Our housekeeper got us extra towels and coffee.  At check out the staff honored our senior AARP discount.  Thank you to Mia, Rachel, Daisy and Justin for being such great help.  We'll definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello R4531FJmikel,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and hope to see you again when your travel bring you back to the area.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Great rooms for a fair price. The pool was adequate in a nice fenced in and shady area. Decent complementary breakfast served at sane hours. This hotel was just down the street from Disney's Park, adding much needed convenience to our Disney experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you‚Äôre anything like me, I was a bit nervous about the name change ‚Ä¶ I had gotten so used to my Ramada Maingate at the Park aka our home-away-from-home when visiting Disneyland! Allow me to put your mind at ease: It‚Äôs the same cheerful staff, a location you still can‚Äôt beat, and I got a deal on the price too :)  And let me just say that the new lobby is breathtaking! The only bummer was that I had wanted to stay in one of their new suites, but when I called to book, they were sold out! We stayed in a premier room with pool view, and our stay was pretty drama-free! They have a new restaurant & bar on the rooftop, called The Fifth (easy to remember since it‚Äôs on the 5th floor). Haven‚Äôt seen anything like that in the area! The food was pretty tasty, and it is hands-down the best
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fabulous Location for Disneyland + Rooftop Views
Summary: The location is wonderful for families that would like to be on their own schedule entering and leaving the Disneyland parks because it is so close for walking. This was our second stay and they had a new rooftop lounge called. It was family friendly and even piped in the fireworks and nighttime celebrations sound from Disneyland as we watched them! Service was great- room was clean and simple but with both a fridge and microwave. Breakfast is included.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a family gathering at Disney and stayed at Grand Legacy for a week! We had a wonderful experience! The pool starts out very shallow for the non swimmers and gets relatively deep. It is also partially shaded. Breakfast was served in the pool house each morning. The food was slightly varied each day.   The staff was friendly and helpful. They directed us on the best places to eat, rent a wheelchair and buy tickets for Disney and other adventures.   The rooms were spacious and well cleaned.   The hotel is only about 2 blocks walk from Disney. We allowed our older teens to walk back on their own from the parks when they needed a break.  Very safe well lit area.  You can even see the fireworks from the hotel! Marvelous place to stay!
Manager Response: Hello bgardner711,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We haven't brought the kids to Disneyland in at least 4 years. We picked this hotel mainly because it sounded like it was right across from Disney and the reviews were very good. Hotel was very nice and the price was right. We requested to be in new building upfront since I was told it was brand new. They said they didn't have a room in this wing. We stayed in a type of room that we booked and it was very nice. We stayed in a room on 4th floor in the very back building. When fireworks came on, we had a very nice view right outside from balcony. On our second day, however, I found out from an employee (i don't know why they didn't twll me when I checked in) that hotel had a brand new restaurant and bar on the roof of new building. SHe said it was for hotel guests only. We went up
Manager Response: Hello tanyagainor,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for the excellent ratings and we hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: The 5ifth @ Grand Legacy Hotel at the Park
Summary: We had the opportunity to spend an evening @ The 5ifth Rooftop lounge with family & friends. This is the only rooftop lounge & bar facing Disneyland & California Adventure Park. The view is fantastic the drinks and food menu great & the staff fantastic!  The owners have done a wonderful job creating a warm and friendly atmosphere.  The live music on this Saturday night was lively and fun. Stay for the fireworks for Disneyland they are definitely worth waiting for. Highly recommended a visit to The 5ifth. A night enjoyed by all!
Manager Response: Hello buddiespac13,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Best location while staying in Anaheim
Summary: We stayed in the newly remodeled rooms during our visit to Disneyland. We loved the property. Very clwan and modern rooms, minutes walk to the Park and very comfy beds. Already planning our next stay, highly recommend if planning a visit  to Anaheim. Pool is super kid friendly as well.
Manager Response: Hello Cleverly C,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: From the rooms to the staff the Grand Legacy at the Park has always been our favorite off resort Hotel to stay at.I mean it is literally 3 minute walk from the main gates at Disneyland... right across the street. There has always been great service and the rooms have always been on point with comfortable beds, cleanliness and seriously awesome pillows... but lately since the remodel and additions to the hotel the grand Legacy has taken their accommodations to another level. There is now a hot service breakfast and a rooftop lounge called The 5ith! It is breathtaking and the views all day long are magical but the best part... the night time views of the Disneyland Fireworks. There is not a better view in Anaheim and we are so glad we have our little gem to stay at when we need a
Manager Response: Hello Penny G,  Thank you for your review and for staying at our hotel. We are happy and ecstatic to know that you enjoyed our clean and comfortable beds and that you taught our remodel has taken our accommodations to another level. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: New Wing Recently Opened with the ONLY Rooftop Bar/Lounge = Perfect Spot!
Summary: I stayed at the hotel a few months back in one of the king size corner rooms that was newly renovated in the back wing of the property, while the new building was under construction. The room was perfect and I have NO noise complaints. The bed was comfortable and my bathroom and room alone were quite large for not being a suite! I took advantage of the complimentary breakfast at that time, though I heard it just changed to a new breakfast room in the new building with new breakfast options.  I am a Disneyland annual passholder and they offer really good discounts to APs! So keep that in mind if you want a staycation.  They just opened the first ever and only rooftop lounge and bar called THE FIFTH that looks out to the Disney resort. I have been lucky enough to check out the
Manager Response: Hello Amy M,  Thank you very much for your comments. We are very happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. It is a pleasure to serve our wonderful guests and we are happy to have had you. I am excited to here that you and your family enjoyed The Fifth, Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge and one of our brand new rooms. We hope that you will come back to visit us again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We chose this location because it was right outside the park.  We knew they were remodeling.  The check in was friendly and quick.  The free breakfast was continental breakfast by the pool.  It looked good but we skipped it for IHOP.  We walked the 5 minutes every morning to the park and right through the front gates.  Hotel was clean and well kept, needed updating though.  I'd stay here again.
Manager Response: Hello Caryl R,  On behalf of our entire staff we would like to thank you for your kind words and excellent ratings. We hope to see you again when you travel back to the area.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Overnight stay in a Cracker Jack box...
Summary: 200$ for one night this place is a joke it was as big as a box two full size beds crammed into a whole in the wall. Bathroom small I thought this was remodeled and supposed to be a suite?????? I wish I could have gotten my money back... Motel six would have been a better stay than this place....
Manager Response: Hello Dawn B,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn‚Äôt find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again in our brand new rooms and suites in our new tower we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Distance to park make up for everything.
Summary: As a Disney annual pass holder I try to make as many trips as I can on a budget..Meaning good weekend pricing no matter what hotel it is.I loved that this hotel was, if not Almost, right across the street from Disney and next to tony Roma's and Denny's.  Luckily I found parking in what seemed to be a nearly full lot, but if no parking is available they offer free valet. Our room was on the first floor and noise was average. I can slightly hear neighbors, but mostly the people walking outside especially since our room was next to the stair case.  Beds were very comfortable, out room was very large but the bathroom toilet was low to the ground. Also the shower stall and water focet on the sink were very weak. As soon as I walked in the room I get the smell of old and it was very
Manager Response: Hello sarah5109,  Thank you for your feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This hotel was perfectly placed to visit Disneyland. It was clean and well equipped and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. However, we had a groundfloor room and it was quite noisy, particularly early in the mornings around dawn. And with lots of families and kids there for their Disney adventure, activity started early. But overall, it was a good choice and we were very happy.
Manager Response: Hello AdamandJulieCole,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay in one of our clean well equipped room. I do apologize for any noise issues from other guests. We do our best to prevent any disturbances and I am glad to know that our staff was very friendly and helpful. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Not luxurious, but a fantastic location and value, right across from Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at a slightly more expensive bigger brand hotel also at the park entrance last year. This year gave Grand Legacy a chance and glad we did. We stayed in an upgraded King so the room was larger than their standard, had a couch, microwave and fridge. Our 4 year old loved the pool and its additional water features. Breakfast was perfectly sufficient to grab a bite before heading to the park. Staff was nice, courteous, and accommodating for the little bit we requested. Parking was better than the bigger hotel we stayed at down the street last year. Checked out the rooftop lounge and the views looked awesome, we just never got a chance to use it since we were at the park. Having a Dennys, iHop, and Tony Roma's next door was awesome, we ate at all three. There is a sorta
Manager Response: Hello zackm0rris,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us and that your child enjoyed our pool and water features. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Great location to the Disney parks and downtown. The room was surprisingly spacious and comfy bed. Currently doing more renovation so some parking spaces were closed and it was overflowing with cars. However, valet parking was free in this instant. Staff are friendly. Internet was terrible in our room and had to go to the lobby for decent connection. Breakfast is very ordinary in the pool area? Good thing Dennys is a couple of buildings down. Overall was a comfortable stay and look forward to how things go once they finish renkvations further.
Manager Response: Hello Phillipa_Fuller,  Thank you for your tripadvisor response. We are happy to have had you and are grateful that you took the time to provide us with feedback. I do apologize if the renovations and parking were a inconvenience to you. We are excited to inform you that our brand new breakfast room is now opened in our brand new building with new items and hot breakfast. We hope that you will allow us to serve you again in the near future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: BEST place to stay near the park!!
Summary: This place was perfect for my family!  We stayed on the 2nd floor of the new addition in a double room.  It was SO nice to put the kids in one room and my wife and I in another! 8 minute walk to Disneyland, free breakfast of cereal, fruit, toast, donuts, etc was nice. The pool is A BLAST for the kids and has a large splash pad with water cannons and more.  My kids wanted to play there all night!  The new rooftop bar is really well done and a nice place to see the fireworks from Disney. Not to mention we got a great deal!  We already have our trip planned for next year and are coming back to the Grand Legacy!
Manager Response: Hello Tyler M,  Thank you very much for your comments and excellent ratings. We are very glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us and our Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge The Fifth. It is a pleasure to serve our wonderful guests and we are happy to have had you. We are excited about our great changes and we hope to see you again soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I'm not sure if there are any great hotels across the street from the disneyland entrance.  The grand legacy was mediocre.  Fairly clean, sort of updated.  A huge complex and we were located on the third floor in a double queen room. The rooms were reasonably sized. Pool area was nice, but located in the middle of the parking lot. The hotel was very noisy with people leaving early in the morning for the park and getting back late.  Breakfast was barely adequate, packaged donuts, cold cereal and apples or bananas.  Best part of the place was the location, almost across from the entrance at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello Jennifer M,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. I do apologize for the noise issues from other guests. We do our best to prevent any disturbances. I am excited to let you know that we have now opened our brand new breakfast room that is located on the second floor in our brand new building with new items and hot breakfast. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again.   Thank you,   Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stayed at the Clarion for VidCon on Friday night and then this hotel Saturday night. WOW. What a difference! Same price, world's apart. The hotel lobby is very clean, and comfy seating for waiting guests. The room wasn't ready for an early check in but they did have one that was being cleaned. I asked kindly if there was a way to get in before check in. They said they would try. I gave them some time a dance checked back in about an hour. They accommodated my request. I didn't expect this from a smaller hotel and was super impressed. Once we got into the room it smelled great, was a good temperature and the style was modern, tailored, gorgeous.  The beds are comfy. My 12 year old daughter loved the pool area. It has a cute splash area for little ones and although she's beyond
Manager Response: Hello Teresa B,  Thank you for your review and for staying at our hotel. We are happy to hear you found your room pleasant and comfy, and that your kids enjoyed our spectacular swimming pool. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location, Nice Staff, Iffy Plumbing
Summary: We have stayed in many of the hotels near Disney, and like this one for proximity to the park and the reasonable rates. The room they gave us on arrival was a fourth floor walk up with no elevator (fine unless you have trouble with lots of stairs) with a sink that leaked (water poured out the back of the faucet and all over the counter when turned on.) They moved us to a second floor room due to the sink, and during our stay there maintenance had to be called twice for issues with both the toilet and the shower (we came back from Disney at 11:00 one night to find iffy-looking water  backing up into the shower from some unknown source. A very nice maintenance person came to fix it and while he was there, the front desk called to tell us other guests were complaining of noise
Manager Response: Hello marykh604,  We appreciate you taking the time to complete a survey regarding your recent stay with us. On behalf of our entire team members here at Grand Legacy At The Park we would like to apologize for the concerns you encountered at our hotel and for the elevator that was down due to repairs. I can assure you that these issues have been take care of and we hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This is our first time to this hotel. We booked because of my friend that told us it was great. She was right. We loved it. The room was very nice for the price. I loved the new lobby and d√©cor. Its right across from Disney and we can take a day off (thank goodness) and keep kids happy at the pool. It is very large and has a little kids water area to play on. It wasn't a waterpark or anything but it was enough to keep them interested for awhile. Anyway, nice place and we will be back
Manager Response: Hello davidbgthree,  Thank you for your great feedback, it was our pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,   Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We picked this hotel for a combination of location + prices. There were other hotels that were cheaper but for the reviews and pictures we decided to book into the Grand Legacy at the Park. After a long flight from Miami with a very late arrival, car rental and a 1AM drive from the LA Airport to the hotel (no traffic, 40 something minutes) we were really beat up already. We arrived at the hotel and ready for next day park visit.  There was one person at the front desk doing a walk-in which lasted like 20 minutes, then another guest with a parking issue and then another one with a room-key problem, so literally like 30 minutes to our turn to check in...this didn't make us any happier...the problem is that basically the people checking in didn't understand the policies and wanted
Manager Response: Hello IngridHA1973,  On behalf of our entire staff, we would like to apologize for the issues you encountered at our hotel. We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed in one of the new suites on Memorial weekend and had a blast.  The hotel staff starting with the Front Desk team were eager to help and fast.  After checking in we made it up to the new rooftop bar (The 5th), and elegant bar with 360 degree views of Disneyland and everything else. In addition to being the only rooftop bar in the area, and literally across the street from the front gate of Disneyland; you can watch the evening Disney fireworks from the rooftop bar!
Manager Response: Hello ALAN E,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and for giving us such great ratings. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and that you enjoyed our new suite. We appreciate the feedback on Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge The Fifth. We hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We just completed our 50 th wedding anniversary trip to the Disney Resort and stayed at the Grand Legacy at the Park. The Legacy's staff are amazing. We were honored with flowers, cards and gifts to celebrate our 50 th. All the new renovations have elevated the hotel from a very nice place to stay to one of the best. The new lobby is beautiful and the roof top on the fifth floor provides a clear view of the Disney Resort with access viewing of the fireworks. The breakfast room is still under construction and when finished will have more room for the breakfast time. A must return for us.
Manager Response: Hello bearfoster,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and our staff was amazing. We hope to see you again when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Good for the price, close to the Disneyland park. Parking is 15$ price, no other option to park at. The room was OK but not in the best condition, the sink was clogged. the room has a quite large fridge that made a lot of noise at the night.  But still for the price and the location is OK.
Manager Response: Hello  Arik G,  Thank you for your review. I apologize for the experience you encountered with the clogged sink and for the noisy fridge. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you soon.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Location, Perfect for Families with Small Children
Summary: My wife and I wanted a hotel that was close to Disneyland so that we could easily walk to and from Disneyland.  We chose this hotel based on my best friend's recommendation so I already had the heads up on what to expect.  For the price that we paid, I have no complaints.  Parking was $5 / day and I had little trouble finding a spot each time I left and came back.  There was also free breakfast in the morning.  Nothing fancy, but it did the job to get you going in the morning until your next destination.  The kids loved the pool.  We went in April so the water was cold so we didn't spend that much time in the water.  The room had a small mini fridge which we used and the wifi signal was very good.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Overall, I was happy with our choice of
Manager Response: Hello SLMK14,  Thank you very much for your comments. We are glad to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. It is a pleasure to serve our wonderful guests and we are happy to have had you. I am excited to let you know that Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge The Fifth is now opened to our guests. We look forward on seeing you again in the near future.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed in a two queen premier room at the back of the property on the fourth floor.  Here are the highlights:  The room was very clean and housekeeping did a splendid job each day. The beds were comfy with four pillows each. There were six easily accessible outlets for recharging electronics. There were two sinks located outside of the bath and toilet area--very convenient. The refrigerator was a nice size and kept our sodas cold. The pool was fantastic, not to mention the poolside bar in the afternoon. I use a fan for white noise at night and appreciated that there was a constant fan option on the a/c. The location is just a five minute walk to Disney.  You also can watch fireworks from the balcony or the fifth floor rooftop lounge. There is a tony Roma's, Denny's and IHOP
Manager Response: Hello PAnn4,  Thank you for your review and for your excellent ratings. We are happy to hear that you had a great stay with us and that you enjoyed our premier room. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: The hotel has been recently updated. For being a 2.5 star hotel it was good. Staff was very professional and kind. Our only complaints are the shower head was just terrible. It had maybe 5 streams of weak pressured water, and although it had other settings, they were massage settings that were a little awkward for washing your face and such. And the air conditioning unit did not have an automatic shut off. You either have to have it on the whole time or off. As with all main gate Disneyland hotels, the parking is limited. Quick walk across the street to the park. The elevators came in handy, as did the mini fridge that had a small freezer compartment and microwave.
Manager Response: Hello meljaydlc,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you had a good stay with us. I do apologize for the inconvenience with the shower head. We thank you for staying with us, and hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Modern, updated, and newly branded Grand Legacy At The Park
Summary: I just stayed at the newly renovated and branded Grand Legacy At The Park for a quick trip to OC.  I stayed here many years ago for my nieces graduation and although the property was great back then, I could not believe the difference!  Fresh, modern, and stunning decor was a wonderful surprise.  A new main building for check in that has a rooftop bar offers unparalleled views of Disneyland and the nightly firework show.  Customer service is also fantastic, which these days is incredibly hard to come by.  The only thing to be mindful of is that parking can be tight, but considering the proximity to Disneyland and the amenities offered onsite, there is no reason to stay anywhere else while visiting Orange County.
Manager Response: Hello geecee67,  Thank you so much for your kind words and great ratings. We work very hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we hope to see you again soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This hotel is located a very short walk from the entrance to Disney.  By avoiding the downtown disney traffic I would guess it is actually a quicker walk than the "on-site" disney hotels.  The hotel has the old time charm of when you went to Disney as a child but was recently renovated and met all of our needs.  The breakfast is basic but gets the job done for a quick bite before hitting the parks.  I didn't get to enjoy the new lounge/bar area, but did go to the rooftop to check it out.  It looks amazing and especially think it would be great after dark with a view of Disney lit up.
Manager Response: Hello ledbetter3235,  Thank you for your review and excellent ratings. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Very good option near Disneyland Resort
Summary: The hotel is very well located near Disneyland Resort, smal markets and food options. The staff was gentle and nicely had received packages for me without charges. Ramada Maingate is now called Grand Legacy. I stayed in a building without elevator and it can be a problem if you have some medical issues or a lots of luggage. There were a tiny space for breakfast but I guess this will be fixed soon (the hotel was under renovation).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wow! I have stayed at the hotel over the years for their proximity to the park, and their current renovation makes parking a little tight, but the suite we stayed in was seriously amazing and more than made up for it. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. Reminded me of some of the boutique hotels I have stayed at in New York and D.C. The best part was the rooftop bar! GREAT ADDITION! Incredible view into both parks and the perfect seats for fireworks! You can even see Angel's Stadium from there. Gotta love food, drinks, amazing sunsets, fireworks, and a short elevator ride "home".
Manager Response: Hello CCEverything,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: i got exactly what i wanted, a cheap place to stay in the vallex.  it was fine, clean, nice staff, big room and a bed.  parking was tough, it was a very narrow parking lot.  the toilet paper was in a strange place, not very close to the toilet
Manager Response: Hello sgtwrench,  We do appreciate your feedback and look forward to be of service again in the near future. Thank you for choosing Grand Legacy At The Park.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed here purely for its proximity to the Disneyland Park entrance. Having experienced Disney a few years ago, we this time wanted a location closer to the park entry that we could walk to and avoid having to wait for the bus service to take us back to the room for a break. Which eats into the time away from Disney for your expensive day ticket. For families with children, I highly recommend. Go in the morning for a few hours. Return to your hotel for lunch and have an afternoon swim/sleep and return again at night. This hotel certainly was handy in that respect. This property had onsite parking at a small daily charge and a great pool area with spa and water guns for kids. We also had a basic breakfast buffet offering as part of our room charge, so was helpful on the
Manager Response: Hello Maria T,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park. We apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you would give us another opportunity to better serve you.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Stay for the location not the room
Summary: The best feature was the easy walk to Disneyland and friendly reception staff. The room was dated, wifi was slow and the breakfast was not worth the effort. Natural light was poor. Breakfast is very basic - toast, donuts, cereal and juice. We ended up going to Wendy's for the second day. Stay here if you are on a budget. There are many other options nearby but they will probably cost more.
Manager Response: Hello Angiopteris,  We appreciate the feedback and will use it to fine tune our operations in the hope that upon your next visit, we can meet or exceed your expectations.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect location and a new rooftop bar
Summary: Stayed at the Grand Legacy for a recent trip to Disney. Perfect location just across the road from the theme parks so no need for the shuttle bus. Means you can pop back to the room from Disney during the day for a much-needed rest. Rooms are clean, comfortable and a good size. The huge added bonus is the new open-air rooftop bar. 5th floor with amazing views across the city but best of all, perfect spot to see the Disney fireworks show at night. Breakfast area could do with a little more room. Other than that, perfect spot to visit Disney with the best views in the city. Well done - really enhanced our stay.
Manager Response: Hello Marksgreen,  Thank you for the excellent ratings. We are happy to hear you found your room clean and comfortable. Our new breakfast room will be opening by the end of this month with new choices in our complimentary continental breakfast. Nothing is more important to us than our relationship with our guests. Again, we thank you for your review and we cannot wait for your next stay.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Grand Legacy for two nights, during our first family trip to Disneyland. Starting with the positives: Location for Disney was great, just across the street. Beds were comfy, although a bit on the small side, and the hotel was very clean. The pool was very nice and the reception staff were very friendly and welcoming.  Now the not so good: Breakfast was awful, sour milk, warm juice and very little choice. We paid to eat at a diner on our last day as we couldn't face it a third time. The fridge in our room made a ticking sound the whole time and despite asking for someone to investigate, this was never addressed. Our room was also next to a maintenance area and there was banging and drilling as early as 7:30am, to be fair this ceased as soon as I asked the man to
Manager Response: Hello Natalie P,  Thank you for your tripadvisor review. We apologize for the issues you experienced with our complimentary continental breakfast. We have notified our maintenance engineer regarding that ticking refrigerator. Our goal is to meet the needs of every guest that stays with us, and we have taken your comments into consideration. We are glad you were satisfied with our comfy beds, pool and location, and hope that as we continue to improve our services, that you will allow us the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Pro: This hotel has a great location, 10 minute or less walk to the entry gates of Disneyland!   Cons:   We had no hot water. We called the front desk twice about the issue. They sent a maintenance worker out both times however the only resolution we got was "tricks" to try and get it to work. Such as... Leave it on cold for a couple minutes then try to move it to make it warm.   Breakfast was hardly worth stopping for, very little to offer- donuts, bagels, oatmeal.  The pool was pretty dirty- a lot of bug floating in the water and didn't feel heated at all.  Overall- The location was great but not being able to come take a warm shower after a long day in the park left a bad impression on me. Personally I expect to have warm water in a hotel... The other cons wouldn't have been
Manager Response: Hello Ashs2Embers,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize for the issues you encountered with the water. We will be upgrading our complimentary continental breakfast by the end of this month as well as opening our brand new breakfast room. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family. You may now enjoy Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge The Fifth.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights. Very basic. Staff not attentive. Anytime we asked for something we had to ask 3 times before it was done (got to the point where we actually knew it would take 3 times before anything happened)  Rooms very basic, took most of the day for room to be serviced (after 4pm one day)  Pool was over chlorinated.  Breakfast wasn't great but it was breakfast. However great location - only a 10 minute stroll to Disneyland
Manager Response: Hello Jeremy W,  Thank you for your comments. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified regarding the issues you encountered. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and these mishaps has been taken into consideration. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Place close to the park
Summary: We stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland. The primary purpose to stay was for the proximity to the park. Easy walk to the entrance. It is so convenient and the price is reasonable.   We have stayed at different locations along this strip over the past several years and found this place to be just fine. The pool was way above and beyond the other places we have stayed. I wish we had more time there but we maximize the time in the park so not much energy left for swimming.  The room was standard size, fridge worked well, microwave, etc.  Yes, the elevator was a long way from our room but it didn't bother us.   The staff were very friendly.  Also, the fan was pretty loud and the room was stuffy unless we kept it on all the time.   For me, these are small things. I appreciate
Manager Response: Hello SCagray,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to hear that our pool was way above the other places you have stayed at. It was a pleasure to be of service and we look forward to future visits.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We loved everything about it! We stayed earlier this month and spent a few extra dollars to be in the new tower up front. It was well worth it! The rooms was brand new and beautiful! We had an amzing view of the fireworks every night! We will be back again soon, SM
Manager Response: Hello stacymontaz,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This was our first time staying at this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised. The lobby is warm and inviting and the front desk staff were phenomenal. They asked if we were celebrating any event during our stay and we told them the trip was for our daughter's birthday so they surprised her with a doll and chalkboard with a "Happy Birthday" sign on her bed!! Her eyes light up and she was very excited. Beyond that the room was spacious and clean, the pool was relaxing and the parking was a breeze! We would stay again and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Disneyland!
Manager Response: Hello Linda V,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We work very hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. We appreciate you highly recommending our hotel to all of your friends and family.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, super close to Disneyland!
Summary: We recently stayed here on our family trip to Disneyland. We wanted to stay close to Disney without paying Disney Resort prices and this was a great pick. It was an easy 7-8 minute walk from the hotel to the entrance to the park. The hotel was clean and comfy. The rooms were very large, two comfy queen size beds. It was all recently remodeled. Large closet and bathroom. Great for a family.  Refrigerator and microwave in our room. Huge outdoor pool, and whirlpool,  great to splash around in when you are taking a break from Disney. Continental breakfast each morning, not great offerings but coffee, juice, donuts, cereal, toast. Could use some hot options, but got us enough to get out the door. Good wi-fi access, easy to use, no slow downs or losses in our room or at the pool.
Manager Response: Hello babytygger,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location, nice clean hotel and good service
Summary: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Grand Legacy.  It is right across the street from  Disneyland so its  location is perfect.  Lots of restaurants within walking distance.  The hotel was still undergoing renovations so the breakfast area was temporary and the food was nothing great - bagels, toast, cereal but free food is free food and I was grateful that it saved us money from  having to eat out. Our room was obviously one of the ones that missed the upgrade.  I never complain about rooms unless they are filthy or falling apart, having said that,  if you get one of these rooms be aware that one of the double beds will be right against the window which was odd but also neat because we could watch the fireworks from our bed!  The bathroom, I'm sorry, was just ridiculous.
Manager Response: Hello mamarama65,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy to hear that all in all you had a great vacation. We hope to see you soon so that you may enjoy our brand new breakfast room that will be opening up next week, and our rooftop bar and lounge The Fifth.  Thank you,   Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: If you are tired from walking around Disney and you just need a place to sleep, this is okay. Just a block away from the main entrance of Disney.  Disappointed with the breakfast area, it was by the pool, I think that was the kitchen area of the pool. There were no available tables or chairs to sit in, so we have to walk back to our room with all our food, walking in the middle of the parking lot. Not sure if they were renovating the breakfast area or what? If they even have one. I have no idea... The room is ok, the parking is ok. Not my kind of place, I thought it's a hotel, coz it looks so nice in the picture, I was disappointed when I arrived. It's an "Inn". Will not go back.
Manager Response: Hello acm947,  Thank you for your feedback. I apologize that we serve our complimentary breakfast at the pool. We will be opening our brand new breakfast room next week. We sure hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again so that you may enjoy not just our new breakfast room but our rooftop bar and lounge The Fifth, Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: This hotel is perfectly located for a visit to Disneyland. It is literally across the street, an easy walk to the entrance. Our room was located near the front of the property which made the walk even shorter. The room had a refrigerator, complete with a small freezer section, a microwave, and the usual coffee maker. The hotel has a great pool and a breakfast area located in the pool area but we didn't make use of either. There is a Denny's restaurant practically next door and since they offer an AARP discount that's where we chose to have our meals. Tony Roma's restaurant IS located next door which is also a good option. We were not bothered by noise and since we spent most of our days at the parks we hardly noticed the construction. We are planning to return in December and
Manager Response: Hello Kate6506,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and providing excellent ratings. We are delighted to know that your stay was great and hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Nothing to see Here.. nothing to see!
Summary: Wholly molly where do we start! Okay.. maybe with the staff.. PLEASE SMILE.. please make your guests feel welcome! we were really tired after a long flight from Australia but were so excited to begin our holiday .. we walked in happy and couldn't get out of there fast enough. As we arrived earlier than our room was available they were kind enough to mind our bags for us. We returned at 3.00 to have a sleep but our room wasn't available until 3.30 so we rested in the foyer for awhile. When we got our room key we headed up to there. We had to carry our bags up the stairs (we didn't realise until the last day that they had a lift - I wish they had of let us know as it was hard to carry things up the flights of stairs) The room was a bit dated and the floors quite dirty (stained)
Manager Response: Hello Crawfs09,  Thank you for your comments with TripAdvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience with our team members. I can assure you that the Director of Front Office has been notified. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We've stayed here in the past when we couldnt get into the Disneyland Hotel because the location is close. But it was a Ramada and reasonably  priced. Rooms use to cost about 130.00 this time we paid 220.00 for the same room. The rug was so dirty it turned our feet black, there was no cell service, and after speaking with 4 people about needing a ground floor, where we would told no problem, they still tried to put us in on the 3rd floor. The air conditioner was set at 67 the whole time we were there, and it was very noisy, yet when we got back to our room at 10:00 at night it was cooler outside than in the room. When you pay a reasonable price its okay to deal with little things, but not when you pay over 200.00. Sadly we wont be staying here anymore.
Manager Response: Hello SDFlipFlops,  Thank you for your comments with tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear that you had a very unfortunate experience. I can assure you that the department manager has been notified. Our staff works very hard to keep up with our facilities and these mishaps have been taken into consideration. Our goal every day is to please every guest that comes to stay, and we regret that we were not able to do so for you. We are committed to improving not only ourselves, but the guest experience overall. We desire to have the opportunity to accommodate you in the future so that you may see these changes first hand.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Plus for families, not for couples
Summary: Nothing near Disneyland screams "couples getaway", so at least we knew what to expect.    Pros:. On Harbour Blvd, about 10 min walk to Disneyland entrance.  There is continental bkfst if you just want something in tummy.  Beds extremely comfortable and pillows were firm or soft. Nice staff and clean rooms. Pool looked nice but didn't have time to use.  Cons: Bkfst selection hard boiled eggs, cereal, donuts, toast, fruit.  Housekeeping staff waking us up at 8:30 to see if we were out of our room.  We were concerned about not finding a parking spot if were to drive anywhere, so we left the car and just walked.  Could hear kids in room next door when they woke up.   Would recommend and would stay here again with the kids. It meets basic needs.
Manager Response: Hello Tammy P,  Thank you for providing feedback with your rating. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay. We do our best to prevent any disturbances and I apologize that we did not in this case. Thank you for being our guest, we hope to see you again.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Walking distance to main Disneyland entrance!
Summary: Ideally located diagonally from the Disneyland main gate entrance. Although the hotel is going through construction, our stay was pretty comfortable. The room was very spacious, which had plenty of space for a "free" roll away bed. Room also included free internet and $5.00 overnight parking. However, parking rates are going to increase in June or sooner. So, I would call to confirm.   The free continental breakfast consisted of  coffee, juice, toast, cereal, donuts, biscuits and gravy, and fruit. I would recommend that they change up the breakfast and add bagels etc. for variety. The hotel uses the older A/C units on the exterior wall, which can get cold and become noisy.   We only paid $125 per night, with tax, which I thought was a great rate due to the close proximity to the
Manager Response: Hello fun4kids3,  Thank you for taking the time to leave a comment with your response. I am very sorry to hear about the inconvenience of the noisy A/C. We have taken your comment into consideration and will use it to better our complimentary breakfast and services. Our hope is that as we continue to improve, an opportunity will arise for us to accommodate you again.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I'll start off by saying it's an amazing place to stay just for how close it is to Disneyland. Easy walk to the park and there are plenty of restaurants close by. I know they are renovating right now, but we stayed in what I assume are the older rooms. The biggest complaint I had were with how thin the walls were. It's a hotel close to Disneyland so chances are you'll have kids next door. Do not stay if you plan on sleeping in, since at about 7 am every morning we were woken up by children screaming. The beds were pretty hard as well. The valet parking was nice since we didn't need the car while we were there but it would be nice if they had more self parking available. The staff was really friendly as well. Overall we may stay here again, still kind of on the fence. If the
Manager Response: Hello MNCleman,  Thank you for your feedback. We are happy to know that you will give us another opportunity to stay with us. I do apologize for the inconvenience you encountered while staying with us. We hope that we will have the privilege of accommodating you again in the future.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: I booked this hotel because of the very recent re-branding and renovations. Sorry to say it wasn't. Everything in the room was worn and dirty. The staff was very nice though, great costumer service. But a clean room is very important to me and there are tons of hotels in this area of walking distance to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Hello missy_fufu,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I apologize that you didn‚Äôt find our room to be acceptable. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidence by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would like the opportunity for you to stay in one of our new rooms or suites and also enjoy our complimentary breakfast in our brand new breakfast room that will be opening up next week. Or even better, enjoy a drink and lite bites at Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge The Fifth.    Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: My wife and I had an opportunity to take a short vacation. Part of this whirlwind trip was a 2 night trip to Anaheim. We stayed here and was fairly pleased. Disneyland is right across the street a 5 min walk to the entrance. Nice pool,hot tub,plenty of ice machines. Breakfast was useful, and with the normal fare, but if you need meat...nope. after getting your plate, you would go out next to the pool to eat. Staff was friendly. 2 double beds in our room. Microwave and refrigerator. Can see and hear the fireworks from the room. Easy freeway access. Would stay there again.
Manager Response: Hello Gyro1954,  Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service and a clean and comfortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Beautiful new room! View was awesome!
Summary: We have stayed many times in the past when they were Ramada. Back then it was a good value, nothing spectacular, but clean, nice pool for kids, free breakfast (which is only fair), and mostly friendly employes. Since we have been here last (about 1 year ago), the changes are amazing! They were under construction last time. It wasn't a real problem. Now they are finished with reconstruction. We upgraded to a new suite in new building. When we upgraded, we paid more than expected, but once we entered room, it was well worth it! Actually, we stayed at Grand Californian a couple years back and their rooms have nothing on these and at half the price. We had a nice view of Disneyland (well, mostly California Adventure) but it was amazing. I am told that ownership has not changed and
Manager Response: Hello Mirandaw1976,  Thank you so much for your kind words and excellent ratings. We work very hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. We hope to see you soon so that you may come and enjoy The Fifth, Anaheim's only rooftop bar and lounge.   Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary: We selected this hotel for our stay because of the location and price.  This hotel is located just a few minutes from the park's entrance. It took us less than 10 minutes from our room to the security check at Disneyland (with an 8 year old walking and a baby in a stroller). However, please note that the rooms are not at the front of the hotel, unless you book one of the new rooms. We stayed in room 160 right across from the pool. We booked a standard double room. It was small, but it worked for me, my husband, our 8 year old and our 15 month old.   The breakfast was bad! Boiled eggs, cereal, store bought donuts, bananas, oranges, toast and bagels (that was all!). The toasters they have do not work. One of the toast came out burnt and the other one only one side was toasted. On
Manager Response: Hello Elizabeth M,  Thank you for taking the time to review Grand Legacy At The Park, we apologize for the issues you encountered with our complimentary continental breakfast. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you and I sure hope that you will give us another opportunity so that you may see our new breakfast room and new items will be serving.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager

Summary Heading: Celebrating five May Birthdays at Disneyland
Summary: We will come back to this hotel for sure. Very clean,employees were very nice and helpful. Excellent location right across the street from Disneyland. We had a view of the fireworks from our room. The pool and hot tub were very clean and the breakfast was good.
Manager Response: Hello blanca1965,  Thank you so much for your kind words and for giving us excellent ratings. We are delighted to know that your stay was great. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. We hope to see you when you come back to the Disneyland Resort.  Thank you,  Carlos Padilla Asst. General Manager
